Title: DTI 6304 - T6 Laser Musical Instrument
Desc:
Problem statement:
Choosing one artifact from the Ingenium collection, each multidisciplinary team studies the artifact present, past and images its future. Transposing the artifact forward in time and space applying sustainability considerations (using UNSDG) and notions seen in class, students redesign the artifact to suit their chosen environment. Each team presents a prototype of the reimagined artifact in the medium of their choice.

Our solution:

The Laser Clock was inspired by the laser harp on display at the Science and Technology Museum. The Laser Clock improves upon traditional instruments by extending the lifespan and combining several musical instruments. The Laser Clock also improves accessibility, as the 'clock notation' allows people to play the instrument regardless of their ability to read sheet music.

Title: X-sensor1
Desc: Le projet X-sensor tient directement son nom du projet de conception dont il s'agit. En effet, nous avions eu la charge de concevoir pour ...un boitier contenant des capteurs (sensors) qui evalueront la temperature, l'humidite et la qualite de l'air dans un centre de recherche de donnees. Le boitier sera alors a l'interieur, au niveau des racks de serveurs et il sera capable d'envoyer des notifications sur une plateforme web et une application qui y est liee pour avertir le client de toute augmentation ou diminution de l'un des facteurs prealablement enumeres au dela du seuil normal pour un lanboratoire.

Title: Toe Beans
Desc: Ce projet consiste en une boite dotée de capteurs visant à assurer le controle de l'environnment dans un centre de données. Ces capteurs mesurent la température, l'humidité, la pression et les gaz présent dans l'air. Le but pour les clients de ce projet est de pouvoir obtenir les données par l'entremise d'une application pour s'assurer de la qualité de l'équipement sur place. Les données permettent de visualiser ce qui ce passe en temps réel et ajuster l'environnement du centre de données au besoin.

Title: Les "éclairs de génies"
Desc: Notre équipe a crée un dispositif qui mesure la qualité de l'air ( CO2, l'alcool, méthane...) , la température et l'humidité. Les données collectées seront transférées dans une application qui notifie l'utilisateur lors de changements brusques.

Title: Les Innovateurs
Desc: Notre projet consiste en la création d’un système de capteurs contenu dans une seule boite lui permettant de surveiller l’environnement au sein des centres de données dont les données récoltées seront transmises en temps réel via une application mobile ou web.

Title: Groupe FC 22- Les Kations
Desc:
Dans ce projet,Il est question d’une difficulté de communication entre la compagnie de Logement Communautaire d'Ottawa (LCO) et ses locataires. En effet, la compagnie communique avec ses locataires par l’impression et la distribution de dépliants en papier. Pour une compagnie avec des dizaines de milliers de locataires, cette technique s’avère très coûteuse en plus d’être néfaste pour l’environnement.  La compagnie a donc besoin d’une solution rapide et efficace pour être capable de communiquer avec ses membres rapidement et avec aise.
Ainsi, nous avons  cree notre application appelee HOUSING CHAT qui repond aux criteres enonces precedemment. C'est une application sure et facile a utiliser. 
Nous vous invitons a venir voir notre stand.

Title: GNG1103 - F31 - Troubleshooters
Desc:
Autonomous weapons raise several moral and ethical concerns that decision makers need to be made aware of. It is important for decision makers to start negotiations on these weapon systems before they are available for use. However, politicians and diplomats still see this issue as theoretical, and they don’t see how such a revolution in warfare would have a major impact on many individuals.

Our task was to design a virtual reality experience that shows the ethical and moral issues that autonomous weapons raise. We had to take this problem from the abstract side and make it into reality for decision makers.

Title: Jam Jam, Green House class C
GNG-1103-F21-Stop Killer Robots VR Experience
Desc:
Note: The Bill of Materials in the earlier deliverables is outdated. Please refer to the complete bill in the User/Product Manual.

Problem Statement: Create a VR experience on behalf of Mines Action Canada and wider the Stop Killer Robots campaign to highlight the ethical concerns surrounding autonomous weapons and to bring the issue from being seen as theoretical to being realistic and presently relevant for decision-makers.

Solution: We are creating a VR experience using the Unity engine and the Steam VR plugin. This experience shows that autonomous weapons should not be used by emphasizing that autonomous weapons see people in terms of code instructions and data, and are therefore both more prone to discrimination and cannot see clearly through the fog of war. There is a secondary focus on emphasizing that such weapons are not only possible to build, but already close to battlefield-ready in our modern day and age; this is to show that the issue is urgent and not to be ignored.

Cost: The project will cost between $50 and $150 in 3D Assets, with the range existing in order to span a wide array of asset quality. Higher-quality assets will cost significantly more money than lower-quality assets, though based on the target quality of your simulation, higher quality assets may not be needed for everything (i.e. background environment in the distance can be lower quality without impacting the experience significantly, but any objects and environments the user interacts with must be higher quality, hence the $50 budget floor).

Concerns during production: This project may be time intensive for anyone attempting to replicate it. Cooperation may be tedious (or cost money due to the nature of Unity's Plastic version control system) in larger groups.

Title: GNG 2501 - FB3.1 - Héroïne du Faso
Desc:
L’association veut disposer d’une application mobile fonctionnant sur Android ou iOS afin de promouvoir la Santé Sexuelle et Reproductive adaptée aux Adolescents et aux Jeunes (SSRAJ).  

Elle permettra aux jeunes filles ou femmes d’avoir un cadre d’échange privé ou public. Elles discuteront de manière anonyme ou pas entre elles et aussi avec des experts du domaine de la santé. L'application sera également une vitrine de dénonciation des violences basées sur le genre. Ces discussions se présenteront sur plusieurs formats : texte, voix ou vidéo. 
La tâche consiste à concevoir cette application avec deux espaces :  

  • Un espace public : Il donne un aperçu sur les différentes rubriques de l’application. Il est possible d’identifier les centres de santé les plus proches, d’être informés des évènements en lien avec la santé sexuelle et reproductive (campagne de dépistage, consultations gratuites, atelier…). Il dispose également d'un moteur de gestion du cycle menstruel qui permettra à chaque femme ou fille de mieux suivre son cycle et d’éviter ainsi les grossesses non désirées. 
  • Un espace privé : Chaque acteur du système dispose d’un espace privé spécifique. Les acteurs de la santé n’auront pas les mêmes fonctionnalités que les utilisateurs clients. Il faut avoir un compte utilisateur pour y accéder. Les utilisateurs clients pourront ainsi participer aux discussions ou créer des échanges avec les autres acteurs du système comme des agents de santé. L’administrateur système aura ainsi des statistiques sur toutes les données de l’application. Cet espace permet de réaliser le travail de vérification des informations soumises par les tiers, mais aussi de veiller à l’anonymat des personnes qui les soumettent. Il permet également d’alimenter certaines rubriques comme le blog, les évènements (conférences, formations …). 
L’application doit aussi être en français, il doit être facile à naviguer et d’utiliser l’application, car certains des utilisateurs ont des difficultés à lire et écrire.

Liens vers le repertoire github : https://github.com/Application-mobile-Heroine-du-Faso-FB31/Application-Heroine-du-faso

Title: GNG1103-GroupeC6-Dusters
Desc: A malt and level sensor system is a device used to measure and monitor the level of malt in a brewing vessel or storage tank. This system typically consists of sensors that are installed at various points in the tank or vessel, which provide real-time data on the amount of malt present. The data collected by the system is transmitted to a control unit, which can be used to adjust the brewing process or to trigger alarms in the event of any anomalies. This type of sensor system is crucial in ensuring the consistency and quality of the brewing process, and can help brewers optimize their operations for maximum efficiency.

Title: GNG1103-C8
Desc: We were presented with the task of creating a software for the Mill St. Brewery Company in order to optimize the conveyors for their production line. The proposed design consists of an app that is able to take input data from files and is able to analyze this data, and then create recommendations for the user operating the system.

Title: GNG1103-C7-Convey
Desc: Mill Street Brewery needs a programmed interface that allows the user to impute system and conveyor speeds, resulting in the identification of various regions where the process isn’t running optimally. The product should be usable offline, set production line speeds according to V-curve theory, and result in an overall efficiency increase of at least 2%. In addition, the product will display flexibility by allowing the user to switch between different types of brewery lines (can, bottle, and keg).

Title: GNG1103-C7-Group C7
Desc: Mill Street Brewery needs a programmed interface that allows the user to impute system and conveyor speeds, resulting in the identification of various regions where the process isn’t running optimally. Title: GNG1103-C10-2A.D.R.H
Desc: The client needs a dust level sensor to detect the amount of dust within their malt silos to prevent the dust clogging the system. This design uses an  photoresistor to detect the amount of reflected light. Then an ultrasonic sensor is used to measure the distance from the photoresistor to the top of the casing. This measurement is used to calculate the volume of malt in the silo. These sensors are attached to a belt so when a motor spins, the sensors move up and down the silo until the level of the malt is detected.

Title: GNG1503- les Gee-Geenius
Desc: Concevoir pour le SPC, un capteur de température, d’humidité ou toute autre variable importante qui permet de protéger le centre de données en transférant les données collectées et en envoyant des alertes aux utilisateurs de l’application pour les avertir de tous changements considérables pouvant affecter le bon fonctionnement de leur centre de données. Le projet doit coûter maximum 400$. On a donc fait un boitier contenant un capteur et un arduino lier a une application qui calculera la température, l’humidité et l’altitude et transférer tout cela sur une base de données.

Title: GNG1503-FB03-Clear data

Nous avons un boitier avec des capteurs: de gaz dangereux, de poussière, de température et humidité. Nous avons un budget de 200$ et avons utilisé 124,88$ pour la conception de ce projet. Notre boitier à un couvercle en plexiglass pour ainsi avoir la possibilité de bien regarder l'intérieur de notre boitier sans devoir toujours l'ouvrir pour regarder à l'intérieur.

Title: AerobicsRUs - D1.4
Desc:
Our client has a need for a compact and light device to simulate a locking motion in his left elbow while ensuring proper support under continuous load, throughout symmetrical and static movements  

Our team used the concept of springs and storing energy to help our client complete pushups.

The budget for this project was 100$ initially and it was increased to 400$ later on in the semester.

Details to consider when trying to replicate this project would be to look into customs spring or other methods to store and convert energy to complete a push-up.

Title: GNG 2101[D] D3.2 - Wheely Good Transfer Device
Desc:
Everyday activities such as accessing a bag or backpack can be a struggle for wheelchair-bound individuals with limited upper body mobility.

The solution? A wheely good transfer device.

Our wheelchair backpack transfer device uses a mechanical solution. A steel pipe was bent to be fitted along one side and the back of the wheelchair. There is a lengthwise slit along the pipe rail, where the wheeled bag mounting component travels (similar to a curtain.) The user uses a pull cord to transfer their backpack from behind the wheelchair to the side of the wheelchair near the armrest, where it can easily be accessed. Once complete, the bag can be stowed to the back of the wheelchair once again. The Wheely Good Tranfer Devices helps to preserve independence in wheelchair users, and its mounting system is adjustable to account for different wheelchair dimensions.

It was a pleasure to work on this challenging project!

Link to On shape project: https://cad.onshape.com/documents/f4fbaf54bf64a51140e4ceca/w/5e5a8559f57383dcc6cfeab5/e/8716b3b6003a348bc8c3d2ff?renderMode=0&uiState=6426d517aba1556bc7d84396

https://youtu.be/pAOkjlCBi0o

Title: GNG1103-C15-Dust Sensor
Desc:
The project is a project that has the goal to create a working dust sensor design that pleases the needs of the client (Mills St. Brewery.) We defined the problem statement to be:
Design a dust sensing system that will detect the dust levels in malt silos that can withstand the silo conditions. The system will be able to display the current dust levels and warn the operator when the dust levels are approaching a set adjustable threshold. This will help avoid full system shutdowns in advance to keep the brewing process running efficiently. 
The solution to the problem statement was to create a device that uses a dust sensor connected to an Arduino. This device will have a case that consists of mesh, which will filter the supplements running through their system to detect the accurate dust concentration measurements. 
When creating the device may things have to be taken into account and assured to have the best functionality possible. One of the things to make sure when creating the device is to ensure that the airflow and filtering of the device is functional as build up might become an issue if the airflow is inefficient. Another thing to take into account when creating the device is that assurance of the functionality of the sensor and its measurements must be made to ensure that the correct measurements are being made to avoid a build up of dust. The device is fairly complex, but performs its job effectively. 

Arduino IDE, Inkscape, and MegunoLink were software used.

Title: GNG1103-C12-Dust_Sensor
Desc:
There exists a need for a wireless, low maintenance device capable of alerting operators when the measured dust concentration reaches a set threshold. The design must be adaptable to the existing system, and must communicate with the current user interface.

We created a device for the purpose of measuring dust concentration early in a brewing process line with the purpose of alerting the operators if there was a large enough amount of dust in the system that it could clog the line.

So, we chose to make a device that took a sample of the malt/dust mixture from the piping using a valve, then separated the two using a filter, and measured the volume of each to determine the concentration of dust.

It cost roughly  $77.68 (BOM is included in files).

Title: Vertigro Hydroponic
Desc:
With Vertigro, get ready to enjoy faster growth, higher yields, and a soil-free way to harvest fresh produce year-round!

At the heart of our project is a commitment to sustainability and community. Our primary goal is to provide an easy and efficient way for an indigenous association in Ottawa to grow crops and educate its community in the city on planting and food security.

Title: Quick-Fold: Automated T-shirt Folder
Desc: Design and manufacturing process of an automated T-shirt folding device that can be activated with an accessible button for individuals with mobility issues.

Title: Buckle-Up seat belt guide
Desc: The client is the father of a 7-year-old girl with arthrogryposis. This condition is characterized by the stiffness of joints which limits the range of motion and can make mobility difficult. The user recently had a surgery which makes reaching and grabbing the seat belt possible but buckling and unbuckling the seat belt remain a great challenge to her. The client needs a seat belt guide that assists with fastening and unfastening of the seat belt independently.

Title: The Sherpas 2.4 - Wheelchair Backpack Transfer Device
Desc: We’ve created a device to assist wheelchair users in transferring items to and from their backpack. By operating a simple crank, the user’s bag is moved along a rail from the rear of the chair to the front with ease.

Title: Rock and Stroll (GNG 2101 Group 2.3)
Desc: Parents who have mobility, stability or endurance concerns find it difficult to navigate different terrains with a stroller while being supported. An adaptive stroller is required to provide support and ease of navigation for the parent.

Title: GNG1103-F23-Virtual Reality for Ban
Desc:
Problem Statement:  
Mines Action Canada needs an informative 2-5 minute virtual reality experience that evokes emotion and conveys the user to take a position opposing the use of autonomous weapons. The experience will not put focus on any specific parties and will be directed towards those who are uncertain regarding their point of view on autonomous weapons.

Solution: 
 The VR takes place in a small community where an invasion is taking place. The streets are deserted and full of destruction. The user is a citizen of the community trying to find the local bunker after everyone has fled. Autonomous drones are filling the sky and autonomous robots are creeping around. When the user finds the bunker, they will be able to talk to survivors and how the attack affected them, even though they are only civilians. Using risk education, the user will be informed about the dangers of autonomous weapons through various infographics and through speaking with civilians. 

 
Cost: $126

Title: Virtual Reality for anti-autonomous weapons
Desc: design a virtual reality experience for Mine Action Canada, the speaks to people around the world  including politicians and UN officials, about the dangers of autonomous weapons on humans, and seeks to stop developing and spreading these types of weapons. Autonomous weapons are unmanned controlled robots that identify and select targets based on specific details encoded to them.

Title: GNG 1103-F22-Virtual Reality For A Ban
Desc:
Problem Statement:
To create an informative virtual reality experience lasting 2-5 minutes which will persuade government officials and the public about the negative consequences behind autonomous weapons by creating emotion. 

Government officials and the public need a virtual reality experience which will persuade about the negative consequences behind autonomous weapons by creating emotion through a two-to-five-minute, storytelling design. 

Mines Action Canada need a 2–5-minute virtual reality experience which will persuade government officials and the public about the negative consequences behind autonomous weapons through an informative and emotional story-telling experience.

Solution:
Working together as a group of five we have one to two weekly meetings to discuss and work on the project.

Our idea is to create a storyline within unity that shows the negative impact autonomous weapons have by giving a scene where the user experiences life where autonomous weapons are used for everyday life.

After this scene we are giving the user the ability to speak out against what they saw and experienced to powerful people within the government.

Cost:
Our budget consists of a multitude of assets that help explain the storyline. Large buildings such as the office and the hospital cost $29.99. After buying the majority of our assets we have spend a total of $73.49

Problems Encountered During the Process:

After the first few deliverables and the prototype stage started we ran into the issue where we did not know how to share and edit other peoples unity projects. Once this was resolved we ran into a few more issues.

Creating and exporting the codes into the unity project was another issue we have run into. We watched a multitude of videos trying to help us work and speed up this process.

Title: Gesteam
Desc: Groupe pour le projet de GNG1503 (La Solution de gestion immobilière)

Title: JIBMM solutions
Desc:
LCO est en train de construire de nouveaux bâtiments à haute performance ainsi que de procéder à des rénovations énergétiques profondes dans des bâtiments existants. Ces bâtiments fonctionnent différemment et la performance de l'ensemble du bâtiment bénéficie grandement du fait que chaque locataire effectue de petites actions dans ses unités ou est averti en temps réel de certains événements mécaniques ou de ventilation en cours.

LCO cherche un service de messagerie SMS ou une application mobile que nos gestionnaires immobiliers pourraient utiliser en temps réel pour communiquer instantanément avec chaque locataire qui s'inscrit dans le bâtiment. En utilisant certaines caractéristiques de chaque unité (étage, exposition sud/nord, numéro d'unité), le gestionnaire immobilier pourrait également envoyer des messages plus personnalisés. Idéalement, certains de ces messages seraient également automatisés en fonction de la température extérieure ou de l'heure de la journée. Voici quelques exemples de messages possibles, mais il faudrait qu'ils soient suffisamment personnalisables pour une situation non encore anticipée:
  • Ouvrez vos fenêtres ce soir pour laisser entrer de l'air frais et rafraîchir le bâtiment
  • Un entrepreneur travaillera sur le système de ventilation ou les 2 prochaines heures, alors attendez-vous à ce que votre ventilateur soit éteint
Il y a trois morceaux principaux de ce projet, l'algorithme et analyse de données pour la décision du contenu des messgaes, une base de donnée qui tiens les informations des locataires, de l'édifice et de la météo et le medium de communication avec les locataires. 

Comme première étape votre tâche est de concevoir l'application destinée aux locataires qui délivre la messagerie et interagit directement avec les locataires. Il devrait être capable de se connecter à une base de données et envoyer de l'information d'une manière accessible et sécuritaire. L'application devrait être bilingue et facile à utililser pour n'importe quel utilisateur de LCO.

Title: SolidWork MRI Project
Desc:
As part of a group project, we were asked to design and reproduce an MRI medical machine on SolidWork.

The project was to include 5 detachable parts that were individually produced on SolidWork. We were also asked to build a fully functional assembly from the individual parts. In addition, engineering drawings were to be produced for the individual parts and the whole assembly.

The MRI project was inspired by various other 3D MRI machine available on the internet. The measurement of the parts where based on an average human (1m80) since we did not have access to a real MRI machine for the project.

Full assembly , parts and Drawing can be provided upon request

Title: OCR 3 Accesibility App Project
Desc:
During our academic tenure, a distinctive engineering course project called upon us to apply our engineering acumen to address a real-world problem. Our challenge was unique and profound: we were to empower a visually impaired individual, enhancing his independence and ease of carrying out daily tasks, particularly during the pandemic.


Navigating the grocery store had become a hurdle for our client, whose vision impairment prevented him from discerning price tags, ingredient lists, and other product details without external assistance. Our objective was clear; we had to listen empathetically, understand our client's needs and abilities, and devise a solution that amplified his autonomy.


The key to our solution lay within the information shared by our client. He had an IOS device he used routinely, relying on Spoken Content & Audio Description, the IOS accessibility features. He was also capable of discerning neon shades and differentiating shapes.


Armed with this information, our engineering team crafted 'OCR 3', an ingenious application operating on the Microsoft Power Apps platform. This tool was not just an app; it was an embodiment of our commitment to leveraging technology to bridge accessibility gaps.


OCR 3 harnessed the power of optical character recognition, transforming images into textual content. Users could then leverage the Text-to-Speech feature, which vocalized the extracted text, or save it to the clipboard for future reference. Moreover, our app held the ability to isolate and present the price from an image, a functionality tailored for our client's shopping needs.


But the thoughtfulness in our design did not end there. Keeping our client's preferences at the forefront, we incorporated 'flashy' colours, large, easily distinguishable buttons, and a simple, user-friendly interface. In every way, OCR 3 was a testament to empathetic engineering, designed to make life a little easier for those navigating the world with visual impairment.

Title: ELG 3336 - Automated Fire Truck 2022
Desc:
As part of a university course (ELG 3336, University of Ottawa), we were asked to design and implement a mechatronics project.

For this project, we were asked to include a data acquisition system and 3 sensors.

We then purchased a robot from Amazon that we assembled and modified to our needs. 

The microcontroller used for the project is from Keyestudio with the DC control shield and sensor shield, we then added an IR sensor, a brightness sensor and an ultrasonic sensor. We also included a fan to turn off the fire when it is detected. 

We then coded the robot to perform the following tasks:

1. fire detection (using the fire sensor)
2. autonomous driving
3. Flame detection (using the IR sensor)
4. Extinguish the flame when it is detected

Title: Automated Fire Truck Project
Desc:
In the context of the course ELG 3336 at the prestigious University of Ottawa, my team and I undertook a complex and demanding mechatronics project that required an innovative blend of mechanical engineering, electronics, and computer science.


Our task was to conceptualize, design, and build a multi-functional robot. For this purpose, we sourced a customizable robot kit from Amazon, which we expertly assembled and modified according to our specifications.


To ensure effective data acquisition, we incorporated a dynamic system and three distinct sensors into our design. The sensor suite included an infrared (IR) sensor for flame detection, a brightness sensor for light intensity measurement, and an ultrasonic sensor for distance measurement and obstacle detection, providing our robot with a broad spectrum of environmental awareness.


The core of our robot's processing capabilities lay in the Keyestudio microcontroller we used. This was complemented with a DC control shield and a sensor shield to enable effective sensor data reading and motor control. To further enhance our robot's functionality and safety measures, we introduced an innovative feature - a fan that could activate and extinguish a detected fire, positioning our creation as a potential life-saving tool.


The hardware setup was only one aspect of our project. On the software side, we dove into coding the robot to perform a variety of tasks autonomously. We developed algorithms for fire detection, autonomous navigation, flame detection using the IR sensor, and automatic fire extinguishing.


This combination of hardware and software culminated in a highly capable autonomous system that could react to its environment and take decisive actions, embodying the true essence of a mechatronics project.


We maintain comprehensive documentation of our project, and upon request, we can provide a full project report detailing our journey and findings throughout this project. For those interested in the specifics of the robot's programming, we have made our Arduino code available under 'Project Files'.


This project encapsulates our technical proficiency, teamwork, problem-solving, and our commitment to utilizing technology for safety and convenience.

Title: Hover - An Automatic Frisbee Thrower
Desc:
Hover is a GNG 2101 team that was given four months to design a frisbee thrower from scratch. This thrower is intended for children with special needs who do not have the motor skills required to throw a frisbee.

Our frisbee thrower is like nothing on the market. It is a compact design with a height adjustable mechanism, which allows for optimal and changeable distances. Combine that with our high efficiency motor and changeable speed controls, and you're left with a product that not only launches a frisbee, but one that consistently and successfully launches variable frisbee sizes at regulative distances. In addition, the safety measures we have implemented in our design ensures that we have dramatically decreased the opportunity for injury.

Title: Béquilles d'hiver / Winterized Crutches - Équipe Borealis
Desc:
English Follows

L’hiver canadien peut être brutal. Il y a de grandes précipitations de neige, des vents froids et surtout l’accumulation de la glace au sol. Ces facteurs augmentent la difficulté à se déplacer quotidiennement dehors et encore plus pour ceux qui se déplacent en béquilles. 

L’équipe Borealis a résolu ce problème avec un tout nouveau prototype qui s’attache aux béquilles et qui facilite l’utilisation des béquilles sur une surface glacée.


Canadian winters can be brutal. There’s big snow storms, cold winds and very often ice build-up on the ground. These factors make it harder to move around from place to place outside and even more for those who need to use crutches.

Team Borealis solved this problem by making an all new prototype that attaches to the end of the crutches and that facilitates de use of the crutches on icy grounds.

Spécifications/Specifications
  • Diamètre de la béquille / Diameter of the crutch: 7/8 in. 
  • Dimensions: 3.5 in. x 3.5 in. x 4.5 in.
  • Poids / Weight: 1.25 lbs
  • Nombre de pics / Number of spikes: 22

Title: GNG1103-B04-The brewskis
Desc: As requested by our client "beyond the pale", we designed a product that was able to measure the specific gravity during the beer brewing process. We had one goal in mind: A need exists for beer brewers to automatically measure and display the specific gravity of their brew during the fermentation process on a routine basis, with a sustainable budget. ​Our design operates on the use of two pressure sensors, and one temperature sensor, while running a code using an arduino microcontroller and attached to the tank. We estimated that our product will cost roughly 98.82 .

Title: GNG1103-B1-Brewery Uno
Desc: The problem our device seeks to solve is that Beyond the Pale Brewing Company needs to precisely and automatically measure the specific gravity of their fermentation process with an attached device that displays real-time data remotely, is easy to use, and can be removed for cleaning. Our device will accomplish this with a pressure sensor that will derive density and then specific gravity from the pressure readings in the tank. It will then transmit data via Bluetooth to an app on a device in the brewery to view and store the data. The total cost of the project design is $79.68. Challenges that may be faced when undergoing this project are effectively waterproofing the sensors and Arduino so they aren't damaged by the fermenting liquid and logging data graphically through an Arduino, which requires external code not written in C++. A detailed report along with .stl files for CAD models can be found under Project Files.

Title: GNG1103-B2-Baby Santa
Desc: The problem statement for our project is to Build a tool that measures specific gravity and temperature, records the data, and sends it to a centralized hub. The device must meet safety standards and the physical limitations of the tank it is used for. Our solution to this was to build a hydrometer (using an ultrasonic and temperature sensor). The ultrasonic sensor will be used to calculate the specific gravity of the beer, while the temperature sensor will be used to find the temperature of the beer. The total cost for our design was $61.74. The important detail that one should keep in mind is to have the wires connected to the correct pins that are used in the code.

Title: GNG1103-B3-Specific Gravity Measurement Device
Desc:
Beyond the Pale needs an accurate and sanitary method to measure, display and store the specific gravity, in a time-efficient and self-regulating process. 

Our group decided to tackle this project in a creative way. Utilizing our fluid dynamics knowledge, we were able to manipulate Bernoulli's equation and the continuity equation for an orifice plate flow meter in order to find the density & specific gravity. The sensors used were a differential pressure sensor and a volumetric flow meter sensor

Our cost for this project was 100$. 

Important details to consider with this design are the connectivity and proper sealing of all components to ensure a waterproof seal. Along with proper code for the sensors.

Title: VR Immersive Experience on Language Barriers basing on Unity
Desc:
The project is aimed at designing an immersive VR experience application to teach users how to deal with language barriers. 
The event is happening in a classroom when the students are trying to make a team for their project of a course. The user can choose to be a student who is not good at speaking English (person A) or be another group number. The user is allowed to use VR devices to move around and choose who to talk with and what to say. 
Based on the user's choice, there will be a good ending or a bad ending. For the good ending, person A will be able to show his value/advantages and stay in the group. For the bad ending, person A will be isolated and switched to another group.
The project is trying to guide the user to find a better way to handle language barrier problems and use these skills in real life.

Title: GNG1503-FA34-Hôtel de pollinisation
Desc:
La cliente a besoin d’un hôtel simple, robuste et durable afin de loger et protéger les abeilles solitaires et indigènes. L'hôtel doit être accessible, facile à installer et entretenir, discret, construit avec des matériaux durables et recyclables, et elle doit fournir une prévention pour les étudiants. 

On a une budget de 100$.

On a décider d'aller avec une projet en forme de 3 hexagone. Une des hexagone est une pot de fleur les deux autre sont les hexagone avec les trous. L'hôtel vas être placée sur le sol. La pot de fleur vais attiré les abeilles. 

Le design des trous peut être modifée, il faut assurer que les contraintes sont suivit. Aussi, assurer que les fleurs sont des fleurs qui peut attiré les abeilles.

Title: GNG1103-B2-Specific Gravity
Desc:
Beyond the Pale needs a food-safe device that can accurately measure brewing metrics and log specific gravity vs time in a cost-effective, automated system. 

Our team used the concept of fluid statics to accurately measure the S.G of fluids in a tank. We accomplished this using an Arduino with a couple of pressure sensors set at known heights. 3D Printing was utilized to print the casing for the electronics.

The budget goal of this project was to keep it under 1o0$.

Details to consider when trying to replicate this project would be to ensure your pressure sensors are accurate and that the correct pressures are being recorded.

Title: GNG2101-A3.2-Frisbee Bud
Desc:
Our team was asked to develop a Frisbee Thrower device by Bethany Children’s Health Center to make the activity of throwing frisbees accessible to children with mobility issues. Our design ideology while building it was focused on creating an affordable, and easy to build device with readily available materials so that our client can build and maintain it. 
Frisbee Bud is an extremely simple frisbee thrower that accomplishes the aforementioned goals. It is built with MDF sheets and uses an inexpensive fan motor to throw frisbees up to 15 feet away.

Title: Hôtel abeilles - GNG1503 - Les Éco-étudiants
Desc:
1) Énoncé de problème:
Le Bureau de Développement Durable de l’Université d’Ottawa cherche une méthode pour promouvoir l'utilité continue des panneaux de signalisation en y intégrant un élément naturel, d'ici le 1er décembre 2022. Il cherche à développer un hôtel robuste, facile d’entretien et sécurisé contre le vol qui permettra de loger des pollinisateurs de façon sécuritaire, tout en rendant le panneau plus accessible aux étudiants.

2) Solution:
Notre solution est un hôtel pour pollinisateur qui est fabriqué en utilisant du bois, des visses, de la colle, et du plastique. L'hôtel à une toiture en composite plastique, et utilise des blocs en bois pour les trous où se nicheront les abeilles. Les inserts en bois ont des trous en demi-cercle qui permet à la création d’un trou entier lorsqu’ils sont assemblés à l’intérieur de l’hôtel. Ceci permet la facilité de nettoyage lors de l’entretien chaque saison. Les rainures à l'intérieur de l'hôtel permettent de facilement insérer les inserts en bois, et fonctionne aussi comme système pour éviter le vandalisme et le vol des composantes. Ensuite, l’hôtel est attaché aux panneaux de signalisation en utilisant une fente formée avec des 2x4 en bois. Les 2x4 en bois sont vissés à une planche en bois qui sert comme support pour l’hôtel et la toiture. Finalement, une colle est utilisée pour assurer l'étanchéité entre le panneau et le support, puis le support est vissé à la base de l’hôtel.

Title: GNG1103- A13 - GAS Team Hydroponic Raft Cleaner
Desc:
Problem Statement:
A simple to use, compact, automated cleaning device is needed for farmers in rural areas to effectively clean the rafts of their eco-friendly hydroponic gardens that will last many years.
Our Solution:
We have an area where the user can stack up to 8 boards on, we then have a wedge that splits the bottom board from the rest of the stack. The bottom board now gets pushed into two spinning wheels which grab onto the board and pull in towards our vertical spinning brush. This brush moves left, right, up and down to clean all holes of the raft. Later on there's larger brushes cleaning off the top and bottom of our raft, and light water to spray off excess residue. At the end we have an easy to carry bucket for the farmers to carry the cleaned boards anywhere.
Cost:
Total cost for all our prototypes was $72.38

Title: GNG2101-Z12-Step on it
Desc: Our Portable step (Step on it!) is a unique product as it achieves the needs of our clients which is portability and a step to use. A need for a portable step that could allow a person with difficulty reaching high stepping areas to use it in different places and ensure the safety of each user by making sure it can handle different surfaces as well as a variety of capacities. Our solution is using a scissor jack mechanism that has a minimum height of 3-inches and a maximum height of  16 inches. It is designed to be held or carried as a suitcase. The cost of this product is $299.99. The step also has a substep to help the users to use it. The first step is 2.8 inches long and the height from the first to the second step is exactly 3 inches. The platform is made of non-slippery material and surrounded by rubber tubing to prevent any injuries while stepping on it.

Title: Image Descriptor- Z14
Desc:
Team: Z14

Digital accessibility is slowly becoming more common however there are still many problems that a person with visual impairment faces every day. Some pictures that you might come across have alternative text which describes what is in the picture for people who can’t see for themselves however not all of them do. There are a few applications that exist which use AI to tell you about your surroundings by being able to take a picture of something around you. However that technology is rarely available for images or pictures that are already on a device. Your task is to create an application that could detect what is in an image when it does not have any alternative text. It should be easy to use and be able to say out loud the description (text to speech).

Title: Power Grabber Handle - TeamZ13

Title: GNG2101-Z24-Belt Buddies-Seat Belt Guide
Desc: The client is the father of a six-year-old girl who suffers from the condition arthrofibrosis. This condition affects all her joints, especially those in her limbs and extremities, causing her to experience limited mobility and flexion, and reduced strength. These constraints make it difficult for her to complete the everyday task of buckling a car seat belt on her own, as it is difficult for her to reach and use both arms to hold the seat belt components. The client has not attempted to produce his own solution due to a lack of materials, expertise, and equipment (3D printer, CNC laser cutter, etc). The product’s goal is to aid the girl in reaching for the male part of the seatbelt and guiding it to the secured/stationary female counterpart, to finally click them together to secure herself safely. The client has a budget of $50 for the product/solution.
tags: ['GNG2101/GNG2501', 'Health Sciences / Sciences de la santé', '3D Printer']

Title: GNG2101 - The Unattached Patient Z21
Desc:
The National Capital Region is approaching 100k or 10% of the population that cannot find a primary care physician. While there is a Provincial portal to add your name to the list, unfortunately, this results in extremely long wait times. At the end of it all, patients looking for doctors resort to google and search in expanding concentric circles from their home address in the hopes of finding doctors accepting new patients. To compound this problem, many doctors are approaching retirement age, with some accelerating their retirement due to the stresses of COVID. However, due to the complexity of some practice plans and the financial model in the province, the retiring doctors are finding it challenging to locate a doctor to take over their practice. This additional difficulty will only exacerbate the problem. 

Our task is to design a solution that allows more doctors to practice and see more patients through a combination of remote or telemedicine and new technologies. Economizing their cost structure by sharing infrastructures and applications will make their financial model more enticing and lead to changes within certain practice plans. This should then lead to changes in the system and more straightforward methods of finding a doctor and accepting new patients.

Title: GNG2101-Z25-The Jiffy App for Mental Health
Desc:
Many people in Ontario do not have access to mental health services, which may lead to dangerous situations if they cannot get the help that they need.

Our solution is an application that allows patients and doctors to meet for virtual consultations, which will provide interaction with doctors as well as attach great importance to everyone’s accessibility.

The application is free to use, but there will be consultation fees provided by the mental health professionals.

Title: Healthy Mind Connect- Z11
Desc:
During the COVID 19 pandemic, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared a new pandemic of mental health. Our goal is to develop a mobile app that can connect and facilitate virtual therapy sessions for those in need. Ontario as a whole is a very large province with lots of remote communities where it may be a day's drive to the nearest therapist. This app is designed to help these people connect with a therapist virtually to give them the help they need during this mental health pandemic. Note: The Bill of Materials is displayed in the economics report.

Furthermore, all project files including the final prototype can be found at the following link:
https://github.com/RaymondMoreau/Healthy-Mind-Connect 

Finally, the project management Gantt chart can be found at the following link:
https://www.wrike.com/frontend/ganttchart/index.html?snapshotId=36kDD3NMDGUgyA5MI0b1Q3hIGzv2X97L%7CIE2DSNZVHA2DELSTGIYA

Title: indigenous vr experience
Desc: experience to immerse into the shoes of a marginalized group in Canada

Title: GNG1503-FC24-Cache-poubelle
Desc: L’ université d’Ottawa a besoin de camoufler les bacs de poubelles, de façon durable et neutre, avec un cache-poubelle qui est portable de site en site, facile à ouvrir par les concierges et les éboueurs, et qui a un coût de prototype de 50$.   Comme solution, nous proposons un cache-poubelle, de bois recyclé, axé sur la simplicité d'utilisation et la fiabilité.  La solution proposée est de 8' de haut, donc le prototype sera assez large et lourd. Pour ceux qui font la construction du prototype, il est suggéré de travailler en groupe de deux ou trois pour faciliter l'assemblage.

Title: The Shadow Pandemic
Desc: COVID-19 has dominated the world's agenda, and mandatory lockdowns were introduced in many countries to help control the spread of the virus. For many of us, the lockdown was inconvenient, but for others, the search for freedom was much more desperate. Measures such as lockdown and distancing rules, have led to an increase in domestic violence – in particular intimate partner violence against women (VAW). Using multi-continental research collected by the United Nation surrounding violence against women, a narrative anchored by facts was quilted. To produce an artistic concept to palate our data, we chose to use two visual fashions; a world map website that easily encompasses the hard data we collected according to the country and a comic strip which explores the narratives of victims of VAW using statistics. By creating these two mediums, users are able to visualize the hard data in a familiar yet explorative manner and relate a compelling story that artistically highlights the shocking facts behind the story.

Title: GNG3100B-SDG12A-Fast Fashion and Waste
Desc:
Fast-fashion culture has accelerated production, resulting in exponentially increasing consumption & production of textile waste.

Using data and artistic visualization, we want to make our audience (Which is any and all who shop regularly) think about their consumption habits.
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'Other Projects / Autres projets']

Title: AHL2100-GNG3100-DTI6304- SDG-13 Climate Action
Desc:
The project is a children's book with a story about a young boy in India and his actions to save the environment. The book also includes artistic visualizations on a deforested tree trunk and chimneys of a factory to show the loss of forests and increase in atmospheric pollution. The project was created for the STEAM Design course (DTI6304/AHL2100/GNG3100), which is an interdisciplinary design course that involves students from Digital Transformation and Innovation, Arts and Engineering. Our group worked on the Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 13: Climate Action.

Our focus is to increase awareness and educate children about climate change and things that they can do to reduce the harsh impacts of mass deforestation for development. It is inspired from one of the sustainable development target which is to include climate change in the curriculum. 

The tool used for this visualization project is Procreate. The cost for the application is 10$. It also requires an iPad and apple pencil for the images drawn.
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'iPad']

Title: Débarracadabra - Camouflage poubelle FC21
Desc:
Ce camouflage poubelle métallique décoratif possede les meilleures caractéristiques répondant à tous les besoins et les désirs de notre client tout en maintenant une fiabilité exceptionnelle. Ce prototype résiste à toutes les saisons grâce à son matériel robuste et endurant, et se distingue dans n'importe quel environnement extérieur puisque son idée principale tourne autour de l’affichage de différentes annonces, de la peinture artistique, des belles lumières LED ainsi que des couleurs neutres du sous-système de camouflage. Avec ses trois différentes ouvertures, dont deux petites en haut pour les utilisateurs et une principale pour les travailleurs, on facilite la tâche de ces derniers en assurant une bonne organisation d’utilisation et on minimise le transfert microbien grâce aux poignets élevées ajoutées sur chaque porte, ainsi c’est plus hygiénique. Cette poubelle est facile à manipuler et résiste aux tâches les plus difficiles vu qu’elle ne rend le système complet incluant la poubelle, ni beaucoup plus lourd, ni beaucoup plus large. Elle est aussi très facile et sécuritaire à utiliser vu qu’on a opte pour un système de verrouillage à clic. Elle est munie d'un système d’odeur de charbon pour contenir les odeurs et prévenir l'introduction des ravageurs. De grandes poignées sur les côtés facilitent le transport du système au bord de la rue pour la collecte des ordures. Ce camouflage en métal pratique est conçu pour être utilisé avec les dimensions de la majorité des poubelles universitaires.
Vidéo: https://youtube.com/shorts/YAhPDLiloHA?feature=share

Title: SDG12B - Fast Fashion Environmental Impact
Desc:
This project is an artistic data visualization exploring the shape of a tree to represent four main aspects of the environmental impact of the fast fashion industry. The project was created for the STEAM Design course (DTI6304/AHL2100/GNG3100), which is an interdisciplinary design course that involves students from Digital Transformation and Innovation, Arts and Engineering. Our group worked on the Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 12: Responsible Consumption and Production.

The focus of our project is to expose the environmental impacts of fast fashion, showing how it contributes to microplastic pollution, CO2 emissions, wastewater, and textile waste. Our solution is to create an artistic visualization through a tree illustration. The message that our project is aiming for is to raise awareness on the impact of Fast Fashion and make people reflect on their consumption habits. 

The tool used for this visualization project is Adobe photoshop. The cost for the license is 20$/month. It would be a struggle to duplicate this prototype as we have a variety of datasets and the image is hand-drawn.
tags: ["uOttawa Team Projects / Projets d'équipes uOttawa", 'Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours']

Title: 3D electroplating printer
Desc: Hydrogen bubble templating can create electrodes very suitable for water electrolysis and thus has major implications for a potential Hydrogen Economy. The current densities required to produce it and consequent heat generation make it impractical to plate large areas at once. These power issues can be mitigated by only plating a small area of the substrate at once. By mating an open source Arduino-powered potentiostat with  modular 3D printer, the electrochemical reaction needs to be localized with a total equipment cost below CAD $500. Challenges remain, in particular sufficiently containing the plating area, and as of yet there has not been an opportunity to test with nickel electroplating solution.

Title: GNG2101-C12-Personal safety
Desc: This product introduces an optimal solution that ensures the safety of the users regularly. It represents an automated process that asks the user to check-in once daily. Should they not complete the check-in prior to the preset time, the app will send them up to three notifications and contacts a set of predefined emergency contacts set by the user in the registration process one hour after their check in time should they not complete the check in by then.

Title: Transcription de cours FB3
Desc: Pendant une classe de 3hrs ou même de 1.5hrs c'est difficile de rester attentif et prendre des notes. Ce client cherche une solution qui lui permettrait de transcrire ses cours en anglais ou en français dans des situations différentes. Votre tâche est de concevoir un système qui est capablede transcrire   des fichiers audio d’une classe en présentiel, d’une classe enregistrée en ligne ou d’une classe diffusée en direct pour ensuite transcrire les notes dans un format comprenable. La solution devraient être fonctionnelle en anglais et en français.

Desc: Virtual reality simulation game that is used to emulate the challenges associated with being in a wheelchair.

Title: GNG2101-C33-Innovative Solutions
Desc: Mr. Paul and Mrs. Clinton from the Tetra society, a company providing solutions for people with physical disabilities, need a device to hold a tablet on a wheelchair tray. Tablet use on a wheelchair for a person with a disability is often an inconvenient process as the tablet is loose on the wheelchair tray and cannot be secured anywhere while transportation. The tablet holder must be installed on the tray permanently, must move from a hidden position to an open position where the tablet is easily accessible for the wheelchair user. The tablet holding device also must be slim and trim. Our solution to this problem was to was to create a tablet holder that is attached to the bottom of the wheelchair tray. This holder is automated to go up and down and is powered by a battery. This movement is propelled by an actuator. The cost of production of our product was fairly low. We had to purchase a 9V battery and an actuator. The wheelchair tray was bought for us by the client. the biggest struggle that we had with creating our product was coming up with a way to automate it. Our original solutions were very complex and expensive. Our advice to anyone trying to attempt this project is to keep it as simple as possible.

Title: Pilier modulable pour utilisations multiples FB33
Desc:
Ce projet aborde la problématique de l'unicité des utilisations faites des différents éléments environnant. Notre solution apporte une nouvelle vision de la modulabilité de pièces, ne se restreignant pas au même domaine d'usage (mobilier public ou ponceau).

Notre solution apporte un atout aux municipalités ainsi qu'aux particuliers, permettant une facilité de modulation accrue, pour différentes utilisations selon les besoins. 
Avec ses piliers combinables et sa taille moyenne, cette solution nous permet d'atteindre d'assez grandes hauteur ainsi que des hauteurs minimales lorsque voulues.

Title: Mobilier urbain - Équipe FB11
Desc:
Ceci est un projet dans le cadre du cours GNG 1503 – Génie de la conception, qui a pour but de nous apprendre le processus de conception et de mettre nos nouvelles connaissances en pratique, tout en nécessitant notre créativité et un travail en groupe. Pour ce projet, nous allons faire la conception d’un mobilier urbain qui sera modulaire et servira à plus qu’une utilisation. Ceci sera conçu pour l’entreprise Northex et on utilisera leur béton fait à partir de matériaux contaminés recyclés. 

Problème :
Il est essentiel de concevoir un mobilier urbain pour Northex, qui sert à plusieurs utilisations et en même temps est sécuritaire, simple à utiliser et innovant. L’accessibilité, l’originalité et le coût sont des aspects à considérer, en plus du fait qu’il sera modulaire et simple à fabriquer. Ce produit ira sur le marché pour être utilisé par le public, donc il est nécessaire qu’il soit profitable et attrayant. 

Solution :
La solution que nous avons offert est un mobilier urbain composé d'un planteur entouré de bancs et tables.

Title: GNG5140 Modular Ultralight eV Prototyping
Desc: The project is related to the structural body of eV (UO Supermiledge). The aim of the project is to remove the welding part between sections by designing a flexible joint. The additive manufacturing and/or conventional manufacturing methods can be used to create a physical prototype. The cost of a part depends upon the manufacturing method used. A high priority should be given to stress and property analysis during the designing stage of an object.
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', '3D Printer']

Title: GNG5140 - Sustainable Food Storage
Desc:
1. Problem statement: To investigate and improve an existing prototype for food storage in Eastern Canada: an above-ground vegetable root cellar designed by a local grassroots organization called Deep Roots Food Hub. 
  2. Our solution: An innovative storage solution is proposed to fully utilize the produce chamber space. Three customized plywood racks are dseigned to store produces, while coroplast boxes can be used to organize different vegetables and fruits. The solution also allows airflow to efficiently remove the heat produced by food.
  3. Cost: The plywood racks and coroplast boxes cost less than $1000 to make.
  4. Important details:
  • The chamber can store more than 17,500 kg of potatoes theoretically.
  • The stress test result reveals that the plywood structures can sustain 100,000 kg before cracking.
  • Racks are 6 ft tall, the top level can be accessed without using ladders. There are more than 5 ft of distance between racks to provide enough space for walking.
  • Wall Insulations, heating elements, and cooling elements were examined mathematically. The produce chamber can maintain a consistent temperature of 2-4 C in winter and early spring.
  • Green energy solutions, namely solar, wind, hydro, and geothermal, were investigated to help the root cellar stay off-grid.
  • Several UN Sustainable Development Goals are met, such as no poverty, zero hunger, good health and well being, responsible consumption and production, climate action, etc,

Title: Inverse Kinematic Robot Arm C13
Desc:
The Canadian Navy needs a robot that can repaint their ships. The robot needs to be able to scan the ship’s paint using a camera, water blast the existing/aging paint off the current ships, and then respray the ship automatically with approximately the same design.

Our solution is very cheap and simple to reproduce. It allows for easy duplication and integration with the robot arm, and with a few simple modifications, can be used on other designs as well.

Title: GNG1103 D31 Heat Exchange Chamber
Desc:
Problem Statement:
"The current HVAC systems create a lot of greenhouse gasses which contribute to global warming and current GCHE systems take up too much space.“

Our Solution: 
As we believe that the main issue faced by GCHE systems is their large size we have designed a system that minimizes its footprint in terms of horizontal area. This is achieved by arranging the pipes in a vertical configuration and placing them below the HEC, going deeper instead of wider.

These vertical pipes would lead into a heat exchange chamber where the heat gained underground would be stored and exchanged with another set of air pipes looped around HEC that would deliver air to the house.

Cost:
$100 (For the prototype)

Challenges:
-Time constraints.
-Group member availability.

Important Details:
-The solar panel was not installed for the prototype.

Title: Amaas Return on investment
Desc:
provide healthcare organizations with "End Use Products" at a commercial scale utilizing additive manufacturing. We are currently working with several biomedical engineering departments in hospitals across Canada to integrate our solution as a tool they can avail of for keeping legacy equipment alive and creating novel products for use.
create a return on investment tool regarding AMaaS solutions for End Use Health Care Products. The value metrics in this tool should not simply compare price differentials of MSRP, but show calculated time saved, appointments saved, equipment hours recouped, quantify simplification of procurement process, and better health outcomes. It should show clients their materials consumption, ecological footprint, and engagement levels. Along with how their individual metrics play into the community and ecosystem of organizations using healthcare 3D printing.

Title: GNG 2101 D15- PerDiem - Personal Safety App
Desc:
Our Client (Susan), is a retired nurse that lives alone. She was seeking out a solution that addressed the vulnerability experienced by people that live alone, as well as alleviates the stress on family members or friends that would have to regularly check on them.
She had some prioritised requirements which included:

  • A daily check in reminder that is easily customizable with respect to user preference.  After the user check in, the reminder resets for the same time in the next day.
  • A buffer period, as well as a dexterity test before a missed check-in is communicated to an emergency contact to avoid false emergencies.
  • Ability to store a list of 3 emergency contacts in order of prioritised communication.
  • An iOS based application that works on her iPad
  • Check in feature that can be paused on special cases such as when the user has company (friends or family) visiting for a period.

The Budget for this project was set at $50 CAD

Title: HORIA FB22
Desc:
Avec des blocs rectangulaires simples, nous sommes en mesure de créer un mobilier urbain polyfonctionnel
https://cad.onshape.com/documents/4e5e2cb5463589cae535096f/w/9323f0df90198416c91db951/e/25ad6e1ed18ea24b708666a2?renderMode=0&uiState=6253560ced10087fc2dce388

Title: Le cache poubelle Sliding Door
Desc:
Il y a plusieurs poubelles sur le campus de uOttawa. Ces poubelles sont grandes et laides donc les immeubles cherchent une solution pour les camoufler pour qu’elles fondent dans le paysage. Les poubelles sont principalement situées dehors et à côté d’un chemin ou d’un quai de chargement d’un édifice. 
 Votre tâche consiste à trouver une solution créative pour cacher les poubelles. Les poubelles n'appartiennent pas à l’université mais à la compagnie de traitement de déchets donc les poubelles elles-mêmes ne peuvent pas être modifiées et elles doivent pouvoir être déplacées et opérées de façon normale. La solution doit être
 durable puisque les poubelles sont dehors à l’année longue et devrait être faite de matériaux recyclables. Elle devrait aussi être facile à installer ou à déplacer. Finalement la solution devrait être universelle pour tous les sites du campus ou être adaptable facilement pour chaque endroit

Title: GNG1103-F32-Immersive Experience Tool
Desc:
The purpose of this project is to develop an immersive experience to educate a wide range of people on implicit bias towards minority groups and improve inclusivity by experiencing life through their eyes

Our solution consists of an expandable platform on Unity containing a template that future creators can follow. This template was based on the true story of Dayniah Manderson who was denied a teaching position because she uses a wheelchair. 

Cost: 0.00$

For optimal use, a Vuze 4k 180 degree stereoscopic camera is ideal for recording videos, but not necessary. Some basic video editing skills are needed as well.

Title: GNG1103-F31-Empathy-Through-VR
Desc: For years, experts in cognitive behaviour and psychologist have been developing techniques to teach empathy. To teach empathy, one must put themselves in other people’s shoes. Therefore, there is a need for a learning tool using virtual reality to enhance and foster empathy by allowing users to experience the lives of minority groups. As a solution, our team presented a real story utilizing the unique affordance of virtual reality (VR) that allows users to walk a virtual mile in the shoes of another. The VR experience is provided with different levels of interactivity with a different outcome, so the players are free to decide their moves. The cost of this project was 50$. The users will experience racism and respond to it appropriately. The main purpose of the project is to enhance empathy and raise the awareness of equity.

Title: GNG2101 Team C31 The Rack
Desc: Rack made for University FreeStore. The rack is extendable and partly collapsible. It has a lower rack for miscellaneous items and wheels for easy transportation

Title: GNG2101-C3p2-Power Grabber-EH
Desc:
Many people who are handicapped, quadraplegic, and elderly have difficulty picking up everyday items from the ground. It is important that those in need have access to a product that makes this task easier for them in order to improve their quality of life and give them more independence.


Those affected by these conditions are in need of a lightweight portable device allowing them to pick up small items off the floor and to place them where they can then be picked up with ease. This device functions with the use of minimal force or difficult movement, and is easily activated without the use of dexterity. 


The PowerGrab Mk1 offers the ease of use necessary for its users  combined with the strength and reliability to withstand time. Its lightweight materials and ability to distribute weight make it easy for users to pick up difficult items. This device requires little effort to control due to its E-Z press buttons, and no gripping force is required. Its long lasting battery ensures the reliability that is essential in ensuring the highest quality of time for its users.

Title: Banc de feuille en béton avec jardinière FB12
Desc: La compagnie Northex nous a demandé la conception d'un mobilier urbain. Celui-ci doit être fait de béton produit avec des matières premières recyclées afin d'éviter que celles-ci ne se retrouvent dans un site d'enfouissement. La solution trouvée a la forme d'un banc qui se commercialise facilement, et qui sera attrayant pour les utilisateurs potentiels. Notre banc a des sièges en forme de feuilles supportés par une jardinière centrale. Tous les modules de notre banc sont encastrables afin de faciliter le montage/démontage.  Notre mobilier représente d'ailleurs les valeurs environnementales dont Northex tient à coeur.

Title: VR experience to create empathy F25
THEC Geothermal box with a dynamic resistor heating D23
Desc:
A THEC geothermal heating system is an underground heating solution for housing. It was primarily done in hotter climates and is really good at cooling but the heating is a major drawback to its current design. Due to this, the client wanted a solution that still had roots in using the THECs as the main air cooling system with the addition of a green heating system that won't consume a lot of power. The dynamic resistor heating system (DRHS) works by calculating the voltage needed to heat resistors to the desired temperature of the user. This is then sent to the TIP120 transistor which then adjusts the voltage running in the resistors and adjusts the overall heating. There are many backups and safes if something were to go wrong which can be seen in the uploaded code below. Also, a calculator was developed to see the number of resistors needed and that respective file is linked below under project files.
To View Design Day Presentation: Design Day Pitch - Google Slides

**SPECIAL NOTE ABOUT BOM**
This BOM was made specifically to outline all of the components used, a lot of the circuitry material was already in the possession of our members. Due to this if replication of this project is wanted. Please be more accountable for your spending and use of tools.

Title: GNG 1103 - THEC Geotherrmal Heating system D22
Desc:
The heat Exchange Chamber (THEC) is a geothermal system to replace current heating and cooling systems in houses; however, it is currently unable to provide sufficient heating in winter to heat homes to a comfortable range. The system also needs to be renewable, not contribute to the production of emissions, and low energy. Our design builds on the client’s patent with renewable solar energy to provide the electrical and thermal needs of our system. Our system captures thermal energy in water and stores it in a hot water tank we call the thermal battery. The thermal battery is to improve the reliability of our system in situations with a lack of sunlight, such as at night or on cloudy days. The water of our system is circulated by pumps running off solar panels. We also plan to implement thermoelectric plates to increase the efficiency of our system by converting lost thermal energy into electrical energy to power the pumps. These plates would be installed on the solar panels and thermal battery to capture lost or excess heat. Our addition supplies additional heating in winter to allow the system to heat to room temperature.

OnShape Link: https://cad.onshape.com/documents/6c2cf1478b39a2c0e87b4cbc/w/e21602e6f650e5cc4ceb1d8b/e/1084005dc275bf6c0265fb2d?renderMode=0&uiState=624b7cd400896a12e3a65d93

Title: Ponceau modulaire en béton FB24 - CiBoRG -
Desc:
Notre client nous demande de concevoir un  ponceau de béton recyclé modulaire, innovant économique et immédiatement commercialisable pour traverser un fossé, destiné à usage léger.
Notre solution un ponceau modulaire, de longueur et hauteur variable, constituée de 7 pièces fabriquées avec 3 moules polyvalents.
À la fin d'un processus de conception rigoureusement suivi, une discipline d'équipe exemplaire, la rétroaction du client et l'aide du corps professoral, on a réussi a concevoir un ponceau  sécuritaire, simple modulaire avec des moules réutilisables pour un coût de production réduit.
-CiBoRG-

Title: GNG2101 - LightSupport - human powered light C11
Desc: This repository describes a system that takes mechanical energy generated by a human and produces light energy for the purpose of growing plants. Humans were chosen as the ideal power source because they do not generate emissions, they are feasible on a small scale and they do not require heavy resources to create (like solar panels). In addition to being sustainable, this system is designed for users with hypermobility in mind.

Title: The Last End-Effector
Desc:
Inverse Kinematics: Analytical Inverse Kinematics solution coded in Python using triangular plane projection. Senses whether the coordinate input is in range of the arm. Average algorithm runtime of 1/100th of a millisecond, near-instant execution. Scalable to higher degrees of freedom without sacrificing time or space complexity.

User Interface: Built in Python using TKinter Library. Takes user input for desired end-effector coordinate. Checkboxes for attachment control. Emergency stop button. User feedback for emergency stop and out-of-range coordinates.

Attachment and Motor Control: Built in Python using PyMata's Firmata protocol for communication with host computer. Relays GUI data to Arduino Microcontroller and controls steppers and attachments using analog PWN ports.

End-Effector: Completely modular system with removable attachments. Current working attachments include a water blaster, vacuum, LED light, and drawing tool. The system allows for others to be developed and easily added based on needs.

Safety Features: Software and Hardware emergency stop using high visibility buttons. Instant deactivation time, killing power to all motors and attachments. Seamlessly resume activity afterward. GUI proves step by step process for dealing with first-aid emergencies after the button is pressed.

Title: C-11
Desc:
Code: Done in C++ to test every possible solution of our (x,y,z) coordinates. These coordinates were solved in our inverse kinematics calculations.

User Interface: The code allows us to control the arm with the use of a keyboard. The end-effector is controlled by pressing the letter d on your keyboard to open and close the claws.

Safety: Sweep of servo motor code opens the claws continuously which is impractical and unsafe. The code used implements the feature of controlling the opening of the claws by pressing a button, so the claws only move when you tell them to.

Inverse kinematics: We used a mathematical approach of matrices to solve for the (x,y,z) coordinates in symbolab. A diagram was drawn to find out where the theta, alpha, and lengths were on the z and x-axis. These values were put into a table. The values were then put into 3 matrices, one for each joint. Then we multiplied the 3 matrices in symbolab to get the (x,y,z) coordinates that were then put into our code to test every possible solution.

Sources for code: Pankaj Kumar Rathi posted code in teams for the robotic arm code, and with the help of our PM Luis Perez Acosta, we could write code that includes our inverse kinematics and parts of Pankaj's code.
The sweep of the servo motor code is from: https://forum.arduino.cc/t/how-to-make-a-servo-sweep-once-back-and-forth-with-the-same-keyboard-key/526048/2
The idea of the gear claw is from: https://www.robotshop.com/ca/en/ez-robot-servo-gripper.html?gclid=Cj0KCQjw_4-SBhCgARIsAAlegrXumRhnhQR0n-0q-R0emKYAh9htyXiL9M0hjNlHjcqI8biGVIXpHMAaAkHDEALw_wcB

Title: GNG1103-C1-Group 3-ARMageddon
Desc:
We have developed various codes that allow a robotic arm to function with end-effectors and a user interface.

The video above is a feature of our design day presentation, where our user, Sam, shows how easy it is to use our solution. It features basic robot movement, Sam's interaction with the graphical user interface, an exemplary interaction with the camera and corrosion detection software, and a demo of the PIR sensors.

Our user Sam is fresh out of high school with little technical experience and decides to join the Royal Canadian Navy. Aboard the Halifax class destroyer, Sam is put to work removing the rust off the walls using sandblasters, vacuums and paint sprayers, a tedious and time-consuming task that our inverse kinematic solution solves. 

Our client requested an automated way to paint and remove corrosion from the walls. Our team of first-year engineers went above and beyond to implement corrosion detection software working alongside an OV7670 Arduino compatible camera. Our solution is ready from start to finish.

As a proof of concept of the client's need to water blast and paint corroded areas, our marker end-effector facilities this by drawing shapes using preset input coordinates. 

The solution is entirely automized with our graphical user interface featuring buttons directing to the Arduino libraries and camera interface.

For the safety of Sam and other crew members aboard, our PIR sensors looped with the Arduino interrupt function triggers the LED and buzzer to alert the crew member of the movement of the robot.

This project proved a big challenge for our team of first-year engineers. With tons of googling and time spent asking our TA for coding help, we are proud to present our finished solution to you!

Links to Github pages
https://github.com/becapoulin/inverse-kinematics
https://github.com/benoittremblayy/Corrosion-Detection-AI
https://github.com/jessbeardshaw/OV7670Camera-with-PIRsensors

Title: GNG1103 D1 1 The Heat Exchange Chamber
Desc:
Group name: The Pelicans (D 1.1)

Problem statement:
Our client, on behalf of their customers, needs a low-tech, zero-emission, and inexpensive heat exchange chamber. The current GCHE needs to be modified to be more compact, have a sustainable power source, and be able to achieve higher temperatures in the winter, all in the scope of an average townhouse. Furthermore, our client needs us to improve upon the current design such that the system can warm air to 20 degrees centigrade in the winter time.

The cost to replicate this design should not exceed 100$, however an issue our team struggled with while creating this system was that several of our electrical components could only be bought in bulk or in large quantities (Packs of 10,5 etc)

Working prototype video:
https://vimeo.com/701512002

Title: GNG2101-C2p3-Image Descriptor
Desc: The context of this project is based on a client who has visual impairment and who is not satisfied with the available solutions on the market to help them read text out loud. This has led to the development of a mobile application unlike any other in the market, that would meet the client’s most critical requirements. The application will allow users to select between PDF and TXT files, between PNG and JPEG images and to take a picture, and the extracted text is then converted to speech. A convenient reading speed was chosen to meet the client's desired reading rate and high contrast colors were chosen to ensure a high level of accessibility. Finally, the app is very user-friendly with a minimum number of clicks to convert text to speech.

Title: GNG1103 Team Pandora D21 THEC
Desc:
Group: Team Pandora (D2.1)

Project Background: Our client, Mr.  Enendu, holds a patent (Canadian patent 2626472) for a Thermal Heat Exchange Chamber (THEC) which is a low-tech zero emission HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning) innovation that extracts energy from the ground into buildings to achieve required thermal comfort using no fossil fuel, refrigerant, or heat pump. We have been requested to build-upon and prototype the system.

Project Statement: Our goal is to improve upon the design by increasing the output temperature during the winter in North America while maintaining the project's initial goal of creating a sustainable and low-cost product.

Solution: We have broken down the prototype into three main sub-systems:
  1. The Heat Exchange Chamber (HEC): Composed of concrete and clay, and filled with water. Inside the HEC will be six high density polyethylene (HDPE) pipes that are connected to our piping network outside of the HEC.
  2. The Piping Network: Six looped piped composed of (HDPE). The looped configuration was chosen to increase the surface area which will promote heat transfer.
  3. The Control System: The control system is a negative feedback cycle that ensures that the desired temperature is maintained by adjusting the fan power as a result of the measured output temperature.

Prototypes and Results:
  • Prototype 1: The HEC and piping network were tested to ensure that the system can reach the client's desired temperature. Results of simulated tests and calculations demonstrated that the prototype is a success.
  • Prototype 2: The control system was tested and our simulation successfully adjusted the fan speed to match the desired output temperature.
  • Prototype 3: Prototype 1 and 2 are combined to see if the entire system is fully functional and if we successfully created a proof of concept for the client. The physical build was a success as the outlet temperature increased however we encountered issues while combining the code and circuit.

Cost: The total cost of the prototype is $175.

Important Details: 
  • The sump pump was excluded from the final prototype design as it would have increased our budget for minimal results.
  • CAD drawings (onshape), circuits (tinkercad) and code can be found in the user manual document.
