Title: Mobilier urbain - Équipe FB11 - GNG1503
Desc:
Ceci est un projet dans le cadre du cours GNG 1503 – Génie de la conception, qui a pour but de nous apprendre le processus de conception et de mettre nos nouvelles connaissances en pratique, tout en nécessitant notre créativité et un travail en groupe. Pour ce projet, nous allons faire la conception d’un mobilier urbain qui sera modulaire et servira à plus qu’une utilisation. Ceci sera conçu pour l’entreprise Northex et on utilisera leur béton fait à partir de matériaux contaminés recyclés. 

Problème :
Il est essentiel de concevoir un mobilier urbain pour Northex, qui sert à plusieurs utilisations et en même temps est sécuritaire, simple à utiliser et innovant. L’accessibilité, l’originalité et le coût sont des aspects à considérer, en plus du fait qu’il sera modulaire et simple à fabriquer. Ce produit ira sur le marché pour être utilisé par le public, donc il est nécessaire qu’il soit profitable et attrayant. 

Solution :
La solution que nous avons offert est un mobilier urbain composé d'un planteur entouré de bancs et tables. Nous avonc conçu un seul morceau en forme de "c" qui se répète plusieurs fois afin de composer le mobilier urbain.
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'GNG1103/GNG1503', 'Drill press']

Title: GNG 2101 - Group C2 1 The Extendables - Collapsible Storage Rack
Desc:
The uOttawa Free store is looking for a collapsible clothing rack that is both easily mobile and cost effective, with high clothing capacity and moderate weight bearing ability while remaining accessible and easy to set up.

The solution group 2.1 came up with is a design for a clothing rack made up of two individual pieces. The first piece is the base which contains wheels at the bottom for movement. The second piece is the frame which can be inserted into the base for an upright clothing rack. The frame also contains a rotating clothing hanging rod on both sides which can be extended and adjusted in height via a groove and fit mechanism, as can be seen in the initial design image attached to this project . Since the whole clothing rack is made up of two individual pieces that can be fit into one another, the clothing rack can also be collapsed to take up less space when not in use, but is still simple to set up for volunteers of the Free store.

The cost of the first prototype is estimated to be  $94.75 solely for materials costs, including wheels, wood, PVC pipes, etc.

Please note that the initial design attached as an image to this project was slightly modified to accommodate physical limitations experienced during the designing process. The final prototype and subsequent deliverables will further explain the changes made in detail, which should be noted if the design is to be duplicated.

Please also note that a video explaining the final prototype is included in the project files.

Title: GNG1103-The Combustible Intelligent Monkeys-Stadium Fan Experience G14
Desc:
This project was a design challenge proposed by Ross Video, in collaboration with OSEG, to develop a panel that could be used in the TD Place arena for Ottawa 67’s hockey games. Ross Video needs a user-friendly interface in order to quickly control the output of information during hockey games.

Our design incorporates 5 aspects of the fan experience into one system. It also automates the input of information by retrieving data from the OHL website through a JSON file in order to save time for the user and prevent errors. 

Our project cost was $0 since we use the free Dashboard software. An important thing to note is that when the project is split into different files before being combined into the final product, it is important to make sure the parameters are implemented properly in the final product, otherwise certain features will not work.

Title: GNG2501-F16 - Gestion de symptome
Desc:
Concevoir une application qui sera utilisée par des individus souffrant de maladie chronique et sujets à divers traitements. Cette dernière les aidera à enregistrer leurs symptômes, leur médication, alimentation, ainsi que tout autre facteur pouvant influencer leur état de santé durant le traitement.
Nous avons donc créer une application à l'aide de l'outil Thunkable qui a pour fonctionnalité d'enregistrer les symptômes, les éffacer, insérer des rappels et suivre le quotidien.
Le seul coût est pour la license Pro de Thunkable qui reviens a 50 USD.

Le lien pour notre projet:
https://x.thunkable.com/projects/61a7d5546f1d1f00119d7be5/47abcc74-d3c0-46c6-84d0-c8d686b79bac/designer

Title: GNG1503D-FD9-Identification de Roulements
Desc:
Il y a beaucoup de personnes qui viennent au magasin de GBS ou envoient des photos de roulements pour avoir de l'aide pour les identifier. Parfois ils sont intacts mais ils sont aussi parfois brisés. C'est un processus qui prend du temps pour les employés de GBS et qui n'est pas très efficace. Votre tâche est de créer un système capable d'identifier des roulements SKF du catalogue ci-dessous tout seul ou est capable de guider un utilisateur vers le bon item. Le système devrait être bilingue et être modulaire pour qu'un autre type de roulement puisse y être
ajouté plus tard.

La solution que nous avons trouvé consiste d'un montage pour prise de photo, un interface développer avec Anvil Works, un programme pour la détection des contours et le calculs des mesures dans Google Colab et une base de données créée dans Google Sheets qui est modulaire comportant plus de 400 différents roulements. La précision des mesures varie entre 0.1 et 0.5 mm et le montage permet la prise de photo de roulement de 5mm à 250mm.

Le coût total de notre projet est de 49$.

La caméra utilisée est importante dans la prise de photo et nous avons trouvé qu'un module de caméra à 15$ fonctionnait, mais que les caméras des téléphones intelligents récents était les plus optimales.

Title: GNG1103-Group15-RossVideoDashboardProject
Desc:
Problem Statement: A need exists for Ross Video to develop and implement a program that allows a user to quickly and efficiently control graphics display for sporting events at the TD Place.
Solution: Our solution implements Ross Video's Dashboard software to create a user-friendly, efficient control panel interface for graphics display.
Cost: None.
Replicating the Design: It should be noted that for full functionality, the Dashboard panel must be connected to the Xpression server that stores Ross Video's graphics. In order to successfully duplicate the design, access to Xpression is required, in addition to a good understanding of programming in Dashboard (based on Java). On Ross Video's website, documentation for various coding aspects is available to explain the programming of the panel.

Title: No More Babies Stuck in Hot Cars - GNG1103 B01 Team 1
Desc:
SafeBaby is the perfect device for busy parents who live in areas where the temperature can rapidly increase to fatal levels.

We understand that parents have a lot on their minds and that it can be easy to forget a child in a car. This affordable device is easy to install and has 2 sensors, a motion detector and a thermal detector, which are able to detect a child's presence in a hot car and send a notification to the parent when concerning levels have been detected. 

Our device is an enclosed 15cm x 12cm x 4cm box that contains an ESP8266 chip, 2 thermistors, 1 PIR sensor, a battery source and a bunch of wires. 

During our design process, we made 3 prototypes, tested them rigorously and implemented numerous changes based on those tests to ensure that our final device was up to our standards as well as our client's.

Title: Library Wayfinding Service A16
Desc:
Clients with disabilities are having issues navigating the Morisset Library, with help from
bluetooth beacons we can guide them to major areas in the library using an accessible mobile web application. The web application is hosted for free here, by netlify.com. Each bluetooth beacon costed us about $33 CAD with shipping and taxes included. We were unable to get much work with connecting the beacons to the site itself; an app (using Android Studio, for example) might be a better course of action. Combining the two concepts together could be an even better idea: have a simple and accessible site describe the application and how it works, while also providing a direct download link of the app.

Title: GNG2101-Microwave Transfer Device-A20

Project background / Contexte du projet

Our goal is to create a device that can transport a variety of items safely and without causing damage. The device is designed for general use and may be easily assembled by individuals so that it can be moved securely from one place to another.

Title: Tic Intel - Group B13
Desc:
Tic Intel is a Canadian-based company that provides the most innovative physical tic protection glove to people who experience injuries from physical tics in their everyday life. 

Our product is designed to minimize injuries caused by physical tics while maximizing comfort and dexterity for everyday use. Using cutting-edge technology, the glove is able to accomplish this through optimized padding placement and the utilization of impact foam which allows for the glove to effectively dissipate kinetic energy during an impact. 

The dark color and slim design of the gloves enable its fashionable appearance and avoid the "hospital" look of common solutions from competing brands. 

This glove is also durable against cuts, heat and is meant to be worn for prolonged periods of time to truly suit your everyday needs.

If you are experiencing physical tics, you have the right to a solution that makes you happy. 

Chose happiness today with Tic Intel.

Title: GNG1503D - MAP Conception - Identification de Roulement
Desc:
Au sein de l'entreprise GBS, il y a un réel problème quant à l'identification des roulements présenté par leurs clients. De plus, les employées les plus experts sont attraient à prendre leurs retraitent et les nouveaux sont malheureusement inexpérimenté ce qui constitue un problème majeur pour le chiffre d’affaires de l’entreprise.


Suite à la sollicitation du directeur de l’entreprise, monsieur Mitch Bouchard, nous avons développé un système capable de faire la mesure et l’identification des roulements de façon automatique. Il s’agit de Roul’Scan. Ce système est constitué d’un scanner physique qui comporte une caméra mobile qui va scanner le roulement posé sur la plaque acrylique préalablement éclairée. Cette image sera envoyée vers l’interface qui est connecté à notre algorithme de traitement d’image et de mesures pour une identification optimale.


Au travers de ce système, nous espérons permettre à l’entreprise GBS de combler leurs lacunes et de leurs permettent de prendre un meilleur envole.

Title: Proj 16 OLP loyalty rewards program
Desc:
Loyalty programs offered by financial institutions and other businesses are fairly limited in how consumers can spend their accumulated points. We have used this as an opportunity to create a system embedded in a website that integrates with other loyalty programs so that consumers need not worry about such limitations any longer.

Features :
- Our tier upgrade system allows users to take advantage of their points gaining and spending by adding in a monthly fee for extra perks and rewards.

- Easily exchange points from your gained OLP points to other loyalty programs such as PC optimum.

- Our easy-to-use User interface makes all important information easy to find and very accessible.

Title: Group 17 - Wallet XVII
Desc:
Wallet XVII is a SaaS platform with the main goal of democratizing loyalty points. This is achieved by giving Ecosystem Partners (EPs) a platform to share their exclusive rewards points with a large pool of users. Users are then allowed to exchange points between EPs, Redeem points for goods, services, and cash, and send points to other users. The platform serves Banks as the main client, and revenue is generated by charging users per transaction, and generating ad revenue. 

https://amukh058.editorx.io/walletxvii

Title: Table portable - Équipe FA6
Desc:
Notre cliente aime beaucoup être dehors dans des parcs pour lire un livre ou faire des choses sur son ordinateur par exemple. En raison de ses joints elle a beaucoup de difficulté à être assise sur un banc ou sur le sol avec quelque chose sur ses genoux pendant plus que quelques minutes. Notre tâche est de créer une petite table qui est ajustable en hauteur pour des scénarios différents et a une surface inclinable. Elle doit aussi être extrêmement légère et peut être pliée pour être facilement transportée. 

Nous avons conçu une table portable aussi légère que possible de type valise facile à transporter. Pour ce faire, nous avons utilisés une planche MDF en guise de surface et des tubes d'aluminium en guise de pattes pour la table. Cette combinaison est à la fois solide et légère. Cette table portable vous permet à la fois d'avoir une table portable et une valise pour que vous puissiez apporter ce dont vous avez besoin tout partout.

Lien de la vidéo de démonstration: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cP-vwP5V5TE&ab_channel=SamuelDupuis

Title: FD12
Desc: Notre équipe a conçu un système d'identification qui inclut une partie numérique et une autre physique, permettant à toutes les catégories d'utilisateurs d'identifier leurs roulements, et ce avec la plus grande simplicité.

Title: Glovers - GNG2101 A6
Desc: Our client is a Tourette Syndrome patient who suffers from bodily injuries due to involuntary movements of their hands. The current solution of boxing/MMA gloves prevents the client from suffering hand injuries, dislocation of knuckles, and burn, however, it is inconvenient for everyday use as the fingers are partly bounded and the gloves are too bulky. The goal of our project is to create a lightweight breathable glove that includes padding for the knuckles to prevent dislocation and burn/cut resistant material for the palm. Furthermore, the fingers will be free to move with the tips exposed to better suit the occupation of our client.

Title: ParaTranspo solution B21
Desc: An accessible trip booking system for ParaTranspo passengers. The system also notify the users of any updates regarding their trips.

Title: Rotation 360
Desc:
Perdre un roulement est un problème. Ne pas pouvoir l'identifier pour le remplacer en est un autre, encore plus scandaleux.
Mais il n'y a rien à craindre car Rotation 360 propose un concept qui peut se présenter comme solution efficace. L'identification se faisant 100 % virtuellement par les employés GBS et en une marge de temps réduite, le client n'aura plus à se soucier de la perte de ses roulements!
Prendre des photos, les envoyer au magasin en incluant des données supplémentaires si possible en quelques cliques, est tout ce qu'il faut pour que  le tour soit joué et que le bon roulement soit enfin démasqué !

Title: GNG2101-B24-Detachable SnowPlow
Desc: The client, seeks a user-friendly and widely-accessible product that could displace snow safely, conveniently and reliably while minimizing the use of physical movements. The product should keep the original functionality of the wheelchair intact and cannot rely on the user’s leg mobility. The product should cost up to $100 (unless modified). In order to recreate certifications of MIG welding, lathe, and drill press training. As well, please read user manual for further information.

Title: Identification des roulements
Desc:
Les employés de la compagnie GBS ont besoin d’être capables d’identifier facilement et avec précision des roulements ou des morceaux de roulement apportés par les clients. Ceci va être fait avec une caméra qui scanne le roulement et ressort les dimensions internes et externes du roulement ainsi qu'un logiciel qui s’occupe d’identifier les roulements du catalogue et qui va afficher les résultats les plus précis selon les besoins du client. 

Les composantes de notre produit sont la base de données modulaire sur excel, le code dans google colab qui capture l'image et qui retourne les dimensions ainsi que le modèle physique qui comporte la caméra et la lumière pour scanner l'ombre du roulement.
tags: ['GNG1103/GNG1503', 'Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', '3D Printer', 'Laser Cutter']

Title: Honeycomb
Desc:
Problem Statement
Children in locked cars, especially in extreme temperatures, are in immediate danger if left alone. A product is needed to help these children by either removing them from the car or regulating the temperature in the car. The product must also be easily installable and easy to use, can be integrated directly into any vehicle, and prompts a fast response time from the user.

Solution
Our solution, Honeycomb, addresses the client's concerns and given design criteria. It is made up of a fan, sensors, an Arduino UNO, and a battery pack. It will sense when a child is in the vehicle and the temperature is above 30 degrees Celsius, then activate a cooling system that will regulate the temperature until it is manually reset and the child is safe.
 
Important Details
When duplicating Honeycomb, one may face the difficulty of generating similar code that assimilates the varying subsystems within our solution. Additionally, the assembly of the solution may face manufacturing errors as the system contains several wires and small parts. There were also difficulties procuring hardware as some of it was fragile and took time being delivered.

Title: GNG2101- A14-Nandos
Desc: Fidget cube and desktop base for users with ADHD.

Title: Défilement accessible FA12
Desc:
Notre produit permet d’utiliser plus accessiblement les fonctionnalités d’une souris informatique en utilisant ses pieds et ses mains afin de faire varier les muscles utilisés pour accomplir les tâches sur ordinateur. 
Il est confortable et léger et consiste en une pédale pour scroller les pages et un pavé de clic.

Title: TrueTable - FA11
Desc: Ce projet consiste à créer une petite table qui est ajustable en hauteur, légère pour des scénarios différents et a une surface inclinable.
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'GNG2101/GNG2501', '3D Printer', 'Laser Cutter']

Title: GNG2501-FA15 - Table Portable
Desc:
Il y a une grande population d'adultes qui souffrent de conditions médicales telles que l'arthrite, la dystrophie musculaire et bien d'autres qui peut entraîner une mobilité limitée. Malheureusement, ce problème n'est pas traité aussi fréquemment qu'il le devrait par les entreprises et la conception de leurs produits. 

C'est pourquoi, en équipe, nous avons conçu la Brief-Table, pour offrir un produit facile à utiliser et confortable pour les activités quotidiennes de ces adultes, ainsi que de toute autre personne ayant besoin d'une table portable et polyvalente.
tags: ['GNG2101/GNG2501', 'Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'Drill press', '3D Printer', 'Laser Cutter']

Title: Mémoria FA13
Desc: Notre projet consiste à mettre en oeuvre une application d'amplificateur de note mobile qui réduira le besoin de porter une grande quantité de notes écrit sur papier. Ce prototype vise à aider non seulement les personnes qui ont la mémoire à court terme imprécis, mais aussi ceux et celle qui ont beaucoup de paperasse à gérer.​

Desc: Aide à la photographie

Title: GNG1503A01-FA1- Éclairs de Génie
Desc:
1. les inspecteurs de la police d'Ottawa ont besoin d'un support pour la réalisation des photos d'empreinte, lors des scène de crime, ainsi d'une lumière qui est ajustable en fonction des angles à photographies. 
2. la solution aux problèmes est un dispositif qui est en forme de U, et qu'elle est connecté avec le bas du la caméra.
3.une lumière LED qui serais fixe sur le bas du prototype qui feras des rotation en différents angles au besoin du client.
4. le coût du projets est de  25.18$

Title: GNG 1503 - FA16 - Dispositif pour la caméra - Direction créative
Desc:
Les investigateurs policiers ont besoin de photographier des empreintes et autres évidence à une distance, une luminosité et un angle parfait. À l’aide d’un dispositif ajustable qui s’attache à la caméra sur la lentille, il sera possible de prendre qu'une seule photo rapidement. Notre solution au problème est un anneau qui s'attache à l'objectif de la caméra qui contient 3 pieds ajustables. Il y a également un lumière ajustable sur le dessus de l'anneau. Le cout du projet est d'environ 55$.

Title: Équipe - Destinée FA2
Desc: Les policiers ont besoin d’un dispositif léger et facile à transporter, qui permet de prendre des photos de manière plus efficace, à une distance de 25cm de l'indice lorsqu’ils sont sur une scène de crime. Le dispositif serait ajustable et compatible avec la caméra utilisée et aura également un coût abordable.

Title: GNG1103-G12-FanEngagement
Desc:
Problem Statement:Ross Video needs a new way to engage fans throughout games, but especially when the players aren’t playing. They need to be able to change and adjust statistics very quickly, as well as have an easy-to-use interface to ensure timely updates from the operator and time limits to show certain information.

Our Solution: We will be creating a system that allows fans to have the ability to vote on what team they think will win. This is in attempt to increase fan engagement. We will also be creating a new team set up system that is automatic, and engaging to all fan types. 

Cost: Although no direct cost, Ross Video will have the option to increase cost in order to increase value.

Important Details: Since it is possible through a complex code, this will be difficult to duplicate. Although once achieved it is easy to run and reliable.

Title: Satya 15
Desc:
Our product consists of an app and a website. Zafin Rewards is an app that allows users to access and transfer points. The website is called Business' Corner and allows verified businesses of all sizes to interact and form connections!

Try out our website here
https://ouloumyassine.wixsite.com/my-site

Title: GNG1103 - G04 - The Dashboard Deltas
Desc: Problem statement - the operator needs a way to quickly and easily control the output of the Ottawa 67s scoreboard show to enhance the fan experience, increasing fan engagement and excitement.

Title: The Gears Heads - Team 5
Desc: The Gear Heads - Team 5 from GNG 1103 were tasked to design a panel for ROSS Videos to create a better fan exprience at TD Place Arena.

Title: Projet ClearView Équipe FA13
Desc:
Daniel Deschamps représentant la Section de l’identité judiciaire du Service de Police d’Ottawa a besoin d’un dispositif capable d’ajuster  la distance entre la caméra et la surface ainsi que l’intensité lumineuse du flash, afin de permettre de prendre du premier coup la meilleure photo possible, avec le bon focus, pour une photo extrêmement nette. Le dispositif doit être facile et rapide à utiliser ainsi qu’à transporter, en plus d’être abordable, fiable et de ne pas nuire à la qualité des photos d’aucune façon.

Nous avons donc conçu un dispositif composé d'un flash circulaire auquel sont attaché trois pièces créées avec une imprimante 3D qui retiennent trois tiges rétractables en acier inoxydable. Toutes les parties sont fixées avec de la colle époxy. Les tiges sont fixées à un angle de 12,5 degrés par rapport au flash pour qu'elles ne soient pas visible dans les photos prisent par l'appareil. La distance entre la caméra et la surface peut être variée entre 5cm et 42cm. Le coût total des matériaux est de 92,74$. Le flash possède huit adaptateurs lui permettant de s'attacher à des lentilles d'un diamètre de 49mm, 52mm, 55mm, 58mm, 62mm, 67mm, 72mm et 77mm. Il possède aussi quatre diffuseurs de lumière permettant de changer la couleur de la lumière émise entre le orange, le bleu, le blanc huitre et le transparent. Le flash à plusieurs intensités lumineuses différentes. Il faut moins de cinq minutes pour installer le dispositif sur la caméra et pour l'ajuster afin que la distance entre la caméra et la surface soit idéal.

Le lien pour la conception Onshape de nos attaches est le suivant : 
https://cad.onshape.com/documents/9ec6e86523b0af72fc1b0dd2/w/5a504dec226aad1a4d6b6290/e/bd7135752d5a165fc6724ca4

Title: GNG1103 - GroupB 19 - Child Environment Alert System
Desc: There is a ridiculous quantity of child deaths that occur due to heatstroke in a vehicle per year,  on average there are 38 deaths per year (NSC). Our group has been tasked to created a product that will detect when a child is present in a vehicle while parked and also notify the surrounding persons and guardians to the situation. Our approach to this issue was a modular system consisting of a Driver Detection Pad, Seatbelt Switch (detecting a child), Sensor Module, Fan, Arduino Housing, and alert system (LED strip, Buzzer, Application). These systems are incorporated into the vehicle to create a reliable and efficient system to detect  a child trapped in a vehicle, and notify the guardians and passerby's. Through tireless effort and hours of dedication, this product has reached an ideal outcome and has become a quality product.

Title: B-16 - SAVE
Desc:
By Shahd, Aviral, Vishnu, Elijah
Our product consists of three main sensors, air quality sensor, a temperature sensor, and a PIR sensor. A speaker is connected that will be activated whenever the temperature or CO2 levels are at a dangerous level. Additionally, if these dangerous levels are detected the motion sensor will start working and send alerts through the speaker.

Title: GNG1103 - B17 - StayinAlive
Desc: StayinAlive, the product made to save lives!

Title: B20 Elite4 Car Sensor
Desc: The Elite4 Car Sensor aims at rescuing children or pets left alone inside a personal vehicle; it is equipped with various sensors—to detect the child or pet's presence and the car's internal conditions—and two distinct alert systems, working via Wi-Fi, which can warn caregivers, their family or friends and passersby.

Title: Zafin Ecosystem A11
Desc:
Zafin is a banking software company with clients that include banks like TD and CIBC. Zafin tasked our class with creating a new loyalty rewards program. They want a product that they can sell to their clients, and be done with it. They want to be "hands-off" as soon as the client buys the product.

Our product, the Zafin Ecosystem, is a way to connect the loyalty rewards program of every business and bank that wants to join. The Zafin Ecosystem allows banks to establish an exchange rate between their point system and another. This way, anyone earning points with one rewards program isn't confined to the rewards of just that loyalty software.

Link to Z-Ecosystem prototype:
Zaffin Prototype (bubbleapps.io)
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'GNG1103/GNG1503']

Title: RADS Points System A14
Desc: We've created a system to democratize points systems in one application for users to access. Using chrome extension software and an integrated python-driven app.

Title: Stadium Fan Experience G8
Desc:
Ross Video wanted us to prepare an easy-to-use dashboard to dynamically control the Ottawa 67’s scoreboard at the TD Arena.​
 ​
This dashboard needed to be able to display team and player information, advertisements, fan birthdays, and crowd prompts to enhance the user and attendees’ experience.

Title: Stars - GNG1103 Proj13
Desc:
When our team met with Zafin at the beginning of the semester, they expressed that they were looking for a platform which offers their clients and users a seamless experience, giving them the technology to achieve more.  They were set on including smaller partners, and taking a more horizontal approach at the existing loyalty rewards system, allowing more freedom for the users.

With the use of PowerApps, our team decided to create a platform that allows clients and users to do just that.  Our app, which we have named Stars! has found a way to allow smaller businesses to participate by offering a pricing plan based on the size of their business, as well as a points value based on the kinds of goods and services they offer.  

Stars! Also allows users to convert points from business A to business B, through an algorithm that takes into account the dollar value of the points of each business.

Title: Hot Car Emergency - HeatSense Alert - Team b13
Desc: A solution to children exposed to dangerous heat while left in a car.

Title: Hot Car Emergency- B14-Save the backseat
Desc:
The device designed by our team for our client has one major outcome: notifying the parent(s)/guardian/passerby that a child/ animal is stuck inside of the car. The purpose of the device is for that person that is notified to be able to go as quick as possible and get the child out of the vehicle in extreme conditions(temperature and kids stuck in the car). 
  The presence of a child/pet in the backseat is detected by a motion and temperature sensor. When the threshold temperature(30 degrees celsius) is reached motion will be introduced in order to test if the alarm system will trigger.
  A need for parents/guardians to detect/get notified by a device that is affordable, easy to install and not attached to the car. So that the parent/guardian can get their children/animal out of their car when they are stuck inside of it.

Title: Douze - Group 12
Desc:
Some hot summer days, or parts of the world that have intense and often extreme temperatures can and has been the culprit of numerous deaths and injuries related to heatstroke and suffocation.

Our device is designed to eliminate that risk and give parents peace of mind. Douze's hot car detection device.

With this compact device, your child will be safe from extreme temperatures, reminding the parent that their child or pet is present. A combination of the device's motor sweep sensor and a mobile application will make sure that your child or pet is accounted for.

Title: Hot Car Emergency Group 15-DFY
Desc: In this project, we design a device to save a child/pet trapped in a locked car.

Title: Backseat Buddy
Desc: This project consists of a backseat monitor to detect occupants in locked vehicles as well as issue a warning via bluetooth connected app when elevated temperatures and carbon monoxide concentrations are detected to notify rescuers.
tags: ['GNG1103/GNG1503', 'Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'Arduino Microcontroller', 'Laser Cutter', 'Soldering']

Title: Cool My Car B8
Desc: Cool my car is a device that detects, notifies, and keeps the vehicle cool in case a child is left unattended.

Title: Keeping it Cool
Desc: This product prevents passengers from being left in harmful situations. It includes a temperature sensor and alert systems to inform the guardian and people nearby of a passenger in danger.

Title: GNG2101-A10-The Next Step
Desc:
DEEN Support Services is collaborating with the University of Ottawa in the context of the GNG 2101 class to solve an accessibility problem concerning pedometers that are not designed for the visually impaired. The proposed solution is a large font pedometer to help a visually impaired individual lose weight. Our client is asking us to produce a specialized pedometer, which has all the normal pedometer features with some adjustments made for visually impaired individuals.
See The Pedometer Working!

Title: Green Beans - FA1
Desc:
Les jardinières surélevées disponibles sur le campus de l'Université d'Ottawa sont formidables, mais sont difficiles d'accès pour les personnes en fauteuil roulant et autres personnes à mobilité réduite.
L'objectif de notre équipe est de créer une jardinière accessible qui soit durable, mobile, robuste face aux intempéries hivernales et sécuritaire tout en étant dans un budget de $100.

Title: FA2 - PMI - Gestions de symptomes
Desc: Ce projet est un site web qui permet de noter les symptômes des utilisateurs ainsi que de recevoir des rappels de médicaments par courriel. Il peut être accédé a l'aide du lien suivant : https://pmi-seg2501.herokuapp.com/. Le code est disponible à : https://github.com/PMI-GNG2501/symptoms-tracker.
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'GNG2101/GNG2501']

Title: Aide à la Photographie présenté par IngeniumX
Desc:
Imaginez un policier arrive sur une scène de crime, il utilise ses deux mains afin de manier la caméra et le flash, la lumière naturelle est faible et il a de la difficulté à trouver un angle et une distance convenable menant à une bonne photo. 

L'équipe IngeniumX a résolu ce problème avec un tout nouveau prototype qui répond à tous ces besoins et facilite le travail du photographe sur la scène de crime.

Le prototype:
- Garde un angle perpendiculaire de la caméra par rapport à la surface.
- Illumine clairement la surface avec une lumière ajustable attachée à la caméra.
- S'attache facilement et solidement aux lentilles.
- Garde une distance désirée de la lentille par rapport à la surface.
- Tout cela en gardant les deux mains sur la caméra!

Spécifications du dispositif:
- Poids: 500g
- Dimensions déployée: 34 x 34 x 17 - 27 cm
- Dimensions de rangement: 34 x 34 x 5 cm
- Compatibilité: lentilles 67 et 77 mm

Spécifications de la lumière:
- Poids: 300g
- Vie de batterie: 4 heures
- Luminosité: 500 lumens
- Dimensions: 13.97 x 6.03 x 55.88 cm
- Vis d'attache 1/4''
- Piles: 3 x AA

Vidéo 360° du prototype: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_XRZ2ev77RQ

Title: Identificateur de roulement - FD10
Desc: Les employés de GBS ont besoin d’un système informatique simple, modulaire et rapide, capable d’identifier précisément ou approximativement les roulements SKF quel que soit leurs états. Le système devrait être minimaliste, bilingue et respecter les unités impériales et métriques.

Title: GNG2101 - A7 - Team 7
Desc: In the common world, people with disabilities are often put aside or even forgotten during product development. Here at Team 7, we ought to help them by creating custom-made products for the handicapped. This time, we had to create a custom foldable change table for a teenager with cerebral palsy.  We did so by creating a working foldable change table that is custom-made for that teenager based on his needs and constraints.

Title: Les Six Ingés FA3
Desc: Salut! Nous sommes l'équipe "Les Six Ingés". Notre équipe est composé des individus de différentes cultures, ouvert d'esprit, dynamiques et unique grâce à leur experience individuelle. Nous avons hâte de vous rencontrer et de vous faire part de notre produit final!

Title: GNG1503A02-FA5-Dispositif de caméra
Desc:
1. Les investigateurs policiers ont besoin de photographier des empreintes et autres évidence à une distance, luminosité et angle parfait. À l’aide d’un dispositif ajustable qui s’attache à la caméra sur la lentille, il sera possible de prendre une photo au lieu de plusieurs à multiples reprises.
2. Notre solution au problème est un dispositif qui s'attache à la lentille de la caméra, qui a 2 lumière LED qui font rotation autours de la lentille, ainsi que 3 bâtons télescopiques pour assurer la distance et l'angle de 90 degrés avec la surface d'indice.
3. Notre projet devrais coûter environ 62$
4. La partie la plus difficile est la construction du dispositif à l'aide des différents morceaux.
tags: ["uOttawa Team Projects / Projets d'équipes uOttawa", 'GNG1103/GNG1503', '3D Printer']

Title: GNG2101-A15-Safety Squad
Desc: The client is in need of a simple personal safety application compatible with iOS that has fundamental functionalities, such as daily reminders, check-ins, customizable timers, and message alerts capable of being sent to the user’s contacts in cases of emergencies. The team is thus coding a mobile application that consists of these features to ensure the user's safety. There has been no major cost to produce this project as the development softwares used by the team members are free; however, there is an additional cost to make a SMS messaging system of 6 cents per message. When duplicating this design, it may be difficult to do so without an iOS device. The client requested an iOS application; thus, to code an iOS application, one member should have a compatible device. The code can be found in the project files; however, the designer must copy and paste those files in a flutter project in order to work.

Title: GNG1503-D03-FD11-Identification de roulement
Desc:
Le propriétaire de General Bearing Services, Mitch Bouchard, a besoin d’un outil informatique simple d’utilisation qui sera utilisé par
son personnel afin d’optimiser leur temps lors de l’identification de différents types de roulements lorsqu’un client arrive avec un roulement.

Ainsi, un programme pouvant être utilisé à l'aide d'une caméra sera développé afin d'identifier les roulements les plus similaires à celui devant être identifié. La caméra pourra mesurer les dimensions intérieures et extérieures du roulement tandis-que les autres caractéristiques du roulement pourront être inscrites manuellement par l'utilisateur.

Un budget de 50$ CA sera respecté lors du développement du programme et du support de caméra.

Afin de bien identifier les dimensions du roulement à l'aide d'appareil photo, le roulement devra se situer dans dans le 3/4 inférieur de la photo, tandis-que l'objet servant d'échelle, telle qu'une pièce de 5¢, devra se trouver dans le 1/4 supérieur de la photo.
Par ailleurs, l'image utilisée devrait avoir le moins d'ombrage que possible pour que le programme puisse identifier le roulement avec le plus de précision que possible.

Title: GNG2101 A09 Fidget Project Fidgets On The Loose
Desc: F.O.T.L (Fidgets On The Loose), is an innovating team that is currently in the process of designing leading edge fidget toys. Our goal is to create a single fidget toy that would meet the needs of everyone to help manage conditions such as ADHD or ADD.

Title: GNG2101 - A8 - BRAKEthrough Solutions
Desc: The client needs a safe and reliable remote braking system for his son’s pediatric gait trainer, the R82 Crocodile. It can be activated from a distance to let him practice walking independently—most existing brakes are manual and require the guardian to be within arms reach. This will be achieved by having a Bluetooth remote activation of a linear actuator and stopper.

Title: Para Transpo Scheduling
Desc:

Muhammad Muizz Zafar | 300186804
Jack Kuijpers | 300190938

Justin Zoorob | 300174393

Title: Polaris - GNG2101 - B33 - Library Wayfinding Application
Desc: This application is designed for the University of Ottawa Morisset library, providing live path navigation through both visual and auditory feedback. The design takes into consideration a range of disabilities including visual and auditory impairments as well as assists new students to navigate through the library. The simple user interface allows for easy navigation throughout the application and the bilingual, as well as the dark mode and text to speech features, allow for easy accessibility for all students.
tags: ["uOttawa Team Projects / Projets d'équipes uOttawa", 'GNG2101/GNG2501', 'Mobile Development / Developpement Mobile', 'Course-related Projects / Projets reliés a des cours', 'Arduino Microcontroller']

Title: THE HAZARDS - Guiding Cane B32
Desc:
About This Project
  • Due to the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic, visually impaired individuals are not able to safely receive the navigation aid they could previously have due to social distancing regulations. Before the pandemic, individuals would be able to link arms with a navigator allowing them to travel safely in difficult-to-navigate spaces (grocery store, outdoor trails). This created a need for a companion guiding cane that allows users to receive navigation aid while still maintaining social distancing.

Problem Statement
  • The client requires an intuitive, compact, and portable guiding cane which allows visually impaired individuals to receive navigation aid from others that ensures the user is able to oblige by social distancing restrictions implemented due to COVID-19.

Title: Heart Rate Analysis GNG2101 Group Pi or B31
Desc: The following documentation outlines the work of GNG2101|Group :'PI' (B31) in their Heart rate analysis project.
tags: ["uOttawa Team Projects / Projets d'équipes uOttawa", 'Health Sciences / Sciences de la santé', 'GNG2101/GNG2501']

Title: Pippette Sorter
Desc: These files create a pippette sorter for 10microliter pippettes.

Title: Annota Mobile - Mobile Note Transcription - Team Z6
Desc:
Our client requires a mobile application capable of digitizing and organizing a variety of handwritten notes for both research purposes and day-to-day life. This application enables the user to transcribe any form of text by taking a picture of it. The transcription is then saved and organized into specific categories which enables the user to search their past transcriptions in a variety of ways (by date, text content, user comments, categories, etc.). Furthermore, the application includes a to-do style list which can notify the user of pending tasks based on both time and their location. 
The only cost associated with this project is Google's API usage fee which depends on the numbers of requests generated by the application.

Title: GNG2101 - Group Z3 - Excel Injection Tracker - Summer 2021
Desc: Our project is a custom made injection tracker created using a macro based Excel file. Please feel free to continue this project and build upon it; just remember to credit this team.

Title: GNG2101-Z2--MakerMove
Desc:
In order to help further relieve and understand the user’s Hypermobility Spectrum Disorder (HSD), our mobile application periodically notifies, recommends exercises, and provides a system to track their pain over time.

We have used Android Studio and Java. Take a look at our GitHub Repository for all our application/code progress, work, changes, and history: 
[ https://github.com/Marco-Cen/Movement-Reminder ]

The current state of our android application remains free, but may be subject to additional fees with further usage if the database is extended to the cloud and synced up; we are using the service of MongoDB for our database, specifically MongoDB Realm. Currently, the database is local and specifically stored on that device/emulator being used to run the application. With MongoDB Realm, if the database is extended to cloud-sync, other services of MongoDB could be used such as the data visualization tool MongoDB Charts; cloud syncing the database to MongoDB Realm in the cloud has the pay model of pay as you need. (There is a free limit of resources that refreshes monthly provided to users each month)

[Note: This is a proof of concept where data is retained in a database. Our application mainly simplifies the process of collecting data from the user, where additional features are merely additional]

Title: GNG2102 - Z5 - Medication Dispenser
Desc:
For our project we used the iterative engineering design process. We also used effective tools learned in class such as elements of the design thinking model. 

          Our client has ADHD and is required to take medication on a daily basis. This task proves challenging to her because of the symptoms of her learning disability (her memory). Through our client meetings, we were able to better understand our clients needs. With this information we were able to develop the following problem statement: 

          Design, for those who have memory retention, and attention difficulties, a smart pill case that eases the pill taking process by 
             a.    organizing the medication, and
             b.    giving reminders
all while being economically advantageous to similar products on the market.

To complete this project you will need:
   -   6X AAA batteries and a holder for the batteries
   -   28BYJ-48 stepper motor
   -   IR LED and Receiver
   -   2X LED lights (yellow and red)
   -   Pololu A-star 328 pb
   -   Laser cutter (+ cutting materials)
   -   3D printer (+ Filament)
   -    A button
   -    2X 100 Ohm resistor
   -    180 Ohm resistor
   -  1/8" MDF board

Title: Automatic Slide Transcriber - GNG2101 - D01 - D4
Desc:
The client finds that they are spending too much time on note taking. Since the notes are always unrecognized to be copied, they are in need of a software that can convert their notes into a simple text format in a reasonable amount of time. 


The following concept is at a high-level, what we initially plan to prototype for the client. It will allow the client to perform the following features:

  • Import Class Notes into the application to be transcribed, and


  • Select a target directory to be used for saving files


In an effort to make the application easy for the customer to use, the amount of setup required by the user will be minimal and it will have very specific choices for the user in the graphical user interface. It’s majority of its functionality is abstracted away from the user so they will need to know specifics about the application, only what to “input” and what to expect as “output”

Title: GNG1503-FB04-CAAE
Desc:
Due aux difficultés des méthodes courantes (mauvais résultats, requièrent trop de ressources, etc.), notre client Daniel Deschamps nous a demandé de concevoir un prototype pour les mesures d'angle d’entrée d'un projectile sur une surface robuste de façon rapide, précise, exacte et abordable pour les policiers et détectives.

Pendant la phase de l’empathie, nous avons récolté des besoins du client en utilisant la mentalité du débutant, et les avons interprétés sous forme de critères de conception pour ensuite former l'énoncé du problème . Suivant ceci, nous avons effectué des remues méninges tout en ne portant aucun jugement. Finalement , en appliquant une matrice décisionnelle comparant 3 modèles proposés lors du remue-méninges , celui-ci à démontrer que le CAAE était le meilleur concept. Suite à cette prise de décision, nous sommes passés aux prototypes . 

Le Capteur d'Angle Azimut et d'Élevation ou (CAAE) est le future pour la prise de mesures ballistiques. Cette méthode utilise un Arduino UNO R3 qui communique à un capteur BNO055 afin d'imprimer les mesures sur un écran LCD. 

Composantes:
- BNO055 
- Arduino Uno R3 (interchangeable avec arduino nano)
- Imprimant 3D
- LCD 1602
- Pile à 9

Title: BeEco
Desc:
The project of “Waste Management” was a project assigned to the teams by the client Mitch Bouchard. Mitch Bouchard is part of a family business in the field of mechanical part supply. This project has a goal of improving the quality of recyclables and decreasing waste in landfills by creating a system to assist people in sorting their recyclables properly. Though many individuals believe that recycling is enough to make a change in the world this is not the case when looked at on a large scale. Many recyclables are missorted and end up in landfills and/or shipped overseas to countries that have more room for landfills than Canada does. In fact, many people do not know how to recycle and opt for throwing everything into the garbage instead resulting in further pollution in our environment. Creating a product to help people learn and understand how to sort their recyclables and garbage easily could help in the big picture of managing and reducing the amount of waste on the planet.  

The team has designed BeEco a webpage to help the users sort their recycling accurately. The product was developed using IBM Watson Visual Recognition to train the website to recognize the material the object is made of. Then the coding algorithm would indicate the correct bin from the material identified.

Title: GNG2101 Team D1 - BAPN Designers - Mealtime
Desc:
In this design project, our team was entrusted with producing a mealtime carbohydrate tracking application for diabetic users that will regulate their diabetic conditions and increase harm-reduction efforts amongst all users.

The main priority that was established at the beginning of the design process was that first and foremost, we needed to empathize with our client and truly understand their needs and wants.

The design of our mobile application is that of an ADD-friendly one created using MIT App Inventor that allows the user to input up to 5 meals and for each of these meals, the resultant carbohydrate contents (sugars, starches and fibers) are displayed for the user to see. This data is then stored in the app. The user can select from four different meal categories; breakfast, lunch, snack and dinner. The user can also view their past meal history, all given personal information, and can take note of their meal history data and send that to their healthcare professionals, for further analysis of one's diabetic conditions. All in all, our app will help aid in regulating many diabetic users' lives. 

The cost to make the app was $0 and is free-to-use. Some struggles that one might face in replicating our design are creating complex functions such as the addition of Bluetooth (Wi-Fi-independency), not exceeding the maximum storage capabilities, and making the app aesthetically pleasing to view. Since App Inventor is free-to-use, it does not have the visual appeal that other app designing programs have.

Please note that the attached .aia file contains the app's source code and is the one to be edited in the App Inventor web application, while the .apk file only allows for viewing the app when downloaded onto one's computer or mobile device. Detailed instructions for sharing and downloading/running the application are listed in the link below.
 
http://appinventor.mit.edu/explore/ai2/share#:~:text=Sharing%20your%20app%20for%20use&text=apk%20file)%20by%20going%20to,the%20email%20from%20their%20phone.

The members of our team include:

Abdel Baig

Ansh Patel

Benjamin Akkinusi

Bora Baskaya

Dylan Neil

Title: Fog Off
Desc:
During the Covid-19 pandemic it has proven difficult for some people to properly wear a mask, especially with glasses. The mask and glasses combo can cause individuals' glasses to fog up impending their vision. This contributes to raised possibilities of contracting the virus (due to improper wearing of masks so that they can see) and as a result tightened anxiety. 

This is where *Fog Off! can help, keeping your glasses clear of fog for no more Fo*ging problems!
This device is in two pieces, one to be adhered to the face under the mask and one attached once the mask has been placed on ones face. The apparatus keeps glasses from fogging and improves the overall fit of the mask. *Fog Off! is reusable and can be simply washed with soap and water!

Title: GNG1103-D6-Diamond Hands
Desc:
~Problem Statement:
JAMZ drone delivery requires a method of detecting violent shaking that continuously transmits accurate data relevant to the status of the package until delivered to the customer

~Summary of Solution
Using an MPU6050 6 axis gyroscope/ accelerator to record positional data relevant to the package in transport, feeding data to the onboard computer and alert the customer if their package has been shaken.

~Cost
 Wires $3.13
 Logic Converter $9.95
 MPU6050 $3.32
 Arduino Uno $32.99
 Raspberry Pi $53.96
 Total $103.35

~Challenges
Calibrating MPU6050
 Drift
 Self calibration
UART communication VIA GPIO
 Raspberry Pi permissions
 Installation of proper libraries

GitHub link for appropriate files:
https://github.com/OhYesMeLikey/GNG1103_G6_ProjectCodeFiles

Title: GNG1103D8SAAND
Desc:
-Problem Statement
JAMZ Automated Delivery needs accurate data on their product's temperature and humidity to be constantly transmitted to their drone operator in all stages of the order from the payload to customer reception
-Summary of Proposed Solution
The main goal of this project is to develop a reliable solution that generates information about the content of the package during delivery. The device should provide valid and consistent data on the temperature and humidity of the food and send a warning to the drone’s microcontroller (Raspberry Pi) when the conditions inside the package are not ideal.
-Total Cost
   $68.54
-Challenges
Since we did not have much experience with the code, we had to spend a lot of time on it.
-Description of Design Files
From deliverable B to K, we have uploaded 10 files in total, including 7 of them are design files and 2 are presentation files. The one we did not upload, Deliverable A, is uncorrelated with our design. The final one is Deliverable K that is the user and product manual. Other Deliverables between A and K are the processes and prototypes for the product.

https://cad.onshape.com/documents/3cb60712ab82f7623b835fe5/w/bad75c53562fb0357d9b2eb4/e/9a89ea161b9b1b6d95486da4

Title: GNG1103-D-Drone Delivery- team 13
Desc: This project was given to us by JAMZ a drone delivery company catering to local towns and cities by Ottawa, ON. JAMZ has given us a task to create subsystems for their drone delivery services. We as a team(Team 13 0 Oscar Black) will divide up tasks between us and create the necessary subsystems as well as submit the desired deliverables for this class.

Title: FLAB Mat
Desc: The FLAB mat is a modular, versatile, rubber mat designed for the harshest Canadian winters. Its simplicity and durability are suited for all conditions. Ease of repairability is highlighted in this design. The mat can be completely opened up to access the heating cable embedded inside. Made from simple materials, this mat is a low-risk design that will always get the job done. Its simplicity, durability, and ease of use are like nothing else on the market.

It is to be installed in high traffic areas and emergency exits at the University of Ottawa; this solution does not compromise safety or functionality. This device will protect the environment while still allowing the solution to be modular and scalable as seen fit by clients.

Title: The Sixth Sense - All in One Module
Desc:
Problem Statement: 

  • JAMZ requires a climate sensor, shake alarm, anti-theft system and beacon that measures and transmits consistent and accurate data. The module must be safe, inexpensive, lightweight and compact.

Our Solution:

  • GNG1103 group D15, The Sixth Sense provides a violent shake, temperature and humidity sensors, an emergency beacon and anti-theft system. All this while being under $50, waterproof, light weight, accurate and providing a large amount of flagship data. 

What Sets Us Apart 

  • Not only do we offer a solution that covers all 4 of JAMZ's needs, but we have gone to great lengths to ensure the module is user-friendly, easy to update and fix, all while having the best parts for the lowest price.
  • In addition, we at the Sixth Sense have delicately and thoughtfully considered elements requested by the client that many other groups have ignored such as: soldering our components for a stronger and more secure connection, a voltage pull down converter to take the 44V volts given by JAMZ and reducing it to a much more manageable 5V, and finally as to not overload JAMZ's onboard raspberry Pi with unnecessary data we decided to send a flag indicator to warn the operator if there is a problem rather than all the raw data. 

Technical Notes 

  • Weight Analysis (Kg)
Sensor Module  | 0.046682286
Arduino Module  | 0.067932716
Wires and Step down converter  | 0.107540864
Total | 0.222155866

  • RGB LED Colour Indicator Key
Red - Shake
Blue - Temperature 
Yellow - Humidity 
Mix - Multiple 
White - All or beacon

Title: GNG1103-F3-SupahHawtFiyah
Desc:
Problem Statement: It is suspected that the sodium chloride salt used for uOttawa’s winter maintenance is potentially reducing the service life of campus infrastructure and damaging the environment. The University requires a cost-effective and less damaging alternate solution.

Solution: ROLLABLE HEATED SIDEWALKS
Cost: 100$

Title: GNG1103-F12-Wolf Fifth
Desc:
Jonathan Rausseo, Officer of Campus Sustainability at the University of Ottawa conveys a need to have a cost-effective alternative to removing snow and ice from walkways and sidewalks that is either rollable or modular, lightweight and easy to store.

Our team tackled this problem by coming up with a modular heated sidewalk. The sidewalk features a central, self automated control system that controls the heating of the sidewalk. 

The sidewalk is very grippy due to the material that is used and is also very durable. In fact, the material is recyclable making it environmentally friendly. The material also has channels, allowing for water channelling in order to prevent ice/water accumulation on top.

As mentioned, the sidewalk is scalable and modular. This is because the sidewalks feature easy magnetic and water tight electrical connections. Therefore, it is very easy to attach multiple units. 

The sidewalk is also accessible and inclusive as an end piece is designed to have a slight ramp to it. This makes it easy for people using things like scooters or wheelchairs to get easily on and off the sidewalk.

Title: JAMZ- Group A13 GNG1103 Project
Desc:
This project was completed in our GNG1103 class for clients JAMZ a drone delivery service to promote contactless delivery during the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic. The members of this team were Maurice Hartlieb, Mathieu Lagacé-O’Connor, Brad Cole, and Jean Gaster.

Our overall was to provide the JAMZ delivery service with a simplistic and user-friendly interface for their drone delivery app. This app will coordinate with the drone to help users access and use it without difficulty. The app is designed to inform users of any trouble with the delivery of their package, real-time tracking of the drone, and the ability for users to customize their interface with personal favorites. This app will be used to order food, track the delivery drone, and lastly allow the user to confirm delivery. Although the app is not entirely complete we have attached the reports and progress of our project.

The User Guide attached will help individuals recreate our work using the application Android Studios. (The link attached below are clips on how the app will work)

Title: Node 14 - SensAct User Interface
Desc:
Node-14 is a customizable User Interface that allows patients to communicate with their surroundings and others. The previous interface was implemented with Java and complicated with overwhelming options that requires some technical and electronic background knowledge to navigate. 
Without access to a simple User interface, it will become extremely difficult for a healthcare professional to navigate and set up the desired configuration for a patient to use. We have developed a simple and intuitive user interface that will allow healthcare workers to easily navigate and set up the required accessibility devices for disabled patients. It is customized based on the patient's needs and takes an average of only 4 clicks to get to the desired outcome. Our solution will increase both work efficiency and patient comfort which is absolutely necessary in hospitals and other healthcare facilities.

Title: GNG2101 - Wio Link User Interface E24
Desc:
Problem Statement:

St. Vincent hospital has expressed a need for an accessible, user friendly system that enables patients with disabilities to communicate with medical staff and interact with their environment using their everyday devices. 

Our Solution:

The general structure of the product includes a user interface that was coded using Node-Red in order to ensure simplicity within the design. The interface has a simple two menu function. The first menu includes the client’s interface; it displays a “call nurse” button, a technical support button and the input option(s) pre-selected by the nurse to fit the needs of the patient.

Pitch: https://youtu.be/FxpsTK9auF8

Title: GNG1103-A14-JAMZ Food Delivery Application
Desc:
Problem Statement:

JAMZ needs a modern, simple and easy-to-navigate drone food-delivery service application targeted toward rural areas outside of Ottawa who have limited access to other food-delivery services.

The solution we bring forth is a phone application that allows users to quickly and easily order food from their phone. Taking inspiration from popular food delivery apps such as SkipTheDishes and Uber Eats, and using the development platform Thunkable, we have created an app that is intuitive for veterans and newcomers alike. With many features that allow for the personalization and ease-of-use such as an account page, an order history, a shopping cart, etc..., this app best suits the needs of the suburban and rural population with it minimalistic and accesible design.

This project has cost no money.

If this project were to be duplicated, many difficulties would be faced in recreating the design as Thunkable is not the most customizable platform, though as this project is public, it could be directly duplicated to obtain an identical version. It is also noted that when working with Thunkable, it would be preferable to adjust size by percentage and not by pixel as Thunkable develops for every phone and every phone has different dimensions.

It is important to note that Wix has several constraints, therefore our team would suggest to test the functionalities of Wix in the beginning to get a sense of the feasibility of ideas.

Title: Plantastique Planteur intelligent Équipe SALSA FA12 Arrosage automatique Éclairage spécialisé Communication avec utilisateur
Desc:
Énoncé du problème : L’Université d’Ottawa est à la recherche de planteurs qui surveillent l’humidité du sol et qui s’ajustent au besoin afin d’éviter un arrosage manuel fréquent. En plus de garder les plantes en bonne santé, ces planteurs sont conçus pour être sanitaires, sécuritaires et esthétiques afin d’améliorer l’ambiance des espaces d’étude des étudiants. 

Notre solution est un planteur qui utilise la technologie d'arrosage automatique à pompe, un système de communication par WiFi et un système de luminosité pour garder deux plantes pothos en santé pour au moins deux semaines consécutives. Ces sous-systèmes sont connectés par l'intermédiaire de la technologie Arduino. 

Le budget pour ce projet est de 100 $.

Title: Food Delivery Website for JAMZ A3
Desc: In these files, we have identified the necessary folders that will allow the reproduction of our html pages for the website. We have also added a user-manual file (Deliverable K)

Title: GNG1503-Planteur autonome universel de uOFLOW-A14
Desc:
Jonathan Rausseo, gérant du développement durable à l’Université d’Ottawa, veut implémenter des jardinières autour du campus qui sont peu coûteuses, élégantes et faciles à entretenir pour améliorer l’esthétique des édifices et du campus, la santé mentale et la qualité d’air. Pour ce faire, nous avons conçu un prototype qui peut alimenter une plante de façon autonome. Notre concept peut être ajouté à un pot de fleurs conventionnel suffisamment grand et alimentera la plante sans interaction humaine.

Avec uOFLOW, tout planteur peut être un planteur autonome/automatisé. Facile à installer, facile à entretenir, le système pour tous, même ceux qui n’ont pas le pouce vert!

Title: Jardinière Intelligente - GNG1503 FA15
Desc: L’administrateur du développement durable de l'université d’Ottawa a besoin d’augmenter la verdure dans les édifices afin d’établir des espaces qui améliorent l’esthétique intérieure, la qualité d’air et la santé mentale des étudiants peu importe la saison de l’année. Il demande donc de concevoir des jardinières compactes, simples, économiques, sécuritaires et belles qui sont intégrées avec un système automatisé capable d’entretenir la santé de tout type de plantes.

Title: Jardinière de léquipe FA11
Desc:
Il nous a été demandé ,dans le cadre de ce cours, la conception d’une jardinière pour l'université d'Ottawa par Monsieur Jonathan Rausseo du bureau du développement durable. 


La jardinière , dont la conception nous a été demandée , requiert un arrosage fiable et autonome , un point assez important serait que ce dernier de nécessite que très peu de visites de contrôle, maximum une par semaine. Aussi à tout cela devrait être incorporé un moyen de s’assurer du bon développement des plantes et éviter donc leur fanaison. 


Notre produit est donc une jardinière munie d’un système d’arrosage qui serait calibré par la plante elle même afin de rendre notre concept plus efficace en terme d’autonomie. 


Aussi nous avons décidé de supprimer toute électronique de notre conception car le capteur d'humidité n’aura plus lieu d'être étant donné que la plante se nourrit d'elle-même au besoin, donc plus besoin d’alerte de quoi que ce soit si ce n’est du vide du réservoir, un point sur lequel nous réfléchissons présentement. Ce concept sera aussi durable, eco-friendly et de meilleure qualité. 


Notre conception se différencie des autres de par sa Simplicité, son efficacité, et son caractère peu couteux.

Title: GNG2101-E23-PiMenu
Desc:
The Pi Menu is a product created by team E23 under the supervision of Bocar N’diaye. This is our approach to facilitating the use of smart devices for those affected by limited mobility. 

The Pi Menu is an accessibility application that includes 3 main features. It enables users with accessibility needs to check and respond to their emails, listen to music, and watch videos with minimal physical efforts and 3rd party assistance.
It includes clean, clutter free visuals, which makes it easy to maneuver through the application. Additionally, minimal clicking id required to navigate through the application. 

There is currently no other product on the market that compares to the Pi Menu.

GitHub link: https://github.com/sebastiengrd/pi-menu-E23
