Title: DAM engineering - Jardinière FA3
Desc: Le projet conciste en la conception d'une jardinière avec un système d'entretien et d'arrosage automatique.

Title: GNG1503-GroupeA8-La Jardinière Autonome
Desc:
Notre projet nait de la demande d'un client souhaitant avoir plus d'espace vert tout en ayant aucune contrainte et à un cout abordable. Nous avons donc pensé au concept d'une "jardinière autonome". Cette dernière a la capacité d'analyser le sol grace à un capteur d'humidité relié à un circuit Arduino. Mais aussi, elle est dotée d'un système d'arrosage automatique. Son style est épuré et chic et est composé de bois et d'une boite plastique pour contenir les plantes. A cela s'ajoute une petite boite pour contenir l'Arduino et ses cables.
Tout ceci pour la coquette somme de 100$. Le plus difficile pour ce projet serait d'abord la réalisation matérielle car à cause de la situation on a pas pu la concrétiser. Ensuite, la mise en place d'un code pour l'Arduino peut s'avérer fastidieux. Mais il ne faut pas être un craque pour y arriver. Alors courage!

Title: GNG 1103-B3-DevelopU
Desc:
View BIM systems in VR to help Elis Don employee understand drawings and plans on constructions sites.

Assets folder for our project: 
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1aGR5TQQNhaYFcSDRSksT3pVAs0ckcW1K?usp=sharing

Title: B8 GNG 1103 AR construction project United INC
Desc: Pellucid is an application created to facilitate construction work. Offering multiple useful functionalities for use on site or from home, Pellucid lets users see their work through an AR camera to help them better visualize their projects. The application is free of use and accessible to anyone using IOS or android devices.

Title: VizBIM
Desc:
In construction, the translation from 3D CAD drawings to 2D blueprints and back to a 3D building can cause needless errors and take time. VizBIM uses AR technology and the Unity software to skip the 2D transition and load Building Information Models directly into the real world using every day cell phones. This project was free to make, using free assets in the Unity store. Possible launching points to continue this project are marrying the front end and back end, adding opacity sliders for the layers, and getting the application onto a mobile device.

Created by Fall 2020 GNG 1103 Group B04

Title: JAND-AR Construction - Team B5
Desc: EllisDon and the Canadian Construction Association need a solution that will allow a construction team on site to easily view multidisciplinary Building Information Models in VR/AR on a mobile device. They require a free, extremely user friendly, and easily compatible software.

Title: Augmented Reality Construction - ARC B10
Desc: ARC is an application created for EllisDon Construction that allows construction workers to view all aspects of 3-D Building Information Models (BIM), including mechanical, electrical, structural and architectural systems in Augmented Reality. The application is user friendly and accessible on IOS and Android devices.

Title: GNG1103A-A15-JAMZ delivery
Desc:
Problem Statement: Design a simple-to-use futuristic UI application for a state-of-the-art autonomous drone delivery service. This will contain an interactive map to track the drone delivery and digital menus for available restaurants.

Solution: Our team created a user interface in the form of a website to allow businesses to advertise their products and for customers to purchase these products.

Cost: The total cost of this project was $28 CAD. This money was used to purchase the Squarespace business plan.

Important Details: Website domain will not be available after December 5th, 2020

URL: https://jamz-drone-delivery.squarespace.com/
To request admin abilities: Please email- nmera043@uottawa.ca

Title: Jardinière intelligente - Les Jardiniers A2
Desc: Un planteur intelligent conçu à l’aide de matériaux durable et ininflammables, capables d’auto-arroser et d’analyser le niveau d’humidité du sol. Ce planteur  incorpore un système anti-vol, tout en maintenant un coût abordable.

Title: Exo-Boot E11
Desc: A prosthetic mounting device that will allow for simulation and testing of prosthetic feet with a quick connection piece that will allow for rapid prosthetic swaps. Exo-Boot will accommodate for different prosthetic feet with a height adjustment mechanism to change the height of each device.

Title: GNG1103B6 AR Project by Futurlistic
Desc: A major issue in the construction industry is its lack of technology, resulting in a decrease in productivity and communication while newer projects are increasing in complexity. This project was created with the purpose of implementing augmented reality technology into the construction industry to improve productivity, ease of work and communication between the company and its employees. Using the Unity software, we created a free application that the client will be able to use to view 3D models of the building plans on any mobile device. Some difficulties that we faced while creating the application are: spawning a large building with decent graphics and implementing toggle effects.

Title: E13 - Simple Remind
Desc: A simple reminder app directed towards users with ADHD or other cognitive impairments that cause them to be easily distracted

Title: Mealtime Calculator A13
Desc: The Mealtime Calculator App or 'DiaBEATes' is an application designed to help monitor the users health through the tracking of food consumed, exercise, sleep, and more. The app is intended for users with diabetes as it is capable of tracking and estimating a users blood sugar level. Furthermore, it has several reminder functions built into the application to aid the user in their busy life. Reminding them about taking medicine, eating proper meals, or even recording extra condiments that one may forget. We are going to cover it all.

Title: SmartPlant FA5
Desc:
projet GNG1505 équipe A05. 


Notre projet consiste d'un contenant électronique. Un système d'engrenage permet d'abaisser la plante pour la faire tremper dans un bassin d'eau. Plusieurs capteurs sont installés pour surveiller de l'état de vie de la plante, signaler un vol de plante, alerter quand il n'y a plus d'eau, etc. L'interface pour pouvoir se connecter à notre système est via une application smartphone (Blink). L'utilisateur, grâce à son téléphone, peut recevoir les données de signe vitaux et contrôler combien de temps il veut laisser la plante dans l'eau . Une fois le temps écoulé, le système mécanique remonte la plante pour faire sortir ce dernier hors du bassin.

Pour plus d'informations, veuillez consulter notre PDF - livrable K

SmartPlant vidéo :
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DWWggbIw0kzzMCSscogrn8uCv9zrlur5/view?usp=sharing
tags: ['Course-related Projects', 'Internet of Things', 'Mobile Development', 'GNG1103/GNG1503', 'Drill press', 'Arduino Microcontroller', '3D Printer']

Title: KITGO - Jardinière FA1
Desc: GNG1503 - Équipe A01

Title: LES JARDIGÉNIES FA9
Desc:
L’université a besoin d’une jardinière d’intérieure munie d’un système d’auto-arrosage et de maintien des plantes durable, sécuritaire, flexible et à un coût raisonnable qui peut être placé partout sur le campus. 
 
Nous proposons un système largement autonome doté d’une haute technologie, d’un système unique et innovant ainsi qu'une poudre révolutionnaire qui changera l’approche de plantation des plantes à l’université pour le meilleur avec un prix total ne dépassant pas 100$.

Title: GNG2501 FA22 Traitement de douleur chronique accessible
Desc:
Dr. Hillel Finestone, physiatre spécialiste en médecine physique et réadaptation, a besoin d’un système électronique bilingue, facile à utiliser qui lui permettra d’établir un échange fluide d’informations avec ces patients. Ce système, sous forme de page web ou d’application, permettra aussi un suivi client organisé qui peut, au besoin, être transféré à d’autres spécialistes de la santé.

 Cette plateforme sera importante pour les médecins et leur clinique dans le but qu’ils puissent épargner du temps autrement consacrer à documenter et à remplir les questionnaires médicaux. Elle permettra au docteur d’offrir un meilleur traitement en recevant plus d’informations sur les symptômes des patients souffrant de douleurs chroniques, même avant leur visite dans la clinique. Un questionnaire électronique fera également en sorte que le suivi et l’interaction entre le docteur et le patient est concrète et accessible rapidement lorsque nécessaire. 

Quant au cout nous somme limites a 50$CAD. Ce projet nécessite en grande partie de la connaissance en javascript et HTML, pour réaliser le site web et l'application.

Title: GNG2501-FA21 - Ambu-bag controller
Desc: Controlleur d'ambu-bag qui guide l'utilisateur a utiliser le dispositif a l'aide de LED.

Title: Helpo - Your Photoshop Assistant A3
Desc:
Photoshops landscape is large, confusing, and difficult to learn for disabled artists. Helpo is a photoshop assistant designed to increase the digital art app's accessibility through interactive tool select feedback, voice commands, and a physical tool keyboard. The project could be built for less than $40. Groups trying to replicate this project should watch out for the scope of the project; it's very easy to forget about one area when progress is being made in another. Possible steps forward include: improving the colour picker design while keeping it accessible (no colour cloud), adding the option for line smoothing, a cleaner integration into the photoshop interface, the ability to select specific brush sizes and colours from Helpo directly, and the ability to select favourite tools or brushes.

If you want to use this software, please download the Helpo_8.zip and Helpo.xml files. Unzip the .zip file and run the installer. To load up a profile, go to the top right, select load, and select the Helpo.xml file.

Made by Fall 2020 GNG 2101 - Accessible Digital Drawings Group A3. Made possible using GAVPI software.

Title: GNG2101-B34-MANA
Desc:
Manager for Audio Notification Accessibility. A GNG2101B34 Team Project.

Group Members: Michael Kagnew, Joseph Francis, Fatimah Vakily, Gabriel Cordovado, Emma Ballantyne, and Jasmine Kokkat


The client is a legally blind graphic artist who seeks software which can read notifications and messages to him; the client is looking for a smarter application than the ones currently available to him. Our solution is MANA, an Android application, which reads incoming messages aloud in two languages, English and Spanish. 

MANA costs $6 for a monthly subscription and $50 for a yearly subscription. When working with our application, it may be difficult to make it more secure and integrate more apps that can have notifications read aloud. Expanding on features in Google Assistant may be difficult due to the limited documentation as well.

https://github.com/GNGB34/accessible-messaging-droid

Title: LiftSmart FA36
Desc: LiftSmart est un dispositif qui aide les athlètes et utilisateurs de salles d'entraînements à visualiser plusieurs métriques telles que la puissance générée et le trajet de la barre dans le cadre d’un entraînement avec haltère.

Title: GNG2101 eAnnotate B22
Desc:
The software annotation project was made in order to facilitate note-taking and research. It is an open-source software implemented using React and Node.js that is able to link notes and ideas together efficiently.

To install the software, simply click on the file titled "eAnnotate Setup 0.1.0.exe" in the project files on this page.

Title: GNG 2501 Video Argumentaire FA23
Desc: Groupe 2,3 Recherche par mots clés intelligents

Title: SeeTech- Nearsight A7
Desc: The client requires a portable device that detects the automatic buttons and performs hands free activation. Nearsight is easy to use, sustainable in low-light settings, harsh weather conditions and cost effective for low vision and blind users.

Title: GNG2101-E22-Google Chrome Magnifier
Desc: Our project is a google chrome extension that helps to zoom in to help people who have visual impairments. We found a simple solution by taking a screenshot of the web site and zoom into that screenshot. Making magnification software may sound easy but actually, it is so hard because the website is constantly changing and the code has to track all of the data plus the mouse pointer. This will be the biggest problem and that's why we are taking a screenshot. This is a code-based project so the project cost is zero dollars.

Title: E14 SensAct User interface
Desc: https://youtu.be/MtcdctcrutM

Title: Soutien en santé mental pour 20Q FA25
Desc: La santé mentale prend de plus en plus d'importance et de nombreuses organisations essaient d'être proactives et de trouver des moyens d'aider les gens. Ce client cherche un moyen de comprendre les besoins des Canadiens et de communiquer avec eux pour leur fournir un soutien adéquat. Notre tâche consiste à concevoir une application qui collectera des informations de ses utilisateurs sur leur santé mentale, est capable d'envoyer des mises à jour d'informations personnalisées régulières, de fournir un jeu de soulagement de l'anxiété et enfin de mettre en œuvre une fonctionnalité de connexion qui pourrait être en mesure de connecter les personnes qui demandent de l'aide avec ceux qui offrent.

Title: GNG2101-B11-AimEye
Desc:
People with a low to high visual impairment are in need of an assistive device, or application to aid their use of smart technology. This device should include voice recognition technology, screen selection readers, availability in multiple languages, and should be compatible with other devices and their applications.

Our Solution is AimEye, a multi-platform screen reader and device navigation application. AimEye reads text on screens, allows for voice commands to navigate the device, and allows for voice-to-text messages in external appliactions.

AimEye costs $30.00 CAD per year.

AimEye is unique because of the unintrusive nature of how it functions on devices. By working mostly in the background without changing how the device is used, our design is hard to replicate.

Project Pitch Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hru9OVTJlI8

Title: Group E24 Pitch Video
Desc: Deliverable H Pitch Video

Title: GNG2101-A12-MultiReminder App
Desc: People with ADHD and diabetes have trouble remembering to complete important tasks and require a multi-reminder app that is highly flexible and customizable to their lifestyle. Multee gives users a highly customizable platform for their reminders.

Title: Cartus FA13
Desc: Une application mobile qui consiste d'une carte intéractive du campus qui le rend plus accessible, sécuritaire et facile à naviguer.

Title: GNG2101-B25-MacroGimp
Desc:
Problem Statement: Design a computer application that facilitates the utilization of Adobe Photoshop or GIMP tools for a person suffering from visual processing issues. 

Solution: An Electron desktop application that serves as a custom toolbar for GIMP. The buttons in the application trigger macro files and the app also has a voice search feature.

Cost: $0.00

Struggles while duplicating the design: In order to run the code of the application, Node.js and many of its modules such as Electron.js must be installed. Furthermore, a Google API Key is required for the voice search command. Finally, some preferences in GIMP must be changed.

GitHub Repository: https://github.com/hongyuewang/macrogimp

Technologies Used:
Node.js: https://nodejs.org
Electron: https://www.electronjs.org
SpeechRecognition: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition
AutoHotkey: https://www.autohotkey.com
GIMP: https://www.gimp.org

MacroGimp Download: https://mega.nz/folder/TeoGzDBa#V2v1gV2iG-ubpIgy0n3NeQ

Title: OnboardPlus E32
Desc: An updated Onboard keyboard for the rasbian/linux operating systems featuring macro's and accessibility features

Title: GNG2501-FA1-1-Affiche de réadaptation
Desc:
En discutant avec le client, notre équipe a pu écrire l'énoncé de problème suivant : Lors de la réadaptation d’un patient atteint d’un AVC, les médecins et les spécialistes en réadaptation ont remarqué que les affiches de rééducation et les programmes assignés aux patients contiennent beaucoup d’informations et nécessitent une longue lecture. Notre tâche en tant que concepteurs est d’animer cette affiche afin qu'elle soit visuellement stimulante et facile à comprendre.

La solution que nous avons conçue est un site web qui va contenir toute l'information nécessaire à la réadaptation des patients tout en étant intéractif et accessible. 

Afin de réaliser notre solution, nous avons dû louer un domaine ainsi qu'un hébergement web. Notre équipe n'a pas eu besoin de faire d'autre achât pour le produit.

Finalement, si d'autres personnes voudraient reproduire notre concept, ils devront se familiariser avec le langage HTML ainsi que l'hébergement web.

Title: NiCa Bell - Team A2
Desc:
Our team was tasked with designing a Night Call Bell for a client with a physical disability. The goal was to design a system that would hear our client say the words "help" or "hey" and then notify the support staff. This is completed with a main unit that has a microphone and a secondary unit that notifies the support staff using both sound and vibration.

Portable Unit - https://cad.onshape.com/documents/ed78a69ea3ef308ab20a157e/w/4c98f26ee61f53d2178e1fcf/e/5aa314be35a997f49a96f443
Main Unit - https://cad.onshape.com/documents/781fa509e1f747a9dba2fc59/w/1bbe2da970a0f127e7b094ee/e/bf0b2029f209a94ea48b62d1
Button Caps - https://cad.onshape.com/documents/b3bc66a59d0a0ae760b66306/w/89a2e93f01e5c93dc4b628a9/e/4d193dc719612d40ab4cc19f

Title: GNG2101-B24-Library Wayfinding
Desc:
The uOttawa Library lacks accessibility for people with visual impairments or other disabilities. We designed a wayfinding website that gives audio and visual directions to various waypoints throughout the library so that someone can easily get around. The cost of this project was $0 as everything was designed on a computer using free software. We have mapped out the directions from every way point to every other waypoint so that someone can get anywhere in the library without needing to return to an origin. This represents over 100 different combinations of directions. Using a text to speech API, we are able to bring audio cues which read the visual directions to the user. With this, we hope to make the uOttawa library more accessible to all. https://uottawawayfinding.wordpress.com

To access and edit the website, an invitation must be sent through email to become an administrator, at which point the user or client may modify the site settings and invite people on their own.

Title: GNG2101 Group A10 Accessible Digital Drawing
Desc:
A professional artist with fluctuating limitations, needs to always be able to work regardless of the physical obstacles they’re facing, to ensure that they can always produce art through an accessible* photoshop software. 

Our solution includes using Processing programming to build the drawing program from the ground up. This way, all features and specifications of the client can be met without the hinderance of unwanted features. 

The cost for this project is $0 since it is a software project based off of a free program. 

One thing to watch out for when attempting this project is trying to adapt OpenSource programs. This seemed feasible in the beginning however it became evident that this route would not be possible. Builing from the beginning is a better option.

Title: EzTrimmer B15
Desc: Our design aims to cut people to nails for them. We have designed a machine that uses servos to actuate the nail trimmer around each of the toenails. It will likely require user input for control. This project has exceeded the allotted budget of $100. We've had quite a few issues trying to distill our project down into a doable thing because the initial pitch was incredibly ambitious.

Title: GNG2101-B14-Press-Ability
Desc: An accessibility switch interface.

Title: GNG2101 - Mealtime Manager Insulin Calculator App - E12
Desc:
The goal of this project is to create a mealtime insulin calculating app which has simple graphics, an easy-to-use interface, and accurate calculations which do not require many inputs.

The purpose of this app is to calculate how many units of insulin a diabetic needs to take before the meal they will be eating.

Thunkable Project - https://x.thunkable.com/copy/7a689cc2f4b06395d7fd1cac99a0f3cf

Title: GNG2101-A11-SmartTech1MinPitch
Desc:
1. Our group is to create a 1-minute video pitch to present our company and its product.
2. This project includes our groups 1-minute pitch for our company and product.
3. This video did not cost any money
4. N/A

Title: GNG2101-E31-My Stroke and Me
Desc:
Problem Statement:
The Élisabeth Bruyère Hospital needs a new and effective way to inform their stroke
patients about their current condition and how they can be more involved in their personalized
rehabilitation process. The product needs to be able to be accessed online, used by both patient
and doctor along with being easily accessible and interactive.
Solution:
To create an interactive, user-friendly website that contains stroke information including:
- Types of Strokes
- Causes of Strokes 
- Rehabilitation Processes

Title: JAMZ Delivery Website - Group A9- Drone on the LOOSE
Desc:
An HTML webpage designed for JAMZ's fast-food drone delivery service from restaurant to doorstep. Made entirely from scratch, with the use of jsfiddle.net, and firebase.google.com, google.com for images, maps, and translation. 

Please access the website via the link below: 

http://droneontheloose.club/

Title: UOWay - GNG2101 - A15 - Library Wayfinding System
Desc:
Visitors to the Morisset library, including those with disabilities, are unable to independently navigate the uOttawa library easily. A system will be designed to assist any visitor by providing them information about navigating the space and the services available.

We've developed a free wayfinding system using NFC technology to guide users to a destination within the library.

Github repo:
https://github.com/Zayood/Library-Wayfinding

Title: JAMZ Delivery Website - A08 - SpaceJAMZ
Desc: This is a website made for the JAMZ Drone delivery service by group A08. The website is built using Visual Studio in HTML, JS, CSS and uploaded on Github.

Title: The JAMZ Fam drone delivery team A10
Desc: A companion application to the clients JAMZ drone delivery service made using React Native CLI. The application has a login and a signup feature as well as the option to proceed as a guest. Entering into the explore page prompting users with the ability to search for what they would like to eat. Then there is the suggestion page, which suggests different cuisines of meals as options for the user. The selection(s) is stored in a cart and can be paid for using banking information. The order can be tracked using google maps location tracking API. Customer service component is also included.

Title: SpaceJAMZ - Group A7
Desc:
Due to the ongoing COVID-19 Pandemic, there exists a need for a reliable and safe food delivery service. JAMZ aims to solve this issue with their drone delivery food service. This project is a Wix based front end UI that has been created for our client JAMZ delivery. 

Link to Website: https://harryxu02.wixsite.com/mysite

Title: Team Aerial Vision Jamz Delivery Design Group A6
Desc:
JAMZ Food Delivery Website
GNG1103 Fall 2020 GroupA6
Created with Wix

Problem Statement: JAMZ needs a simple, sleek, and intuitive website that will allow suburban and rural users to place drone delivery food orders. The app must be capable of processing online transactions while also allowing the users to view the selected items before the order is placed as well as track the location of the drone in real-time.

Solution: Our project design team designed a user interface in the form of a website. The website allows local businesses to advertise their products and for customers to order their products through autonomous drone delivery.

Website link: https://ashaw086.wixsite.com/website

Title: Trackbite E21
Desc: An application made for diabetic patients which allows the user to input food and exercise data like nutrient amounts in pasta or the time spent biking so that the user can view trends in eating or exercise habits.

Title: FreeSpace B33
Desc: An accessible and simple solution to navigation system designed for those with visual impairments and low visibility. Includes a wearable pair of spectacles with integrated bone-conduction speakers to aid in providing direction via tones without hindering the ability to hear ones surroundings. Includes a companion application (https://github.com/murdau/FreeSpace-App)

Title: Clavier sur écran FA32
Desc:
Présentation du projet:
L'objectif du projet sera de concevoir une version améliorée d'un  clavier sur écran préalablement développé par les volontaires et les chercheurs de SVH(Saint-Vincent Hospital).
Pour ce faire nous utiliserons XML,SVG et Python qui vont nous permettre d'implémenter de nouvelles fonctionnalités au clavier susceptible de subvenir au besoins des patients.
Description du problème:
La version existante du clavier sur écran est très ancienne au point qu'elle ne subvient plus aux besoins des patients
Coût:
Un avantage est que le code de notre clavier sur écran soit en open-source ce qui réduit considérablement les coûts de production néanmoins le seuil fixé par produit est de 100$.
Défi à relevé:
le défi principal sera de comprendre le code source du clavier en place pour pouvoir trouver une manière d'ajouter et de manipuler les nouvelles fonctionnalités.

Title: GNG2501 FA3 3 Interface Wio Link
Desc: Dans le cadre de notre cours de deuxième année à l'université d'Ottawa en gestion de produits et développement en génie (GNG2501), nous avons le mandat de continuer et d'améliorer le travail du tableau de bord dans les hopitaux en créant une interface utilisateur avec les cartes Wio Link et le programme NodeRed. Nous avons un budget de 100$ pour présenter une solution intuitive à notre client. Il est important de comprendre comment le Wio Link fonctionne avec NodeRed avant même de penser développer un produit (petite astuce).

Title: B12-CallForCare
Desc:
Mainly during the night, the client needs a technical solution to use her voice to signal for help to her nurses.
Github: https://github.com/ChetanMandur/NightCallBell-GNG2102

Title: GNG2501 SensAct UI FA24
Desc:
Plusieurs patients de l'hôpital St-Vincent, à Ottawa, souffrent d’un handicap physique. Ce handicap affecte beaucoup leur capacité de mouvement. Certains n’ont qu’une motricité très limitée. 

Le problème, c’est que ce handicap les empêche de pouvoir interagir avec plusieurs appareils électroniques que nous utilisons tous les jours, que ce soit une télévision, un ordinateur, un lecteur de musique ou autre. Ces appareils faisant partie intégrale de notre vie sont presque une nécessité au 21e siècle. Ils nous servent à rester connectés avec le monde qui nous entoure, chose qui est encore plus importante durant cette pandémie. 

C’est là que SensAct vient en jeu. Cet appareil, lorsqu’il est connecté à divers capteurs ou méthodes d’entrées, joue le rôle d’une sorte de télécommande pouvant interagir avec les appareils mentionnés plus haut. 

 Or, puisque chaque patient est différent et peut avoir besoin de différents capteurs connectés à SensAct, pouvant contrôler différents appareils, chaque SensAct doit être programmé sur mesure pour chaque patient. 

Or, l’interface déjà en place pour faire cette tâche n’est pas intuitive, ce qui fait que bien que SensAct soit fonctionnel, personne ne peut vraiment programmer un appareil pour chaque patient.

 Pour régler ce problème, nous avons donc mis en place une interface intuitive et facile d’utilisation qui permettrait au personnel de la santé et aux patients de programmer leur SensAct facilement et en peu de temps, afin de leur permettre de contrôler leurs appareils électroniques. 

Il n'y a aucun coûts associés à notre interface, elle est implémentée avec node-red, qui est un outil de programmation intuitif.

Pour utiliser notre interface, il faut télécharger NodeJs et ensuite installer node-red. Il faudra aussi télécharger quelques modules dans node-red, qui seront spécifiés quand vous essayez d'exécuter les flows.

Title: Contrôleur Ambu bag FA34
Desc:
L'objectif du projet est de concevoir pour le Centre de Gestion Entrepreneurial de la Conception (CGEC) un contrôleur de ventilateur manuel fiable, précis et à faible prix, avec déploiement potentiel dans les pays à faible revenu ou les régions avec une infrastructure médicale limitée.

C'est ainsi que notre équipe à developper un concept  permettant de régulariser la ventilation manuel en analysant les battements du coeur d'une personne ainsi que sa respiration. Le prix du dispositif est équivalent à environ 85$.

Le plus Grand défi de ce projet se situe au niveau de la conversion des données. L'analyse des battements du coeur en fonction de la respiration s'est retrouvée être assez complexe.

Title: An data tracking device for gym users
Desc: The LiftSmart is a device aimed at high-level trainers and players of any sports who wish to track useful data during their workouts. Our processing chip makes use of powerful software that can recognize movements and track useful metrics such as power generated during your lifts, the type of lift completed, and the trajectory of the bar during the exercise allowing for corrections of the athlete's form and therefore reducing the risks for injuries. One can visualize the data obtained during a workout on his phone using our mobile application, allowing him or her to monitor progress anytime, anywhere. This will make it easy for anybody to find ways to improve and plan out future workouts accordingly. With LiftSmart, progress will truly be with you wherever you go.

Title: GNG2101-B23-Elevaider
Desc:
Since the start of COVID-19, people with low vision might be more concerned about touching public surfaces since they usually must do this to find things. Common places where they might have to touch surfaces is to find automatic buttons such as doors, elevator buttons, or audible traffic signals.

Our device is an iOS app that uses object recognition and tracking to guide visually impaired users to elevator buttons.

Download link: https://github.com/thuyvi-le/GNG2101_Elevaider

App demo: https://youtu.be/hHGptZLmvfw

Cost: Freemium

Title: GNG2101- Navigation system for the Visually impaired A5
Desc: Design a durable personal navigation system for the visually impaired that can navigate indoor and outdoor space, without depending on sound as the main source of communication. The system is weatherproof and affordable.

Title: GNG2101-A14-Accessible Switches
Desc: Our team created cheap, usb compliant accessible switches to replace the ones currently on the market.

Title: GNG 2501 FA 1 5 Contrôleur AmbuBag
Desc:
Nous cherchons à concevoir un contrôleur ambu bag pour le CGEC qui est simple, facile à utiliser, durable et portatif. Ceci doit être fait principalement pour les patients de la COVID-19 et le tout doit être fait en respectant un budget de 100$ et avant le 3 décembre 2020.

Nous suivons un budget de 100$. Notre plus grand défi a été la programation du Arduino puisque le projet a plusieurs composantes à contrôler en même temps.

Title: GNG2101- Project Team A6 - Hear Shield
Desc: This project was based on a family who has a child with a cochlear implant. The parents struggled to protect the hearing device from physical damage and becoming lost. From working closely with the clients, the A6 team created a hard case with a built-in tracker/locator and other helpful features. Please note that all names for clients have been blacked out in order to protect their privacy.

Title: GNG2101 - A9 -Accessible Messaging
Desc:
A need exists for visually impaired individuals that struggle reading and replying to their messages. With voice commands and magnifiers, it will make reading messages easier for those who struggle with their vision.

Our Team has created a shortcut/app through ios that will allow our client to use his voice to text. It is compatible with iMessage and third party apps. 

Cost: 99 cents / year subscription 

Benefits of using our app are not having to rely on memory to find the small voice button. Our app works along with accessible touch, making it always on the screen and easily accessible to the user.  

Click on the link to see a demo of our project: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p_orE4Xm0Dg&feature=youtu.be

Title: B21 Auditus
Desc:
B21-Waterproof hearing aid

The statement to the problem is : To design and produce a functional set of waterproof hearing aids while still optimizing the functionality and user experience for people who suffer with hearing loss.

Proposed Solution: Our design idea was to modify an over-the-ear hearing aid that is rechargeable with a Micro USB cable and to modify it to produce a hearing aid that is waterproof, thus, functional when immersed in water. This was done by waterproofing the electronics, microphone and charging port separately. To waterproof the charging port, we used a magnetic charger with a removable charging head. We then plug the charging head in and seal it using either silicon glue  so that it remains in place to block off the charging port and stop water from entering. The hearing aid will then be recharged just by attaching the magnetic cable to the end of the charging head.  This method of charging will ensure that the charging port is sealed at all times. To waterproof the electronics, we disassembled the casing on the hearing aid and cover all the electronics, except for the microphone which will be covered by a different material, in clear nail polish. We then put the casing back on. This will allow the nail polish to act as a second barrier of waterproofing in case any water were to enter the hearing aid and come into contact with the electronics.

Cost: The total cost to produce this headset is about $43 at the time of purchasing the materials.

Problem points: If this project will be duplicated insure that you have a good seal around the microphone with the waterproof fabric. Also ensure that multiple of coats of clear nail polish are applied to the electronics and hearing aid. Although it is not required, sealing the seams of the hearing aid with silicon caulking or clear nail polish adds an extra layer of protection against moisture.

Title: GNG1503-D5-UDetect
Desc:
Le but de ce projet:
Concevoir pour la Faculté de Génie de l’Université d’Ottawa un dispositif de détection du nombre de personne entrant et sortant d’une salle avec un système d’affichage, et indiquant de ne plus entrer, afin de respecter la limite de personnes admissible dans une salle due au COVID-19.
Nous proposons un système de detection par infrarouge. L'écran affiche le nombre exact de personnes présentes dans la salle. Lorsque la salle est pleine, une voix entonnée par un système de haut-parleur indique aux usagers de ne plus entrer dans la salle.
L'ensemble du projet a couté 80$.

Title: GNG 1503-D4-Système de comptage du nombre de personne
Desc:
Madame France Brazau et le corps administratif des laboratoires, ont besoin d'un système peut couteux qui peut compter le nombre d'étudiant dans une salle et l'afficher sur un écran pour faciliter la distanciation physique en vigueur à cause de la pandémie de COVID -19. 
Comme solution, nous avons pensé un système utilisant les lasers et les photorésistances pour compter le nombre de personne. le système coûtera environs 70 $

Title: GNG1503-D3-Détecteur de personnes
Desc:
Un membre de l’administration de l’Université d’Ottawa veut un dispositif de comptage et d’affichage du nombre de personnes présentes dans une salle sur le campus pour réguler le nombre de personnes et ainsi éviter de dépasser la limite du nombre permis. Un dispositif qui consomme peu d'énergie et qui est adaptable aussi pour les personnes avec des capacités réduites pour un montant maximum de 100 dollars.

Nous avons conçu et créé un dispositif qui s'attache au mur à la porte et détecte si quelqu'un rentre ou sort. Le nombre de personnes est affiché et les gens sont notifiés lorsque la limite est dépassée. Le coût, excluant la carte Arduino Uno et les taxes est de 47,44$

Un défi que vous pourrez êtres confrontés est que le système Arduino n'est pas 100% fiable lorsqu'il n'est pas finalisé (connections soudées, etc).

Title: GNG2501 FA31 Carte de sécurite
Desc:
Notre projet consiste à créer une application de sécurité et de navigation sur le campus de l'Université d'Ottawa. Nous afficherons les points de sécurité ou de rassemblement sur le campus ainsi que des directions pour s'y rendre. Le coût sera d'une modique somme de 25 $ afin d'être publié sur le magasin électronique Google Play. Lors du développement de notre projet, nous avons su remonter notre plus grande faiblesse, celle de notre manque de connaissance en programmation de ce genre.
Le code est disponible sur GitHub : https://github.com/Hadhoud5/SecurityMap

Title: Jamz food delivery website A1 JamNation
Desc: Hello we’re project team A1 and we were tasked to build a front end UI application for the JAMZ delivery service. Linked below is the final prototype for our website: https://lprov055.wixsite.com/mysite-3

Title: JAMZ Business Platform A4 by Presidential Constituency
Desc:
Web app containing options to view and manage orders, menu items, and various aspects of a business profile which allow the user to build a successful virtual restaurant. There is little to no back end since the project emphasized us generating an aesthetic over a functional application.

Link to Github:
https://github.com/Serpopovici163/GNG1103Website

Title: Group A2 - DESIGNZ Team
Desc:
Our team has designed a JavaScript based front-end application created on Node.js for our client: JAMZ. The JAMZ company has created a drone operated delivery service and our application will connect users to this service and allow them to order food to their houses. 

Our design was created to be simple, functional, easy to use, and to have an appealing, minimalistic aesthetic. All of our code was written from the ground up by implementing node modules, and it was designed to be easy to alter and customize. That is to say; all colors can be edited from a single page, and restaurant cards have been created using a standardized template.

Title: JAMZ Group A5- The Websters
Desc:
Group A5 is comprised of Sarah Hajji, Ben Whittington, James Wiginton and Manar Shakir. The websters (group A5) have created an interactive website for users to browse restaurant menus and place orders to be delivered via the JAMZ delivery service.

website link: https://shajj0634.wixsite.com/jamz

Title: GNG1503 - A10 - Self watering planter
Desc:
Le représentant du bureau du développement durable à l’université d’Ottawa, Jonathan Rausseo a besoin d’une jardinière intérieure à arrosage automatique pour les édifices du campus.

La jardinière doit être facile d’utilisation, détecter l’humidité du sol et arroser les plantes. Ce produit doit être sécuritaire, attrayant, mobile et bon pour l'environnement tout en étant sous le budget de 100$.

Les défis à considérer lors de la conception de la jardinière sont d'assurer une bonne isolation des composants électrique dans le boîtier pour éviter le contact avec l'eau, ainsi que d'assurer une connexion fonctionnelle du câblage avec les composantes et l'interface web. 

Le coût total approximatif est de 107.21$

Title: Green Tide - La Jardinière Automatique - GNG1503 Groupe A6
Desc:
Projet GNG1503, Automne 2020

Dans le cadre du cours GNG1503 (Génie de la conception), nous avons le défi de concevoir une jardinière d'intérieur pour les espaces communs de l'Université d’Ottawa pour notre client Jonathan Rausseo, gestionnaire du développement durable. Monsieur Rausseo nous a expliqué qu’il y a un manque de verdure sur le campus et que les êtres humains sont biophiles, nous avons tendance à interagir avec la nature. Il aimerait apporter plus de verdure dans les espaces communs à l’aide de planteurs autosuffisants. Notre budget pour ce projet est de 100$.

Énoncé du problème: L'Université d’Ottawa veut mettre des planteurs, autosuffisants, nécessitants un entretien minimal et ayant un bel esthétique, dans les espaces communs pour ajouter de la verdure au campus et pour aider à améliorer la moralité des étudiants et des professeurs.

Title: GNG1503-A7-Jardinière automatique
Desc:
L’université veut ajouter de la verdure dans les édifices et ne veut pas passer trops de temps à arroser les plantes.
L’objectif de ce projet de conception est de concevoir une jardinière pour l’université avec un système d’arrosage automatique qui est efficace, sécuritaire, pas trop coûteux et moderne. Nous ferons cela tout en pensant au côté environnemental et écologique.

Notre solution suggeste l'utilisation divers capteurs en combinaison avec l'Arduino pour surveiller le niveau d'eau et l'humidité du sol et arroser la plante automatiquement (grâce à une pompe submergé) basé sur l'information obtenu.

Le coût du projet est de 75,29$

Title: Augmented Matrix B12
Desc: The construction industry is in need of a software that can allow it's workers to visualize any given structure. With the use of Augmented Reality (AR) and Unity3D, this software is possible. Our team has designed a game-like software that is easy-to-use and efficient. Enjoy!

Title: GNG2101-A8- magnifierPLUS
Desc: We are Accessibility 8, our users need a computer magnification system that is easy to activate and will help to navigate web pages, read text and use social media. We are working to create a magnifying software that will follow the cursor as it moves across the screen, and can be activated with a button. Our proposed solution will not cost more than 50$

Title: GNG 2101 - B13 - Prosthetic Foot Testing Apparatus
Desc: Our client needs a model for a prosthetic foot testing apparatus that replicates transtibial behavior and is usable by able bodied researchers. They require a device with a rigid connection between the mount and prosthetic foot, allow researchers to quickly change between different prosthetic foot models, and support mountable accessories.

Title: Annota - Smart Annotation Compilation - B31
Desc: A discourse analysis, the study of written or spoken language in relation to its social context, requires taking notes and putting annotations in documents and images to be able to analyze the data. The client for this project, a Master's student with a disability and chronic illness, is seeking to perform a discourse analysis of a government bill for her research, but she is not always capable of remembering the documents and what ties the have to other pieces of information. The purpose of this project is to create a way for her to keep a visual timeline of all the annotated and reviewed documents and how the information might flow from one to another.

Title: IRBseven FD7
Desc: Le but du projet est de créer un système qui peut avertir les étudiants d'une façon autonome quand la limite d'une salle est atteinte où il n'y a pas d'employés. Le système sait quand qu'une personne entre ou sort d'une salle automatiquement. Le système inclut aussi un affichage bilingue qui est accessible à tout.

Title: GNG1503-D10-Détecteur de personnes-CS-counter
Desc:
Les administrateurs des édifices de génie ont besoin d'évaluer le nombre de personnes dans une salle en temps réel à l'aide d'un dispositif compact, autonome et fiable, et ce tout en ayant la capacité d'informer, de façon efficace, les étudiants s 'il est sécuritaire d'entrer dans la salle. Notre produit a été conçu pour réponde à cette requête, en plus d'une application interactive permettant le contrôle des administrateurs à distance et à tous moments. 

Estimation du coût du produit: 100 $

Title: GNG1503-D9-Système de détection de personnes
Desc:
Description courte pour guider les juges : 

Dans le cadre du cours de génie de la conception, notre équipe a développé, à l'aide de photorésistances et de pointeurs laser, un système de détection du nombre limite de personnes dans une pièce afin d'aider à respecter les règles de distanciation sociale que la pandémie actuelle impose. 

Description détaillée :

Depuis les derniers mois, l’accès aux lieux publiques est restreint et contrôlé. C’est pourquoi, dans le cadre de ce cours, nous sommes en train de concevoir un système capable de détecter le nombre de personnes dans une pièce pour aider à maintenir une distance sociale sécuritaire en tout temps. 


La résolution de ce problème est très importante afin de limiter la propagation de la COVID-19 et d'éliminer les risques potentiels liés à de futures épidémies. 


Notre équipe est composée de 3 étudiants, tous en génie mécanique.  Nous allons maintenant vous présenter notre solution, soit prototype que nous avons développé spécifiquement pour pour les salles de bain du pavillon STEM. Le coût total du projet s'élève à environ 65$.

Vous pouvez visionner notre vidéo promotionnelle dès maintenant !

Title: Jasper FD11
Desc:
Par mesure de prévention à la covid-19, les différentes salles de l’université d’Ottawa ont des restrictions en ce qui est du nombre de personnes permises en même temps dans un endroit clos à la fois. Nous avons donc, pour les membres du personnel, conçu un dispositif mobile, ne dépassant pas 100$, qui permet d’avertir toutes personnes à l’entrée d’une salle si elle est autorisé à entrer par rapport à la limite de personnes.

Ce dispositif comprend un sous-système d'affichage et détection par photorésistances et lasers, qui sont interconnectés par la technologie Arduino.

Title: DNOinfra - D8
Desc: un système de détection de limite de personne dans une salle (système de comptage)

Title: Soutien en santé mentale FA35

He will then have the option to view the mechanical, electrical or architectural aspects of the building through the selection of wall layers.

Title: Senseur de pression pour touches de piano FB1
Desc:
Un système discret, économique et efficace qui sert à mesurer et afficher la pression exercée par le pianiste sur chaque touche de piano ainsi que sa durée pour les chercheurs, professeurs de musiques et musiciens afin d'éviter les blessures aux pianistes et d'améliorer la pédagogie du piano.

Nous avons achevé ceci par moyen d'un système qui consiste d'une couverture pour la touche muni avec un senseur qui est lié avec la plaque Arduino sous la touche de piano. Le coût estimé du projet est d'environ 70 $ pour une première fabrication.

Title: GNG1503-FB9-Capteurs de pression
Desc: Il s'agit de concevoir un capteur de pression peu coûteux et efficace qui servira à mesurer la pression exercé sur une touche de Piano lorsqu'on la joue. Le capteur de pression devra être discret au toucher et visuellement. Nous avions donc choisi de concevoir un dispositif qui se placerait sous la touche de piano dont on veut connaitre la pression exercée. Le coût de ce projet s'est élevée à 77$ et 12 cents.

Title: SPP - senseur de pression pour piano FB-4
Desc: Dans le cadre du cours GNG 1503, nous avons été amenés à concevoir un capteur pouvant détecter la pression exercée sur une touche de piano.

Title: GNG1103 - C4 - The Cottage Greenhouse
Desc:
Problem Statement: To allow the community at Lac Barrière to harvest crops for three seasons, a 6ft x 6ft x 6ft greenhouse, equipped with a HPS and solar panels, must be built, while considering issues involving accessibility, pests, and structural endurance against climate conditions.

Solution: Building "The Cottage" Greenhouse

Cost with tax: With COVID-19 Measures - $544.66

Without COVID-19 Measures - $459.31

Possible Challenges: Including all the features while staying in budget due to possible price change


NOTE: Final Prototype could not be completed due to COVID-19

Title: Hydroponic 2
Desc:
Our goal is to build a simple, stand alone hydroponic system, which will be used in winter. Based on the benchmarking, we chose the third design to contribute to our final project. However, due to COVD-19, our hydroponic system was not successfully build, but our designs are all complete and materials are all obtained. In the future, our hydroponic system can be easily build by following our 3rd design.


Group members:

Zhema Wen

Liam Leahy

Stanley Lin

Title: Senseur de force OnePiece FB10
Desc: Le mécanisme OnePiece est un mécanisme de détection de force appliquée sur une touche de piano. Notre mécanisme permet de mesurer la force sur 3 touches de piano et d'afficher ces données sur un écran en forme de graphique. Ce mécanisme a été conçu pour but d'aider les musiciens et les professeurs de musique afin qu'ils puissent étudier la force appliquée par les nouveaux pianistes sur les touches de piano. Cela est dans le but de minimiser les effets néfastes de l'usage a long terme sur la santé des pianistes.

Title: Position Warning System G7
Desc: The wireless modular system developed to inform any collision to wheelchair users.

Title: openChem VR F10
Desc:
Utilizes a repository of open-source VR components collectively used for assembling a university-level lab environment suitable for macro-micromolecular visual learning; simulating chemistry labs on HTC vive VR environments.


The Folder 'Project 1' Contained the environment the user would be in, allowing the user to experience a kitchen like scenario in the macroscopic level.

The Folder 'Project V1' contained the microscopic environment with molecules interacting with one another and with the user, all depending on how the user interacted in macroscopic scenario

.

The openChem repo is created by Tony Kim, Azfar Azfar, Ahmed Osman, Bradley Liu and contains our projects under file names: "Project 1" and "ProjectV1", which uses certain assets and components from repos "SBHacks" and "Atomive": two libraries that have been forked into the openChem repo for redundance and easy asset importability within project 1 and V1.. Sources for SBHacks and Atomive are cited in read-mes of each repository file.

Title: environmental robot G3
Desc: Environmental problems have increasingly become the focus of attention. Because of the concern of pollution on the seashore, our project aims to design and modify a robot for beach cleaning. According to the requirement of clients, benchmarking and the experience during trails, we designed a mobile platform for camera to make it flexible and get larger vision. Meanwhile, we also developed the night work mode based on IR camera to make it able to work automatically at night. Our prototype and functional testing are finished as well as the analysis of usability, scalability, sustainability and other necessary analysis.

Title: VR Tutor F7
Desc: Must be using Unity version 2018.4.17f1

Title: Working winter accessibility G4
Desc: This Client has cerebral palsy and is confined to a wheelchair. He is bored and is having trouble finding a purpose so he is looking for an employment possibility.

Title: EarSecure FC2
Desc: Système composé d'une interface web couplée d'une alarme visuelle pour les utilisateurs du Centre Brunsfield et du Centre de formation en fabrication afin d'assurer le respect des normes en matière d'exposition au bruit du Centre canadien d'hygiène et de santé au travail (CCHST).

Title: GNG1103F - F11 - Organic Chemistry VR Project
Desc: This product allows first-year organic chemistry students to visualize the connection between the macroscopic and microscopic levels of a chemical reaction. The team wanted to make an easy-to-use, physcially interative, and cost-effective VR system to help students. For access to the final prototype and its design files, please feel free to email any member of the design team.

Title: Pression de piano FB3
Desc: Nous sommes les étudiants du cours GNG1503, notre groupe est FB-3 'HMNS', nous avons réaliser un système qui détecte la pression 'la force ' appliqué par les clés du piano par des capteurs connectés à l'Arduino Uno, ainsi de visualiser les données collectées sous forme d'un graphe dynamique en utilisant Matlab comme outil.

Title: F8 GNG1103 chemisrty game
Desc: An interactive chemistry game for students in organic chemistry (assets and library)

Title: Pression de piano Groupe FB-8
Desc: Se projet permet a l'utilisateur de visualiser la pression appliqué sur les clés du piano avec un graphique et un tableau de données. Groupe FB-8

Title: Tactile Map GNG-5140 G8
Desc: Navigating in a foreign space for a visually impaired person can be extremely challenging. The Public Health Agency of Canada is looking to create a tactile map for the blind using 3D printers or other suitable technologies, to make the first floor of 100 Colonnade Rd, accessible for employees with vision impairments. This is part of the accessible and inclusive meeting spaces initiative, which is serving as the benchmark for accessibility within the public service, and is informing the work being done within Centre Block and the Parliamentary Precinct. The end result will be presented to the subcommittee on tactile mapping for the Parliamentary Precinct, which is currently exploring options for tactile mapping on Parliament Hill.

Title: GNG1103F Chemistry VR group F4
Desc:
For our design project, we developed a VR environment that consists of an interactive map with different stages that guide the user through the different levels of a titration reaction. We chose this design since it forces the user to follow a particular order, which ensures proper understanding of each stage before moving on to the next. The environment itself is very intractable as the user can move around, play with different objects, as well as use a bow and arrow to answer the quiz questions that test what they have learnt in the VR. The objective of this environment is to allow users to visualize the difference in between the macroscopic and microscopic levels of a chemical reaction.


There is a link to download what exists of the reaction part of the project here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gb1DyOgVqO2mafqBohARS1DteLv_2l_2/view?usp=sharing

Title: GNG 1103 Hydroponics 4 - Winter 2020 Professor Majeed
Desc: The proposed aeroponics design is easy to make, relatively cost efficient and extremely efficient at germination of crops. Aeroponics is a form of hydroponics which uses pressure to spray a mist of a nutrient rich solution at the roots of the growing crops. Aeroponics is efficient because it reduces the need for a growth medium which frees the roots up completely allowing for full coverage of the water solution across the surface of the plants' roots. The system we proposed is also a closed loop system meaning that the water is 95% reused and thus infrequently requires refilling of water. The nutrients would need to be resupplied to the system when they are running low, but are also relatively cheap so could be bought in bulk. The system requires a power source of 120VAC at 60 Hz, and produces a stream of water with 300 GPH (gallons per hour).

Title: GNG 2501 Amelioration fauteuil roulant pour colline F3
Desc: Les proches aidants ont de plus en plus en plus de difficulté à pousser les chaises roulantes en pente ascendante et lors de longs déplacements, car cela occasionne des blessures au niveau des poignets et du dos. Notre objectif était de concevoir un système de propulsion de chaise roulante qui est abordable, facile d'utilisation, autonome, léger et compacte.

Title: GNG 1103 Hydroponics Baddies H1
Desc: Welcome to the Hydroponics Baddies, where we don't play by the rules. We spend all our budget before the first prototype, we only ever measure once, and we don't take client feedback.

Title: GNG 1503-FB5-Dispositif de mesure de pression
Desc:
Concevoir, pour les formateurs au piano, les chercheurs et les apprenants, un dispositif de mesure de pression de petite taille, très sensible, facilement démontable, d'un prix abordable et qui est capable d'enregistrer les données mesurées puis les afficher sur un écran sous forme de graphique facile à interpréter et comprendre.

La solution retenue pour répondre aux besoins du client est un dispositif constitué d'un microcontroleur Aduino Mega muni de quatre capteurs et d'un module bluetooth permettant de transmettre les données de pression à distance. Une application permet de visualiser les graphiques en temps réel sur un écran.

Le coût total du projet est de 63,29 $CAD.

Les principales difficultés rencontrées lors de la réalisation du projet sont: la réalisation et le téléversement du code ainsi que la connexion du bluetooth sur l'arduino Nano.

Title: GNG1503-B07-Systeme de capteurs de pression
Desc: Concevoir un dispositif à faible coût capable de détecter et d'afficher l'application d'une pression de manière efficace et précise sur les touches d'un piano pour les instructeurs de piano.

Title: Project Armadillo C3
Desc:
There are thousands of people with disabilities who are unable to pursue their dreams due to their limitations.

Our project is to ensure that everyone has a source of accessibility and an equal opportunity to do what they love regardless of their struggle.

We have created a ramp that will last for 2 months outside, is portable and will handle 500 pounds of weight.

Title: C7 OP-Watch
Desc:
In this design project, our team was entrusted with producing an electronic device in response to the growing epidemic of the opioid crisis.


The main priority that was established at the beginning of the design process was that first and foremost, we needed to empathize with the user and truly understand their needs and wants.


Opioid users range from all sorts of age demographics; these include the homeless, adolescents, and even those employed in trades-based industries.


The design of our device is that of a watch which measures one's heart rate and oxygen saturation levels. These values, alongside the GPS tracking system coordinates, are then directly sent to the mobile application. A call is made to the user's emergency contact, who can then forward the call to emergency services if additional assistance is needed. All in all, our device will help save many lives and rescue others from potential life-threatening circumstances.



The members of our team include:


Abdel Baig


Ali Al-Zaidi


Bilal Ahmad


David Onoruvwe


Yazan Elmasry

Title: Greenhouse Construction 2
Desc: The need exists for members of the Algonquin of Barriere Lake community to increase their food supply with the availability of sustainable greenhouse (hydroponic system) that is self-sufficient, easy to control, compact, insulated, affordable, and able to provide warmth all year for growing plants.

Title: GNG2101-D1-FLASH-E
Desc:
Did you know that in 2019, 4.4 million people suffered fatal injuries in emergency situations? Overcome with fear of something similar happening to her, our client came to us seeking a functioning emergency call device capable of reaching and sending out a quick alert to emergency services in the event of a dangerous situation.

Our team has developed a watch-like device and a mobile application of medium-high fidelity. In the featured prototypes, we have a complete watch assembly consisting of a watch case, watch bezel, watch crystal, a button, and a band. The watch is a simple design that can be easily worn on the wrist ensuring accessibility at all times. It is easily connected to the mobile application through strong and wide ranged bluetooth connectivity, accommodating the event that a user wearing the watch is separated from their phone. In terms of functionality, the user must simply hit the button that is found at the centre of the watch which will activate the device and send out a signal to request emergency aid as it is already connected to the app and optimized to the user.

Our prototypes were developed using Solidworks, 3D printing, Adafruit Bluefruit Circuit Playground, Laser cutting, and Android Studio.

Title: GNG1103D02 GHConstruct 3
Desc:
Problem Statement: The community of the Algonquins of Barriere Lake are in need of a safe, self-sustaining and affordable greenhouse that can provide produce for an extended amount of time, throughout the year.

Our Solution: We have creating an affordable, modular and low maintenance greenhouse design, that will produce vegetables through the different seasons in Barriere Lake

The Cost: $372.12

Problems/ issues faced through replication: If you are looking to replicate our design, it is important to note that many of the materials and tools were provided by the school. This is important to note as the directions are based on what our group was able to complete in the time given. Altercations may be made to fit the needs and wants of the replication. For instance our original design had a 4x8 base until we changed it to a 6x8 base to optimize space inside the greenhouse.

Title: C12 LIFELINE
Desc:
For this project, we were tasked to create a device that confronts the uprising opioid overdose crisis. In order to create an ideal device, we needed to gain a strong understanding of who the user would be. In this case, it is those who are blue collar or in construction, and we tried our best to accommodate to their needs and lifestyle.

We designed a wristwatch device that would measure heart rate and blood oxygen saturation levels which would directly connect to our phone application and alert help in the case of an overdose.

We hoped to provide our users an easy and affordable way at a second chance at life or in other words a lifeline.


Makers of this project include:

Abdullah Abdulmajeed

Alyssa Wang

Antonia Zupu

Spencer Henry

Yomna Elsahili

Title: Opioid Overdose Device - Team C13
Desc: For this semester's GNG1103, my group, Team 13, was asked to make a device that detects overdose opioids and contacts emergency services within 3 minutes in an attempt to save the person overdosing's life. During the client meeting we were informed that the best way to recognize an opioid overdose is by checking Blood Oxygen levels using an oximeter; if ones SPO2 dips below 85% the chance of them having an overdose is really high. This project required a lot of programming and electrical knowledge to work. We worked a lot with codes, Arduino Controllers, Sensors, Bluetooth etc. to make this project work. We also took advantage of the school's 3D printers. Our final project was supposed to be a watch with an inbuilt pulse oximeter that connects to an app. This app with receive your heart rate and blood oxygen levels and will contact your emergency contact when having an overdose. Unfortunately due to COVID-19 we were unable to complete the project.

Title: GNG2101 - C4 - Emergency Call Bell
Desc:
The Client, Victoria, an elderly woman, needs an emergency call bell that can detect when she falls or can be manually triggered to call the emergency services for her.

An emergency call bell system implemented with a Fitbit smartwatch and an Android smartphone.

GNG2101 Group C4 - Winter 2020

Title: GNG1503-FC1-site STEM website
Desc:
Concevoir pour les gérants et utilisateurs des centres de génie, un système automatisé pour l'édifice STIM qui améliore, promeut et facilite l'usage et l'orientation dans l'édifice afin de faciliter le travail des gérants et utilisateurs.


Site Web sur le pavillion STEM.

Contient des itinéraires pour se rendre aux salles que l'on recherche. Ainsi que la descricption des salles.

Aucuns coûts n'est associé à notre projet.

Si vous essayez de reproduire notre concept, il serait important de trouver l'information sur les laboratoires que nous n'avons pas définis. Aussi, il serait utile d'imprimer le code QR et de l'afficher dans l'édiffice pour que les utilisateurs puissent y accéder facilement.


Lien contenant les fichiers d'information:

https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1FyKrI1MNTjkaX4UJTiDClufXVwQf7Lyr

Title: GNG 1103 - Chemistry VR set using UNITY F3
Desc: Virtual reality (VR) has the ability to help users visualize and interact with a variety of abstract subject matter. This product will utilize the power of VR to allow students to interact with molecules at a microscopic level and develop an understanding of difficult concepts. The target group is students who have a background in general chemistry, and are proceeding to introductory organic chemistry. This product uses technology to connect the effects of macroscopic and microscopic reactions.

Title: Lookout C8
Desc:
An earpiece device that accurately detects an opioid overdose using a oximeter sensor. Once detected the device sends a text alert and the location of the user to a third party so naloxone can be administered in under 3 minutes.


Youtube links:

App: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qUyEzbhzJag ("Get Address" button added in order to show that the app can get the user's location)


Hardware: https://youtu.be/Yrgbb11B9UQ (accuracy of oximetry shown using serial monitor using finger. Earlobe wasn't shown because of demonstration would not be possible)

Title: Table de changement F4
Desc: C'est une station portable pour se changer

Title: Equipe F2 GNG 2501
Desc: La construction d'un attachement pour un rameur Concept 2 qui permette l'utilisation de celui-ci par une personne en chaise roulante.

Title: JoyOne F1
Desc:
Le client/utilisateur est devenu incapable d'utiliser sa main droite et est un passionné des jeux vidéo sur ps4. Pour résoudre le problème une commande fonctionnelle, ergonomique, rigide et sécuritaire pour la console Playstation 4 de Sony a été développée pour le client.

Le JoyOne est compatible avec le APEX et l'ordinateur.

Équipe FA-1

Title: GNG1103C5VibeMachines
Desc: Our client requires a transportable, weather-resistant greenhouse that can feed up to five people while needing minimal maintenance, being self-powered, and automatically watered. The greenhouse should be low-cost while remaining easy to use. Our solution reflects these criteria while coming in at $388 or $112 under budget. The single biggest obstacle in the construction process was COVID-19.

Title: Greenhand Construction - Construction 1
Desc:
Greenhand Construction has created a greenhouse structure that maximizes both its efficiency and safety precautions. The basic design of our structure involves various tresses and beams to assure integrity. As a result we have also created a single-roofed greenhouse with plentiful sunlight accessibility to control the flow of water and deliver it to the hydroponics system.

However, due to unforeseen circumstances, the greenhouse will not be finished and we are only left with what we have already done.

Title: GNG1103-Construction-6
Desc:
Construction of a greenhouse for GNG 1103 W2020

Unfinished due to COVID-19

Members:

Ross McNamara

Title: GNG2101 - D2 - Independant Walking
Desc:
Hello ! Welcome to the Independent Walking first attempt. Here, you may find all the files used in our attempt. due to Covid-19, we did not have time to fully complete our work.

If you attempt this project, and have any questions relating to the files, feel free to reach out to me @ cbohe083@uottawa.ca

Title: Walking Stimulus D3
Desc: This project is meant to combat freezing of gait, common with people who are suffering from advanced stages of Parkinson's disease.

Title: GNG2101-C2-Adaptive Row
Desc: Convert a rowing machine, using a detachable adapter, to make it wheelchair-accessible for people who suffer primarily from lower-body disabilities.

Title: Adaptive Game Controller- Group C1 - RPGenius
Desc: Game controller designed for our client for one-handed use. Combination of a keyboard and joysticks for easy adaptation. It feature 21 keys which can be customized based on one's preferences. It is ergonomically designed around the palm of your hand and XIM apex compatible.

Title: GNG 2101-C6-Sensory Chair
Desc: The purpose of the sensory chair is to allow those with disabilities or growth defects to be more comfortable and help sleeping. As our customers will much of their time sitting on the chair, we want to create a chair that allows the user to remain comfortable and relaxed for a long period of time. This is accomplished by structuring the chair to accommodate a variety of sitting and laying positions, notably on the users front and back. First, we coded the motor to change the direction and speed of the motor through an Arduino Micontoller. This motor is placed at the centre of the base of the chair and is attached to the chair itself. The rocking system works by using a gear that pulls along a chain, pulling the chair with it. A spring was added to keep chain tension, allowing for smooth and consistent rocking.

Title: Team C1 Never Close to an Overdose
Desc: Opioid overdose detection device. Our device will detect when the user is having an overdose, and through our app it will notify an emergency contact chosen by the user. The device is located at the users ankle, the pulse oximeter will read the users blood oxygen saturation level from the users achilles heel.

Title: GNG2101-C5-One Step
Desc: People with Parkinson's sometimes have trouble starting a movement. When they are stationary for a while or have just risen from a chair for example, it takes a little encouragement to get their legs moving. Our project involves insoles that are able to vibrate when triggered by an app to mimic walking for our client and stimulate walking.

Title: GNG1103-KELT-Hydroponics 6
Desc: There was need for a functional and cost-effective hydroponics system in a greenhouse that would be easy to use and maintain and provide food for 4-5 people. We designed a drip hydroponics system to solve this problem. The expected building cost of this system would be $79.30. The trickiest part of our design is arguably controlling the flow rate and ensuring all plants get equal amounts of nutrient solution.

Title: Hydroponics 5 FTW
Desc:
Hydroponic system made for the GNG1103 greenhouse project of winter 2020 using the nutrient film technique.

The PDF 'Hydroponics' is a 3D pdf with a representation of the system.

Title: GNG 1103 C4 Opioid Overdose Device
Desc: A device that can accurately track and measure the user's blood oxygen level and BPM, the device will alert emergency personnel when the user's vitals reach a dangerous state.

Title: Opioid Overdose Detecting Device - C05
Desc:
Our problem statement: A need exists for people who use opioids to safely have their blood oxygen saturation monitored and location quickly sent to emergency services in case of overdose, with a device that is discrete and cost-effective.

Our solution to the problem is a device of a combination of a pulse oxygen saturation ring and a watch that is connected via a thin wire. The ring and the watch would be battery powered as well as have a GPS system within it.

Title: GNG2101 C7 Lightweight Posterior Walker
Desc: Design a lightweight posterior walker, that is height adjustable, foldable and easily controlled by the user.

Title: Lightweight Posterior Walker D5
Desc:
Come see our promo video at https://youtu.be/NRnr-jTQJAs

3D Design files consist of 4 Solidworks Parts, 1 Solidworks Assembly, and 1 .STL from TinkerCAD.

Title: Hill Assist D4
Desc: We're focused on making an affordable wheelchair upgrade to help physically disabled people to more easily travel uphill and travel. We plan to use a timing belt attached to a motor to turn an appendage wheel.

Title: Oxi-Flex Team C2
Desc: Opioide overdose detection armband. Senses when the User is having an opioide overdose and sends a message to our app on their phone, which will notify one of their emergency contacts

Title: FC3-PaslChoix
Desc:
Dans le cadre du cours GNG 1503, l'équipe de conception PasL'Choix à développer un système de comptage pouvant être utilisé dans divers espaces du STIM. Ce dispositif est en effet très utile car ses données peuvent être consulté par la communauté étudiante via un interface WEB et par les gérants via un outil de recherches. Ces outils peuvent aider les étudiants à mieux gérer leur temps et aux gérants à garder un historique de plusieurs années des allers-venus dans le laboratoire pour ensuite faire des améliorations aux installation et aux services offerts.

Vous pouvez retrouver tous les aspects importants dans le but de comprendre et de mettre en place ce dispositif fort utile dans Manuel de l'utilisateur et d'avantage d'information en consultant les fichier joints .

Title: Automisation du complex STEM FC4
Desc: - Compteur laser du nombre de personne dans une salle du CEGEC

Title: O2-POD -- An Opioid Overdose Monitoring Device C6
Desc:
The opioid crisis has caused over 10 000 overdose deaths in Canada since 2016. 94% of those are accidental and young Canadians aged 15-24 are the fastest growing overdose population. Overdoses are happening with both illegal and prescription drugs and touches every sector of the population. The main signs of an overdose is a low respiratory rate and low oxygen saturation levels in the blood.


Our project is to create a device that can detect a person overdosing and send a signal to a loved one/paramedics to alert them that something is wrong and indicate the location of the person. Another important factor is that it must be reliable, not be intrusive or hard to use for the user since they must want to use it consistently.

Title: GNG1103-FO6-VR Chemistry Game
Desc: We need to make a VR-based chemistry game for researchers and professors to better illustrate the misconceptions behind reactions and proportions for organic chemistry university students, Our budget is $100 for the assets required to build the necessary components for the game. The game consists of 2 reactions, one of which is a tutorial. Also, the game will consist of 2 phases, one in the macroscopic phase in the laboratory, and the microscopic phase in order to analyze molecular structure and reaction.

Title: Save Your Sole C01 Team C3
Desc: The purpose of this project is to create an overdose detection device that can alert medical attention when an overdose is present.

Title: GNG 1503 Capteur de pression FB2
Desc: On a été assignés la tache de concevoir un système discret, économique et efficace pour mesurer et afficher la pression exercée par le pianiste sur chaque touche de piano ainsi que sa durée pour les chercheurs, professeurs de musiques et musiciens afin d'éviter les blessures aux pianistes et d'améliorer la pédagogie du piano. Notre budget est de 100$. Ce projet fut conduit dans le cadre du cours GNG 1503. Notre groupe est FB02.

Title: Info session 1
Desc: Please find attached the slides from the first info session. If you would like to be on a mailing list for the challenge please email makerspace@uottawa.ca

Title: tracteur interactif fa7
Desc: Tracteur interactif avec un module de contrôle Arduino et un jeu sur la plateforme Garry's Mod.

Title: Simulateur de tracteur
Desc: Dans le cadre de notre projet final du cours GNG 1503, Génie de la conception, enseigné par Emmanuel Bouendeu, nous avions le mandat de concevoir un simulateur de tracteur interactif.

Title: GNG2101 A01 Special Keyboard F2019
Desc: SALA, the Special Adjustable Laptop Arm is designed to help JM, a patient with no arm or leg mobility, to use his laptop more comfortably. He currently uses a mouth-stick to operate his laptop, but the angle and height of his laptop causes him neck strain. As a result, the team designed and produced a prototype that allows JM to set his laptop at a comfortable height and angle. This will reduce his neck pain and prevent future health issues involving neck strain.

Title: JAMKey - on-screen keyboard
Desc:
JAMKey is an on-screen keyboard designed to be highly customizable so that those suffering with disabilities will find it easier to type. The keyboard allows users to modify the size, colour and function of keys as well as save and load presets from an online database.


GitHub Repository : https://github.com/Markol17/OnscreenKeyboard

Title: Mr RobinO
Desc: C'est un bras robotique capable de bouger et s'articuler dans tous les sens, atteindre des hauteurs pour appuyer des boutons et soulever de petits objets légers, afin d'aider les patients physiquement limités mais cognitivement de haut-niveau

Title: Stimulus de marche FA-09
Desc: Notre produit, le stimulus de marche a pour objectif, d'aider les personnes atteintes de la maladie de parkinson de se déplacer un peu plus efficacement. En effet grâce a une vibration, notre stimulus de marche, stimule le muscle de l'utilisateur et lui permet ainsi un confort dans ses mouvements.

Title: ClavierASKIP
Desc: Un clavier facile à manipuler, lisible, bilingue et accessible à open source pour personnes à mobilité réduite qui servira le département de la technologie de l'hôpital St Vincent.

Title: Simulateur de tracteur interactif
Desc: Boite de contrôle pouvant démarrer un montage vidéo d'un tracteur , contrôler le volume de l'expérience, controller une interaction visuel lumineuse et afficher des instruction sur un écran LCD.

Title: Tracteur interactif FA16
Desc: Nous avons conçu une simulation de tracteur intéractif, amusant et éducatif pour le musée de l'agriculture du Canada

Title: Tracteur Interactif
Desc: Ce projet consiste à construire un simulateur de tracteur interactif pour le musée de l'agriulture à Ottawa. Ce projet fut conduit dans le câdre du cours GNG 1503. Notre groupe est FA01 (photo du groupe incluse).

Title: 3Detect A15
Desc: A 3D printer monitoring system using a Dashboard UI, as well as a nodeMCU and and PIR motion sensor

Title: GNG2101-B2C TAD
Desc: Our client suffers from thoracic outlet syndrome and as a result the muscles that support her thumbs are weakened. Our product, TAD (thumb aiding device) aims to restore support to her thumb muscles through mechanical means.

Title: GNG1503-FA17-Simulateur de tracteur
Desc:
Le musée de l'agriculture a besoin d'un simulateur de tracteur interactif, amusant, accessible et abordablequi pourra donner l'expérience idéale d'un tour de tracteur aux visiteurs.

La solution que nous avons donc choisis de concevoir un simulateur constitué d'un jeu vidéo , un volant et une manette pour controler la simulation ainsi qu'avec des boutons.

le cout total du projet est donc $76.26.

Title: Equipe FA17
Desc: Photo du groupe équipe FA17

Title: GNG2101-B4B-2019
Desc: Our project is a sensor system that provides warnings to wheelchair users when obstacles approach their chair. Using vibration and an LED system we can alert a user to obstacles outside of their field of view.

Title: Volunteer Call Bell - Fall 2019 A3
Desc:
All server files and current CAD designs can be found in the GitHub repository


A Raspberry Pi acts as a router and provides access to a LAN through Wi-Fi for devices. An API server runs and responds to HTTP GET, POST and DELETE requests by updating or reading a SQLite database. A web server also runs on the Raspberry Pi to provide a web application that allows
patients to submit their calls and volunteers to delete and view the calls. Another Raspberry Pi that connects to the LAN is used as a button. It sends a predetermined HTTP request when the physical button is clicked and is programmed using Node-Red.

Title: GNG1503-FA18

Desc: Tasked with creating a screwdriver that can be used by those with hand tremors, the SteadyTools team designed the Steady Screwdriver. Using gyroscopic technology, this device resists movements due to hand tremors while maintaining the functionality of a regular screwdriver.
