The code runs and connects and disconnects the wifi when prompted on laptops. No cost was involved from our part. The design could be different on the basis of what the server is.

Our goal is to create a user-friendly interface for a virtual reality program that allows patients of the Ottawa Hospital and their loved ones to simulate medical treatments by watching 180° stereoscopic videos on their upcoming experience and browse through applications all while allowing hospital staff to easily upload videos and update the program as required.


Link to Project: https://drive.google.com/open?id=10wdy34M5ZUaBizggYp0FiVBM3fs4ZMXD

Le musée de l'agriculture du Canada souhaite offrir une expérience inoubliable et éducative en modernisant le tracteur sur place pour que celui-ci offre une simulation comme jamais vu.


Notre concept s'agit d'une simulation à la fois audio et visuelle ou l'utilisateur pourra appuyer sur une série de bouton pour entendre le tracteur démarrer, accélérer et arrêter tout en admirant un champs qui défilera devant lui sur un écran.

Le musée de l'agriculture nous a chargé de moderniser et recréer un simulateur de tracteur accessible, facile d'utilisation et sécuritaire.

La simulation offre une expérience interactif qui consiste a faire un tour au bord d'un tracteur pour une durée de 40 secondes. Et cela avec un budget de 100$

Title: GNG2101-A11 -Portable Wheelchair Ramp
Desc:
A need exists to provide a lightweight, compact, portable ramp within $100 that will enable Austin to access areas which are not otherwise accessible to people in wheelchairs due to curbs and tree roots.

Our solution is to build a triangular wheelchair ramp which is capable of folding in half for portability. The ramp is supported by ratched straps running along the bottom.

The current cost of the ramp is $127.70

The biggest struggle we have faced with this project was finding a way to give the ramp enough support without introducing too much weight. The ropes supporting the ramp proved to be an extrememly effective solution.

Title: GNG2101-A9-Accessibility Device
Desc:
The client suffers from a condition which severely limits his ability to move his arms and communicate without his wheelchair system. He has requested a product that will allow him to communicate to caregivers while laying in bed which is operated with his foot, it should be lightweight and easy to set up. ====Our solution was to make a joystick much like the one of the clients' mounted onto a ramp like structure. It sits on the surface of the bed and is secured by two straps that wrap around the bed frame.

The cost of our prototype is 109$.

Some problem that might be faces is not getting the joystick to move in the upwards direction. This is caused by the hole in the top piece to be too small which limits the range of motion.

Title: GNG1103-A5-MakerMap
Desc: CEED requires an interactive system that shows its users the layout of facilities and what machines are currently available or in use. We have designed a free and simple, yet effective software using Ross Video Dashboard that allows CEED workers to simply click a button to display that specific device as in use. An external device can connect to this Dashboard and view what devices are avaibale, allowing users to use thier time most effectivley.

Title: GNG1103-B14-VR Video Player
Desc: The following is a group submission of the VR app requested to be built for the course GNG1103. Please note the app is still a work in progress and no where near as refined as we would like it. Keeping that in mind the, following app is a stereoscopic video player, that will be primarly used in a hospital environment to help aclimate the patients to their treatment procedures and etc.

Title: GNG2101-A13-JAAC Box
Desc: The JAAC Box is a foot controlled mouse. The device uses a 3D printed heel socket to move the mouse around 360 degrees and a large left click button. This version has been optimized for use while lying in a hospital bed and uses aluminum legs to maintain its position in a comfortable position in a hospital bed.

Title: GNG1103-A14-CIM
Desc: CEED Introductory Management

Title: Team B9
Desc: Using Unity, visual studio, and VR technology, we have put together a media player that allows for a stress free patient experience. The goal of this software is to reduce patient anxiety by introducing them to the scans they will be undergoing in a safe environment.

Title: Kinder Farmer Simulator FA3
Desc: Notre concept répond aux besoins du client de façon simple, minimaliste et est facile à utiliser. Il est constitué d'une boîte qui sert de plateforme pour 3 boutons. Ces boutons allument des lumières qui peuvent clignoter, comme les feraient ceux sur un véhicule régulier. De plus, notre solution incorpore un levier de vitesse non fonctionnel ainsi qu'un écran tactile qui permet à l'utilisateur de sélectionner différentes stations de radios, de visualiser un écran GPS et d'appuyer sur un klaxon. Enfin, notre solution accomode la langue de préférence de l'utilisateur tout en étant interractive et accessible aux déficiences auditives et visuelles.

Title: Projet tracteur interactif - groupe FA-13
Desc: Le Musée de l'Agriculture et de l'Alimentation a besoin de moderniser et de remettre en marche leur exposition de tracteur pour qu'elle ait une longévité de plus de cinq ans, soit plus interactive, facile à maintenir et accessible au plus grand nombre de personnes possible. Nous avons donc un mandat important afin de permettre aux visiteurs du musée d'en apprendre davantage sur cette exposition qui présente le domaine de l'agriculture au Canada.

Title: GNG2101 - Accessible Laptop Stand B01C
Desc: A motorized laptop stand that raises and lowers at the push of a button. The design reduces neck pain in users who type using their mouth.

Title: GNG2101-B1A-Rear view Camera
Desc:
Back up camera and mount that allows the user to see behind them granting the user better awareness of surrounding objects. App enabled software streams footage to phone.




Problem statement

The client, who has limited mobility and visibility in a wheelchair, wants to be able to see behind them to help with spatial awareness when turning, going forward, and reversing to help in avoiding any obstacles in their way. An electronic camera system that could be attached to the wheelchair is the desired solution that would be developed depending on time and money constraints.




Definition

A wide angle camera will be secured to the back of the wheelchair, providing a good field of vision behind the wheelchair. The camera will be secured to the chair with strong durable velcro. The camera will be powered by a usb port found underneath one of the armrests. The video feed from the camera will be displayed on a phone with bluetooth that will be mounted on one of the chair arms. The mount will be adjustable to provide a comfortable angle to view the phone.

Solution

The wide angle camera will allow for a good field of view, and since most cameras that are available are at least 1080p, the video quality should not be an issue. The combined weight of the camera and wires should be rather low, however, the mount for the phone could be an issue in staying under the 600g target. The camera and phone are intended to be connected via bluetooth to reduce the need for additional wiring. The main drawbacks to this design is the power source. Since both the camera and phone will be powered by the chair, the amount of power used must be monitored as to not cause problems with extended use of the chair. Another possible issue is the bulkiness of the phone mount. If the mount is large and obstructive, this may cause problems with the user, therefore it is important to produce a mount that is compact.

Title: SimpleTools B1B
Desc: Inspired by Parkinson's patients, simpleTools is an affordable tool that allows users with hand tremors to use a screwdriver by dampening unwanted movements.

Title: GNG2101 - B01D - Wheelchair Camera Mount
Desc: The main purpose of the camera mount is to help wheelchair users easily take photos at different angles, without risking their camera falling or being damaged in any way. The arm is extensible so that the camera mount can be moved to be closer to the user, as well as, it can be easily adjusted. Last but not least, this mount is designed so that the user will be able to use both their phone and camera at the same time.

Title: GNG1503 - FA4 - tracteur
Desc:
Basé sur un site patrimonial, le musée de l'agriculture et de l'alimentation comporte une ferme expérimentale qui permet au public de se familiariser avec le mode de vie agricole. Plusieurs démonstrations de technologies rurales y sont présentes dont une exposition sur les tracteurs. Par contre, cette dernière a été enlevé en septembre dernier après 17 ans. Dans le cadre d'une actualisation de l'exposition, le musée souhaite concevoir et créer un système d'interaction physique et virtuel accessible à tous, captivant et éducatif, offert dans la langue de choix de l'utilisateur dans une cabine de tracteur John Deere. Ce système se doit d'offrir une modernité technologique dans son interaction et montrer à l'utilisateur l'agriculture moderne. Pour ce faire, le client a quatre grandes demandes: un coût de projet abordable, une utilisation sécuritaire, un appareil éducatif et interactif ainsi qu'une durée de vie de 10 ans.

Notre solution a été de fabriquer un panneau de contrôle semblable à ceux que l'on peut trouver dans les divers musées de la région. Une série de boutons poussoir démarrent des interactions indépendante selon le bouton pressé. À l'appui du bouton principal, un son de moteur et une courte vidéo démarrera. Complémentaire à celui-ci seront agencé 3 histoires d'agriculteurs (dans les deux langues officielles canadiennes) où ces personnes parlent de leur contact avec la machinerie. Une dernière série de bouton-pression permettent l'allumage des phares du tracteur.

Le coût de la solution retenue du prototype est d'environ 100$. C'est une solution simple qui permet de visualiser un ensemble plus grand que nature.

Les défis de la réalisation de ce projet sont de nature technique. Il faut savoir manipuler les machines de fabrication ainsi que les branchements électroniques au contrôleur.

Title: GNG1103 -A3-Inventory Management
Desc: The CEED areas need an inexpensive and effective way to manage their inventory in real time, while keeping the process simple enough to encourage participation. We will solve this problem by keeping track of a scanner to upload data to Dashboard as items are removed or added. The item quantities will automatically be updated as they are used and will be able to be tracked on Dashboard. The user will be able to easily see the quantities available, as well as see an alert when the quantity has dropped below a preset value. The only cost associated with the system is the cost of the scanner as the rest will be taken care of through Dashboard, and possibly for viewing online. A computer will be necessary to run Dashboard but the cot of a computer is not taken into account. Struggles people may have with duplicating the design are likely to be with the operation of the Dashboard interface as it is likely they have not used it before.

Title: GNG1503-FA15-Tracteur

Le Musée de l'agriculture et de l'alimentation du Canada a besoin d'augmenter la qualité de l'expérience au musée, pour ce faire, il a besoin d'un simulateur de tracteur étant sécuritaire, facile d'utilisation, durable/facile à maintenir, économique et ayant une courte durée de simulation afin de simuler un tour de tracteur .

Donc pour ce dernier, nous avons décidé de confectionner un simulateur de tracteur interactif afin que le musée puisse rendre la qualité de l'expérience encore meilleure et tout cela avec 100$ comme budget

Title: GNG2101-A8-Adaptive Communication
Desc:
A need exists to support a Tobii Dynavox I-12+ in a stable fashion on a wheelchair, bed, and hospital bed, while being accessible for our client Treena, maintaining a sleek design, and working within the constraints of cost and time.


Our solution is a robust, modular, fully adjustable segmented arm that is held in place by the weight of a bed, and maintains its orientation through the use of press-and-click locking joints. The arm features a 3D printed tablet mount at its end in which a Tobii Dynavox I-12+ easily slots into, and on the other end a flat base that uses the weight of the bed to keep the whole arm stable.


The cost of our project was roughly $120.

Important details to consider when recreating our design would be to use Adjustable Locking Technologies' Variloc Medium Duty Thermoplastic Hinges, which are a focal part of our project. In addition, the tablet mount is an important load bearing part of the arm and should be printed with a high infill to achieve the ideal strength.

Title: GNG1103 A20 Environment sensor
Desc: An environment sensor for the Brunsfeild center, using Ross Video's Dashboard as a readout of the sensors. The sensors that we will be using for the project will detect and record values for: temperature, relative humidity, carbon monoxide, and ozone. This project uses a WIFI enabled arduino along with an https:// server to collect the information for Dashboard.

Desc:

By offering three axis of rotation, Ergobrush effortlessly emulates a natural brushing experience through the execution of timed positioning sequences. Ergobrush is designed to provide independence to individuals with mobility constraints.

Title: GNG1103 - Group A9 - SD Card QR Code Scanner
Desc:
Our project creates a fast, easy, and expandable system that allows a CEED employee to easily sign out, sign in, and keep track of 3D printers and their corresponding SD Cards. In addition our system allows the easy collection of user feedback.

Our product is based off a Raspberry Pi 4 and employs the use of a RPI Camera. The camera runs custom software that allows the Pi to process and relay information read from QR codes. The QR codes are designed to be printed and attached to an SD card which corresponds to a 3D printer in the makerspace. A CEED employee will have access to both the RPI as well as a dashboard UI. The UI allows for the staff member to easily scan a QR Code, signing it out, or returning it if already signed out. The UI also displays the number of active printers, and the time in which the printer was signed out. The Pi itself also stores a log of active printers, as well as a list of all QR Codes scanned as well as the time the code was scanned in, and out. What makes our project special is the easily expandability, if the makerspace wishes to add more printers, not modification needs to be made to RPI, its software or the Dashboard UI. Simply by printing more QR codes and assigning them a unique value that corresponds to a 3D printer, the scanner will automatically sense the new QR code, and add it to the system without any user modification required.

Title: GNG1103-A19-Automated 3D Printing with OctoPi
Desc:
We want to design a system and user interface that improves the current problems with automating the use of 3D printers, while eliminating the troubles with SD cards to enhance the user and staff experience with 3D printing, organizing, time management, and ease of use.


Through the use of Ross Dashboard we have created a UI that will display the availability of printers, their status, and other key information relevant to the current print job such as time left and filament usage. With the use of OctoPrint in conjunction with HTTP GET Requests, we were able to get these values in real time. OctoPrint allows users to upload STL and g-code files to a raspberry pi connected to the printers. This will decrease wasted time in Makerspace while using 3D printers compared to the current system in place.

1 X Rasbarry Pi 3B+ ....................................................................... $55.97

1 X 16GB Micro SD ........................................................................ $9.30

1 X Printer Cable ............................................................................. $4.43

3 X Printer Cable ............................................................................ $4.60

1 X 3D Printed Case + Stand ................................................. $0

1 X Wall Plug ..................................................................................... $13.99

TOTAL ................................................................................... $101.88

Some struggles people may face in replicating this design is coding. People will have to code the GET Request accordingly for their purpose. Not only that, they will have to be comfortable in accessing the raspberry pi through ssh and being able to create multiple instances of OctoPrint on various ports of the raspberry pi's ip address. To add, people will need to know how to set a static ip address for the raspberry pi. Also, a struggle people may face is coding Ross Video Dasboard for all possible scenarios. Moreover, people will need to know how to code GCODE Scripts for OctoPrint.

Title: ROTEM 360 FB12
Desc: Les Services Alimentaires de l'université d'Ottawa ont besoin d'un robot culinaire qui permet d'exécuter des plats « casual » rapidement, de manière constante, abordable et personnalisable. Notre objectif est de construire un robot permettant de cuire, de disposer la nourriture dans une assiette et de laver. Notre équipe dispose de 100 $ afin de compléter ce projet. Le défi le plus important pour ce projet est la programmation et l'électrique, car nos connaissances dans ces domaines étaient nulles lors du début de projet.

Title: GNG1103-C15-Ingredient Distribution
Desc: Automated food distribution/ measurement system for an automated kitchen.

Title: GNG1103-F10-Fallen
Desc:
Task:

Work as a team to develop a prototype of a public sculpture for an outdoor art exhibition with an interactive human element, 80% recycled materials and a budget of $100 CAD.

Solution:

Fallen is a sculpture inspired by themes of symbiosis in nature, inverted relationships, tragedy and loss. It contains a human interactive element using an Arduino microcontroller, three ultrasonic sensors and a RGB LED strip. The final sculpture is designed to change the viewers perspectives on dichotomies in nature in addition to giving an exaggerated example of a mutation in nature that we can expect if we continue to poorly manage waste materials as a species.

Cost:

$84.00 not including the Arduino & breadboard (provided by team member)

Title: GNG1103-F7-Distorted View
Desc: Our team was tasked with creating a kinetic art installation made up of at least 80% recycled material. Our goal was to promote recycled art while also exploring the theme of time relativity. Using recycled CD's and mirrors, the sculpture catches the eye with its colorful reflections and distorted images. This effect is enhanced by a simultaneous spinning of both discs. The main reflective disc interacts with the viewers through their own distorted reflections, while the smaller disc symbolizes time and its relativity by spinning faster as people approach and slower as they move away from the sculpture.

Title: Community Shelter 2 Automation System
Desc: This is the Automation system for shed number 2 of the community shelter project for GNG1103. There were 6 subsystems as part of this project: The power supply, Doorbell, RFID lock, Fire Alarm, Lights and panic siren. Each subsystem was constructed according to the attached schematics inside of a lazer cut box and affixed in the shelter as seen fit. Wiring was then laid between the modules using quick connect connectors wherever needed to ensure modularity.

Title: GNG1103-D1 Automation
Desc: We are tasked to automate an entire house through lighting, heating, and running water.

Title: TBD
Desc: Space exploration using polyplanets

Title: Robot de cuisson- FB10
Desc:
le directeur des services alimentaires de l'université d' Ottawa a besoin d'améliorer la qualité et la rapidité de son service. Pour cela, nous avons conçu un robot de cuisson rapide, efficace, autonettoyant, et économique pour un budget de 100 $.

la difficulté majeure a été de trouver une façon de programmer l'Arduino UNO afin de commander tous les moteurs qu'on avait et `également imaginer un dispositif de nettoyage efficace.

Title: Surface Sound F4
Desc: Improvement on surface tension by adding sound which works with the different wave patterns .

Title: Engineering Design Modular Cardboard Bed 2
Desc: For this project we were asked to create a modular shelter for domestic abuse victims. Our specific task was to create a portable cardboard bed. For our final design we came up with a modular honeycomb design that is structurally sound and can fold easily.

Title: machine de cuisine FB1
Desc: appareil de cuisine capable de melanger les ingrédients et de les placer sur le plat, il respecte tous les besoin du client et ne dépasse pas le budget

Title: Tenaci Hand Grip C2A
Desc: For the full project, please go to Tenaci Hand Grip

Title: GNG1103 Solar 2
Desc: We need to come up with a solar system, which can support all the appliances, so we calculated how much energy each appliance needs and how long each of them can work to reduce the waste of energy. The cost is cheap. The water heater and air heater that we use are inexpensive and efficient. We need to be more careful with the choice of different wires and connections between all the equipment.

Title: Stimulus de Marche F2
Desc:
Un dispositif monté à la cheville du client muni d'un moteur vibrateur. Lorsqu'un signal est envoyé par une application mobile, Le moteur tourne (d'une variété de façons dicté par l'utilisateur) et cause un stimulus à la cheville.

Ce stimulus à pour but d'aider un client atteint du Parkinson à débuter un mouvement du pied. Il est possible qu'un client ait de la difficulté à initier un mouvement de marche par elle même et se frappe la cheville avec leur canne pour initier ce mouvement. Notre produit à pour but de remplacer ce coup de canne par un stimulus plus discret.

Title: GNG1503 Robot de cuisine FB4
Desc: À venir

Title: GNG1103 D1 Solar
Desc: Our project provides solar energy to a modular home that is easy to set up, transport, and deconstruct and is safe for anyone to use.

Title: GNG1503B-FB2-Robot de cuisson automatique
Desc:
un robot de cuisson sanitaire, autonome,peu couteux

budget $100

Title: GNG1503-FB5-Robot de cuisine
Desc:
Il s'agit de la conception d'un robot de cuisine autonome qui fait des plats de qualité dans un temps minimum.

Nous avons pour cela créé conçu un système de cuisson au travers d'un bras mécanique qui servira a remuer les aliments. Ensuite un système de déversement qui enverra la casserole vers l'assiette et le lieu de nettoyage.

Le cout pour ce projet est de 89$

Title: GNG1503-B0-Robot de cuisson FB6
Desc:
Nous devions faire un robot de cuisson qui pouvait adapter sa cuisson des aliments selon les saisons, l'humidité et le mode de cuisson. L'interaction humaine dans le processus doit être aussi minimale que possible. Le robot doit aussi être muni d'un système de nettoyage et d.un système pouvant transmettre la nourriture du bol de cuisson aux assiettes. Le coût total de ce robot doit être de 100$ maximum.

Notre solution est un bol de cuisson de format standard positionné sur une plaque chauffante. Ce bol est attaché à des servomoteurs faisant basculer le bol vers l'assiette. Un bras robotique mélange la nourriture et lave le bol avec un tuyau d'eau savonneuse sur son côté. Un servomoteur est aussi attaché sur le bouton rotatif de la plaque chauffante nous permettant ainsi de contrôler la température.

Le coût de ce projet est d'environ 97$.

Les défis à surmonter sont de trouver des les bons servomoteurs: ils ne sont pas faciles à trouver et toutes les forces ne sont pas tous disponibles. Les matériaux pour construire ce robot peuvent être variés: il sera difficile de trouver de bons matériaux résistants mais aussi peu coûteux.

Title: VR App Bird Simulator E1
Desc: The game revolves around the vast amount of problems radiation treatment patients endure. The game is a bird flying experience where the user is able to choose a bird and the bird flies them around two islands created by the team. The game is easy to use and does not require any training as all the user needs to do is move their head to enjoy the view of the scenery.

Title: GNG1503-FC2-Fantastic Four Pompe Arterielle
Desc:
Nous avons été chargés de la création d'un simulateur de pompe artérielle pour les analystes des taches de sang, travaillant pour notre client, le service de police d'Ottawa. Il faudrait qu'on crée un simulateur de pompe artérielle pour les analystes de taches de sang pour qu'ils puissent répliquer les pertes de sang des artères coupées.

Le but de la pompe était de reproduire les modèles de projection de sang d'une artère sectionnée.

Elle est contrôlé électroniquement en entrant des valeurs pour la pression et le rythme cardiaque souhaités sur un clavier; ces valeurs sont affichées sur un écran.

Idéalement, nous voulions construire un appareil avec un petit réservoir de sang et avec des clips de tube de différentes tailles. Les diamètres des tubes varient pour représenter différentes artères.

Lors de la création de notre pompe, nous devions prendre en compte des facteurs tels que le coût, les matériaux, le poids, la taille, la portabilité et l'efficacité.

De plus, des facteurs tels que la pression dans les vaisseaux sanguins réels, la circulation sanguine, la fréquence cardiaque et d'autres propriétés physiques des artères ont été pris en compte.

´

Title: OhmVR E2
Desc: OhmVR is a virtual reality meditation experience designed to provide relaxation and comfort to patients of all ages during both chemotherapy, and radiation treatments. The natural scenery and peaceful meditation soundtracks can be enjoyed in a variety of languages as patients receive treatment while sitting, standing or lying on their back.

Title: OculEye Access D3
Desc: Our project uses Eye Recognition Software to control the cursor on a computer and help people with disabilities communicate with others.

Title: GNG1503-B00-FB9-Robot de cuisine Automatise
Desc:
Dans les services alimentaires comme le Thai express, le délai d'attente des clients est relativement grand en raison du fait qu'il est difficile de trouver du personnel qualifié et que la formation de nouveau personnel engendre une perte de temps et d'argent. À la vue de toutes ces difficultés,

le directeur des services alimentaires de l'université d'Ottawa, Monsieur Patrick Genest, aimerait avoir un robot de cuisine automatisé qui apporterait la solution à ces problèmes puisqu'il serait divisé en trois parties; la préparation, la distribution et la cuisson. Il est de notre devoir de concevoir un robot qui prendra en charge la partie cuisson, c'est-à-dire qu'il effectuera la cuisson d'au moins deux plats principaux en un temps minimisé et de façon autonome.

Le coût de notre projet est de 150 $ CA. Ce prix est élevé, car les fournisseurs des composantes que nous avions besoins étaient les seuls à pouvoir nous fournir les pièces immédiatement.


En apparence, il parait simple de faire ce projet, mais la vérité est que la réalisation de chaque partie constituant le rebot demande de la visualisation et beaucoup de remu-méninges. La modélisation 3D est l'un des défis important à surmonter.

Au cours de l'assemblage, plusieurs problèmes survenaient au fur et à mesures. Il fallait donc trouver des solutions à chaque fois.

Title: Le Fantastic Foot F3
Desc: Ce support de pied révolutionnaire permet de corriger la position d'un pied qui tourne vers l'intérieur en le ramenant et en le gardant droit. Il est beaucoup plus confortable, beaucoup moins encombrant, plus facile à mettre et plus durable que les produits existants sur le marché, le rendant unique en son genre. Sa structure personnalisée pour chaque client le rend aussi plus efficace.

Title: GNG1503B-FB8-Robot de cuisson
Desc: Dans les restaurents alimentaires du type fast food/casual, il y a un gros manque de chefs, De plus, le service est très lents ce qui est mauvais pour les restaurents. Comme solution a ce problème, nous avons fabriqué un robot de cuisson qui va cuire des repas avec rapidité pour augmenté le service à la clientel. En plus de cuisiner rapidement, le robot va aussi distribuer la nourriture sur les assiettes des clients et se nettoyer donc il n'y aura pas besoin d'interaction humaine pour le mettre en marche. Pour ce projet nous avons eu un budjet de 100 dollars et nous avons utiliser environ 95% de cela. Notre plus gros défi a été de créer le mecanisme qui servira a transposer la nourriture sur un assiette car nous avons eu a refaire cette partie a plusieurs reprises.

Title: GNG2101-C4B-Working Summer Accessibility
Desc: Our client suffers from Cerebral Palsy which confines him to a wheelchair at all times. The client requested a mower attachment specific to his wheelchair. Additionally, the overall cost of the product must be within $ 100. Setbacks faced during the project were the material build for the frame and maneouverability.

Title: Motus- WheelChair Assist C4A
Desc:
The goal of our project is to focus on the construction of a custom wheelchair attachment.

Our client Abas is faced with cerebral palsy. He has a problem self propelling on all surfaces. In terms of mobility he is much more dominant with his right side. With our product Abas would gain independence while bound to his wheelchair.

Title: GNG1103 D1 Construction - Raise the Roof
Desc:
There is a lack of shelter space in Ottawa for women and their children. There is a need for a modular design that can be assembled without skilled tradesmen. To aid in solving this problem, a temporary housing option for one woman and any possible children is needed. This housing option should be able to accommodate the woman/family for at least one to two months. A miniature house which can be constructed and destructed easily is ideal.

GNG1103 D1 Construction group final project.

Note: Deliverable A is not required to complete the project as it was simply a team contract.

Title: GNG1103-FB11-RobotDeCuisson
Desc:
le département des services alimentaires a besoin d'un robot de cuisine sanitaire, à coût qui ne dépasse pas 100$, entièrement automatique, facile à utiliser et qui est capable de personnaliser les repas.

le coût du produit final est environ 100$.

notre solution finale consiste à utiliser un plan incliné pour minimiser l'effort requis pour verser le repas, pour ce qui est du mélange nous utilisons une louche en bois,

le système de nettoyage vas consister d'un tuyau qui va créer un jet d'eau assez fort pour la nettoyage et puis l'eau va être évacuer derrière.

Title: ROTEM 360 FB12
Desc: Les Services Alimentaires de l'université d'Ottawa ont besoin d'un robot culinaire qui permet d'exécuter des plats « casual » rapidement, de manière constante, abordable et personnalisable. Notre objectif est de construire un robot permettant de cuire, de disposer la nourriture dans une assiette et de laver. Notre équipe dispose de 100 $ afin de compléter ce projet. Le défi le plus important pour ce projet est la programmation et l'électrique, car nos connaissances dans ces domaines étaient nulles lors du début de projet.

Title: Offline Voice Remote C4C
Desc: A voice remote to replace the use of online AI homes in a hospital environment. Built for offline use with a custom AI that can be adapted for individual clients and for new command signals.

Title: GNG2501FA1Peventiondechute
Desc:
Énoncé: Concevoir un système de prévention et de détection de chute fonctionnel pour les patients qui sont à risque de chute à l'hôpital Saint-Vincent qui coûte moin de 100$, qui est fiable et durable, qui est capable d'alerter les infirmières responsable rapidement et qui est confortable et subtile.


Solution: Nous avons créer un prototype qui s'installe en dessous d'une chaise roulante et qui sert à détecter si un patient est assis ou non dans la chaise. Quand il est détecté que le patient est levé, une alarme sonne pour avertir les infirmières.


Coût: Moins de 40$


Vidéo promotionnel:

https://promo.com/share/5c8ec029e38d37196e5299ef

Title: Automation 3-GNG1103
Desc:
The Ottawa Violence Against Women Shelters require modular housing for women escaping violence.

We have created an automated system that controls lighting and cooling in the house. A door alert system will use a light and sound to indicate people approaching the door. Through an arduino we control the lighting system through a motion sensor, and the cooling system through a temperature sensor.

Title: GNG2101-C1A-Voice Remote
Desc:
Voice remote devised to being able to send commands to the TV.

The remote controller provides: the following:

-does not require internet connection

- can be trained with any sound at any level

- can control other devices connected with the TV.

Title: GNG1103F-F5-MAD
Desc: The Equilibrium art installation in STEM is currently non-functional and is not being used to its intended full potential. In order to improve the piece, the original designers wish to see an improvement in the reliability as well as the addition of user-interactive elements. The objective of this project is to improve the existing Equilibrium art installation located on a staircase in UOttawa's STEM building. As an improvement, we decided to included an auditory component to the art installation. Two speakers and three ultrasonic sensors are wired through a stair structure to an Arduino board, maintaining a similar design to the original art installation. The total cost for this project amounted to $97.

Title: GNG1103 F3 Temperature Gradient
Desc: Temperature Gradient was designed to complement the pre-exisiting Equilibrium sculpture in STEM by attracting more foot traffic to the stairs. It connects the temperature taken with the sensor to a neopixel strip underneath the overhang of the stairs. We believe that Temperature Gradient is a unique and user-friendly solution to combine Ottawa's daily fluctuating temperatures and the staircase.

Title: Automated kitchen C12
Desc: Prototype of automated dispensing device for use in a automated kitchen for UOttawa food services. Our client Patrick Genest has a need for a fast, effective and sanitary autonomous kitchen device . Our group is focused on completing the dispensing aspect of the food process.\\\\\\\

Title: GNG1103 D2 Construction
Desc: Modular Shed Construction.

Title: Acorn Light Flicker D2
Desc:
Designed to enhance your home experience and promote independence, Acorn's Light Flicker technology enables you to effortlessly control the lights in your home, with no more than a couple words.

Simple to install (just snap-on!), safe and stylish, the Light Flicker is the perfect addition to your modern home.

Title: GripMate D1
Desc: Helps improve your grip.

Title: GNG 2101-Fall Detection System C1B
Desc: The Fall Collection is a line of clothing that cleverly (and cheaply) allows for the detection of various slips, falls, and tumbles to help aid in a quick recovery: all without compromising comfort or fashion.

Title: The Portionator C2
Desc: : With automation becoming more mainstream nowadays for various reasons, University of Ottawa wanted an automatic kitchen to reduce cost and increase efficiency to give better service to students. In response to that, our group designed an automatic ingredient portioner and dispenser which not only distributes a portion of food for cooking, but also stores bulk of the ingredients in a safe environment for restaurants. We hope to improve efficiency as well as be cost effective in the long run for the owners of the restaurants and the customers who buy food here in University of Ottawa. Our bulk storage will be able to store at least 50 portions of each ingredient for the restaurant, and dispenses one portion of ingredient safely and efficiently when needed.

Title: GNG1103-F2-Infinity Mirror
Desc: An interactive infinity mirror using PIR sensors, controlled by an Arduino Uno. Our design replaces the current ultrasonic sensors while adding an intriguing component for users. The average cost to replicate the project will be approximately $100.

Title: Articulated Funnel
Desc: The goal is to create a food dispensing system to help fully automate the kitchen.

Title: Porterpal 3000 C3
Desc: Our system transports ingredients from the bulk container to the trays on the rollers which will be automatically activated via servo motors. Inside the bulk container there will be a Archimedes screw which will turn by a motor to push the ingredients out of the container. There will be chains on the side of the rollers which will have gears attached that will turn via servo motors. There will also be plastic rods attached to the chains, when the chains turn the rods will push the trays across the rollers until they reach the cooking station. Bulk containers were made by laser cutting. Rollers were made by drill press. The motors will be controlled by an arduino and the trays were made by 3D printers.

Title: GNG11032019Group7AutomaticKitchen
Desc: GNG1103_Group7_2019 Designing parts for an automated kitchen. Specifically portion control and cleaning containers that deliver food from portion control to cooking vessels.

Title: GNG1103- Solar D3 - Dream Team
Desc: Our team was asked to build a modular mounting system for a solar panel. We used sliding tracks and U brackets as a non-penetrative mounting system while making it easy to be attached and detach easily. Our project was feasible with a budget of 100$.

Title: GNG1103-D3-Cardboard Bed
Desc:
Problem Statement:

To provide the domestic violence victims in the city of Ottawa a safe place to sleep, a lightweight bed frame that can support a single 250lb person, be compacted and transported, while being made entirely out of cardboard, needs to be made.


Budget: $100.


Solution

The design of the bed frame consists of four legs that can be nested within each other. The legs have corrugated tops, on which slats of cardboard lay on. Within each individual leg, boxes are situated at the base to provide reinforcement.

Title: GNG1103-Construction3
Desc: Construction of shed.

Title: Design Day Project C5
Desc: Bulk container containing a weight powered measuring device that will release the portioned amounts of food into an ingredient box. This prototype represents an automated food distribution system that will supply cooking devices with all of the ingredients required to make delicious recipes.

Title: Useless Box
Desc: Slides used for the basic construction, used as reference in workshops

Title: GNG1503- FC04- POMPE ARTERIELLE
Desc: L'agent médico-légal de la police d'Ottawa a besoin d'une pompe artérielle à moteur, performante et facilement transportable, munie d'un circuit fermé semblable à l'appareil circulatoire, et étant capable de reconstruire des patrons sur les scènes de crime par simulation des propulsions de sang selon la pulsation (haute, basse, moyenne).

Title: GNG1103-D1-Bed
Desc: We were tasked with creating an easy-to-assemble bed made of cardboard for use in a small, modular home. The bed is designed to be inexpensive while still providing comfortability and easy assembly.

Title: New Sound
Desc: Kinetic musical spheres

Title: Lumos C2B
Desc:
For the disabled, everyday tasks like turning the lights on and off and be impossible. Tools that give them back their independence can be life changing.


That's why we created lumos: an accessibility device in the healthcare space that allows people with limited mobility to turn an existing light switch on and off wirelessly.

Title: GNG1503 CFC1 Pompe Arterielle
Desc:
Les analystes de taches de sang du service de police d'Ottawa cherchent à reproduire les patrons tracés par le sang éjecté par les artères coupées. La solution est de concevoir une pompe portative à 2 tubes de sorties alimentée par une batterie qui pourra simuler de telles pertes. Le coût total sera de 100$.


Les défis importants à considérer seront d'avoir un contrôle précis du système électrique dans le but de simuler les pressions ainsi que les battements du coeur à différentes valeurs identifiées. Il faudra également s'assurer de l'étanchéité du système. Particulièrement aux liaisons des tubes.

Title: Pompe arterielle FC5
Desc:
Photo 1 (Groupe):


(gauche à droite)

Mohamed Yassine Bouhamidi, Oueslati Ahmed, Jad Haddad, Marc-Antoine Mayer, et Mathieu Lacelle.

Nom du groupe: NoName.


Photo 2 (Prototype 1):


Durant la conception du premier prototype, notre limite ou objectif d'arrêt consiste de pouvoir tout compacter de manière sécuritaire et d'être durable dans un volume minimisé. Cela permettra au client d'opter pour le prototype le plus pratique tout en gardant le prototype le moins encombrant que possible.


Photo 3 (Prototype 2):


Le deuxième prototype consistait principalement le sous-système électronique, c'est-à-dire le le circuit électrique et les composantes Arduino. Il est important d'assurer la faisabilité de ce sous-système puisque c'est ce dernier qui permet de contrôler la pompe et de la faire fonctionner de manière désiré. C'est le sous-système le plus important de tout le produit final. Ce système affiche la pression et le rythme de la pompe. Le LCD est connecté à l'Arduino, et on peut modifier la pression et le rythme avec les deux potentiomètres, qui résultent au valeurs changeant dans l'écran LCD.


Photo 4 (Prototype 3):

Le troisième prototype et notre produit final consistait à assembler tous les sous-systèmes dont nous avons fait l"étude séparément afin d'obtenir le maximum de chaque partie.

Title: Advanced Arduino Workshop
Desc:
This workshop focuses on more advanced functionality of Arduino and understanding the use of libraries and sensors. The workshop is used to familiarize participants with the hardware available for the boards and creating software for the microcontroller boards. Participants will work through some of the example codes in order to understand basic coding, preparing you for use with the Arduino platform.

If you have not already, please make an account on Makerepo.com before coming to the workshop, and bring your student card or RFID capable card! Arduinos, breadboards provided.

We recommend that you bring your own computer, make sure you install the Arduino IDE (software), available for free here:http://arduino.cc/en/Main/Software

Title: GNG1103-1503- Soldering basics
Desc:
Learn basics of through-hole soldering by making a night-light circuit.

Apprenez les bases de soudage en faisant un circuit de lumière de nuit.

Title: boite musicale
Desc: boite qui fait de la musique

Title: Valentine LED Matrix Workshop
Desc:
This workshop requires previous experience using the following equipment: Soldering, Arduino, 3D Printing. The goal of this workshop is to code or create LED matrices using an Arduino, LED's or LED Dot Matrices. Creating an elegant and simple Valentine's day gift for a significant other or just a cool project to work on!

Note this is a TWO PART workshop which is being divided into 10 tickets for beginners and 10 tickets for more advanced users. Beginner kits only require Arduino and 3D printing knowledge. Whereas the advanced kit will require some skill in soldering.

Attending both sessions is recommended but not mandatory. The Slides as well as code has been provided here however, case knowledge is required in order to fully grasp what's going on.

Title: FA2- Simulateur de pompe arterielle
Desc: Utilisation de la pression de l'air pour éjecter un liquide plus ou moins rapidement vers d'autres tuyaux.

Title: La Cite - La periode de fete
Desc: Ceci est une représentation démontrant comment en cette période de fête les gens ornent leur maison en y implantant des sapins avec des lumières et toutes autres de sortes de décorations.

Desc: The iron man arc reactor with LED

Title: 8 x 8 x 8 LED Cube
Desc:
An 8 x 8 x 8 LED cube with programmable light show, with a desktop organizer
Un cube 8 par 8 par 8 DEL, avec un organisateur de bureau.

Desc: Learn the basics of Unity3D

Title: GNG1103-1503- Green Engineering
Desc: Learn about simple circuits and solar energy

Title: GNG1103-1503- Advanced Arduino lab-Motors
Desc:
This lab provides a brief tutorial on Arduino and motors. This lab assumes the student has a solid understanding of the basics of Arduino and builds on the content of the GNG1103-1503- Arduino lab. For this lab please download the following library:

AFMotor.h (https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit-Motor-Shield-library )

Title: GNG1103-1503 - Advanced Arduino lab - Sensors
Desc:
This lab provides a brief tutorial on Arduino sensors. This lab assumes the student has a solid understanding of the basics of Arduino and builds on the content of the GNG1103-1503- Arduino lab. For this lab please download the following library:


NewPing.h ( https://playground.arduino.cc/Code/NewPing#Download )

Title: Fall Detection System Fall 2018 GNG2101 A3
Desc:
A fall detection system designed using a Flic button and iOS app developed in Objective C. This is a user operated system in which the user presses the Flic button, that is to be on their person, to send an alert to the iOS app. Please see attached documentation for further details.


This was developed for the use of patients at St. Vincent Hospital in Ottawa. Our lead contact there was technologist, Bocar.


Attached: Final Report.pdf (including user manual) and a zip file containing source code for the iOS app

Title: GNG1503-FB7-Robot de cuisson
Desc:
Les Services alimentaires de l'Université d'Ottawa ont chargé la classe GNG1503B de concevoir un robot de cuisson autonome, abordable, auto-nettoyant, qui cuit les aliments dans un ordre particulier, à une température et une durée spécifique et précise.

En utilisant la pensée conceptuel comme méthode de conception et un budget de 100$, le groupe FB7 à concus un robot à petite échel et deux applications Java pour le contrôler.

Le robot avait des capacité de manipuler une poêle avec un bras à deux articulations, un pour déplacer la poêle vers la gauche et la droite et l'autre pour la faire versé. De plus, le robot simulait le malaxage avec un mécanisme séparé à une articulation et simulait la cuisson avec des lumières DEL sur une plaque chauffante imprimé en 3D.

Le robot était contrôlé par deux applications Java. Le premier pour charger une liste d'ingrédients avec une durée et une température de cuisson spécifique à chacun. Le deuxième une interface de commande pour le consommateur qui permet de choisire les portions voulus. Tout c'est instruction étais envoyer à un ordinateur Arduino pour activer le robot de cuisson si et seulement si un capteur de pression était activé en plaçant un bol à côté du robot.

Title: GNG2101-A5-Wheelchair Skis
Desc:
The goal of our group was to create a pair of customized skis that will allow the wheels of a regular wheelchair to traverse through the snow.

Our group's final product is a regular pair of children's skis that has a regular slit in the center of the skis and features a secure locking mechanism that locks the skis to the structure of the wheelchair. Additionally, the wheels of the wheelchair will be placed in the rectangular slit of the skis that enables a unique ability for the wheelchair to traverse through the snow and the payment.

Title: Webcessible - GNG2101 A11
Desc:
Webcessible was an attempt to build a simplified web browser that would make browsing the web easier on people with physical disabilities. Webcessible was setup in such a way to allow for a variety of inputs to suit users with varying handicaps.

Github link

https://github.com/MarcDAFrame/AccessibleBrowser

Title: GNG1503 FA10 Bloodtooth panneau d impact
Desc: Lors de ce projet, nous devions concevoir un panneau d'impact qui soit compact, pratique à utiliser et économiquement accessible dans le milieu de la formation et de l'enseignement, dans le cadre de l'étude des taches de sang sur plusieurs types de matériaux, et à plusieurs angles compris entre 0 et 90 degrés.

Title: Construction 3 Greenhouse
Desc: Construction group 3 built a simple rectangular greenhouse with a gambrel roof. The goal of the project was to answer as many of the clients specific needs as possible while staying within the budget. The attached report details the design process and demonstrates the reasoning behind the group's choices.

Title: Bowie House A12
Desc: We created a overnight storage/charging station for Bowie.

Title: GNG1103-Construction5-Greenhouse
Desc: A greenhouse is designed and built to address the problem of the client and the needs of the users. Basing from the client's specifications, the Green builders managed to make a greenhouse that could be as sustainable to the users. The team incorporated their ideas into one sustainable greenhouse with five key systems: Insulation, Ventilation, Security, Water Collection, and Electrical power. Wood framing with polyethylene sheets covered with bubble wraps was used as insulation. Holes between the roof and walls were considered as ventilation, and a hanging fan was added to help the air circulation inside the greenhouse. For security, a simple lock is attached to the doors. Gutters were attached on the roof to gather the rainwaters, and the gutters were linked to a pipe that's connected to a storage tank that's inside the greenhouse. A solar panel is put on the roof to collect sunlight and produce electricity for the hydroponics system inside. Limitations such as time and cost were kept in mind. Given the cost limit of $250 dollars, choosing of materials were done wisely. And the whole construction was done in a total of 21-28 hours.

Title: Swiss Chard Machine H5
Desc:
This project was developed for the Barriere Lake First Nations community in La Domaine, QC. This community is home to around fifty people living in a remote area that is about a 1.5 hour drive from the nearest town of Maniwaki, QC. Their location has no access to running water or electricity. The community's water source is mainly from a nearby spring. During the winter time, this community receives large amounts of snowfall and temperature can drop below -30 degrees Celsius. The community needs a way to grow their own fresh produce during the cold winter months.

The team applied the engineering design process to create a hydroponics system capable of sustaining the needs of the Barriere Lake First Nations community year round. This project was developed in tandem with a greenhouse group that were tasked with designing the greenhouse that our system was to rest in.

Title: Fogponics H3
Desc: This goal of the system is to grow fresh fruits and vegetables for a remote community in Quebec. Fogponics uses water in a vaporized form to transfer nutrients and oxygen to enclosed suspended plant roots.

Title: GNG1503PompeArterielle FA3
Desc:
Énoncé de problème:

Concevoir une pompe de simulation artérielle portable, facile d'utilisation , facile à nettoyer , pouvant répliquer le comportement du sang dans le corps humain et pouvant simuler plusieurs types de dommages aux artères.

Solution :

Notre solution est une pompe fonctionnant grâce à un piston et un système de contrôle électronique avec une Arduino. Le tuyau simulant l'artère est interchangeable et tout l'ensemble fonctionne avec 3 batteries 9v.

Coût : environ 100$

Défis importants :

Le défi le plus important lors de la réalisation est de faire fonctionner l'appareil sans fuites. Après, le système de contrôle a tendance à être un peu complexe simplement à cause des fils qui vont un peu n'importe où.

Title: GNG 1103 Fall 2018 Hydroponics 4
Desc: The following Hydroponics system was produced during the Fall 2018 semester of GNG 1103. The goal of the product was to not rely on any forms of electricity to deliver water to the plants. Instead the water was delivered with a manual method using a hand pump. The flow of the water could also be controlled by multiple sets of valves. This product was produced for the Algonquin community of the La Domaine, Quebec, Canada.

Title: Greenhouse Construction 4
Desc:
Greenhouse Construction 4


A rectangular greenhouse with the dimensions 6 ft long x 4 ft wide x 6 ft high, with a traditional triangular roof. The greenhouse was made using wood, 6 millimeter polyethylene for the walls, and corrugated plastic panels for the roof. The side walls disassemble into 3 sections and the back disassembles into 2 sections. They would connect to each other and the floor and roof using nuts and bolts. This was done to increase the portability of the greenhouse, and allow for easier transportation. Windows were added as well to allow for control of air flow in greenhouse. They were made in a way where they would swing on a dowel to open and close. As well, aluminum gutters were attached to the edges of the roof in order to collect water for the hydroponics team.

Title: Obstacle Avoidance A7
Desc: To create a versatile obstacle avoidance device that is easy to replicate and economically friendly.

Title: WaterBowie A10
Desc: Stl files for frame and pictures of completed prototype

Title: Integrated Sensors A11
Desc: Integrated sensors for the robot Bowie. Project done by Pthahnil Guo, Jose Paulo Meneses, Cisco Musetti, Nick Cheng, and Ben Paul.

Title: GNG2101-A20-WheelchairAssist
Desc: A left sided ratchet mechanism lever to aid in improving the mobility of our client. It was composed of abs piping for the lever attachment with 2 2.56 in. diameter bearings as well as a 1.25 in. spacer, an aluminum extension pole for the lever itself, a PLA printed gear axle system (as well as the pawls).

Title: Music 4 All A12
Desc:
A two part accessibility device.

CanStrum is a device that strums a guitar with a pedal for input, and CanChord is a device that makes pressing down the strings of the guitar significantly easier.

Desc:
Portable curtain for disabled at LIFE society

Title: Smart Cushion A10
Desc:
Our project for GNG2101 was to design a Smart Cushion to measure pressure differences when the user sits down on our product using Force Sensitive Resistors. We were able to interface and calibrate the sensors to work with an Elegoo UNO microcontroller and relay data to a python program.


Future Steps:

We weren't able to save the data to an array but the code is elegant enough to do so with extra effort.

Desc:
Our client would have trouble at working going from duty to duty, often spending more than the allocated time working on a duty.

Cost: $25 (Android developer membership fee *required to upload application to Google Play Store)

Note: If you download the project, in order for the emailing feature to work, you will need to setup your own Amazon AWS account and use the SES service. Once you are set up, place your API Key and Secret into the grade.properties file (in the slot that says "YourApiKey" and "YourSecretKey")

Title: Plaque essai sanguin FA4
Desc: Conception d'une plaque d'essai permettant de vérifier les formes que créent des goûtes de sang lors d'un impact sur un mur entre les angles de 0 et 90 degrées.

Title: Projection de sang avec une pompe FA9
Desc: Une pompe qui peut reproduire les patrons de projection de sang d'une artère sectionnée. Elle est contrôlée électroniquement en entrant des valeurs pour la pression et le rythme désiré sur un clavier, ces valeurs sont affichées sur un écran. Elle peut reproduire une pression entre 60 et 180 mmHg et un rythme cardiaque entre 40 et 180 battements par minute. De plus, on peut changer les diamètres des tubes pour représenter différentes artères.

Title: Panneau impact simple et abordable et facile a utiliser FA6
Desc: Notre produit est une boîte légère contenant un mécanisme manuelle simple à utiliser, durable et précis qui sert à faire monter et descendre une plaque. De plus, notre produit est muni d'un gyroscope, d'un écran et d'un arduino qui nous permet à l'utilisateur d'obtenir digitalement l'angle de la plaque à deux décimale prêts. Le tout est facile à transporter et ranger.

Title: La Maniplak FA7
Desc: La Maniplak est un panneau d'impact facile à utiliser, durable, portatif (puisqu'elle fonctionne avec des piles) et avec un affichage de l'angle automatique (fonctionnant avec Arduino). Des pieds ajustables et une bulle à niveau sont aussi installés pour permettre de mettre le panneau à niveau avec le sol. Puisqu'elle fonctionne de façon manuelle, elle peut être utilisé même sìl n'y a plus de piles. L'angle est mesurée à l'aide d'un potentiomètre, ce qui permet d'avoir une très grande précision au niveau de la mesure de l'angle.

Title: Hazmat Bowie A4
Desc: The hazmat arm modification for the Bowie robot is designed to allow an untrained operator to safely collect and dispose of hazardous waste, such as needles, without any risk of becoming injured. This is accomplished through the use of an arm replacement that features a sealed container attached to the bottom of the arm. A funneled scoop will guide any hazardous waste into the box, and once all waste has been collected, the box can be removed and disposed of.

Title: Secure Portable Storage Unit for Bowie A14
Desc:
Alternative means for environmental restoration implemented to Erin, from Robot Missions, on the existing Bowie robot during its mission will be evaluated upon its current abilities with an attachment that is lightweight, affordable, and uses materials that are environmentally friendly, to more effectively reduce the amount of litter and pollution on parks and beaches. During the Fall 2018 semester the key focus areas recommended are to prevent a large intake of sand to reduce scoop space for garbage, secure storage where Bowie can dock and recharge while not on duty, and wildlife monitoring and remote surveillance from a good quality camera, along with software.
Our design team has created a Secure Portable Storage Unit. When or if Bowie becomes a fully autonomous robot, it will need to be stored in a shelter. The shelter will protect Bowie from natural weather impacts and provide security for Bowie so there is no direct damage done by humans or animals. Considering natural weather impacts, the storage shelter will need to be durable enough to protect Bowie from wind, heavy rain, and very cold (and/or very hot) temperatures. The storage shelter will need to be big enough to hold Bowie, any non-permanent attachments, and a charging station to reach Bowie's battery. The amount of durable material will need to be determined by triple bottom line.

Title: GNG2501-FA1-Coussin intelligent
Desc:
Une entreprise innovatrice fondé par : Mark-Olivier Moreau, Vincent Lafontaine, Mathieu Perreault, Jeremie tsai


Le problème que nous devons résoudre sont les douleurs que subissent les patients de l'hopitâle Saint-Vincent lorsque ceux-ci se retrouve immobile pour de longues périodes.

Nous avons conçu un coussin intelligent qui permet de détecter les pressions et aide le personnel médical à mieux comprendre les patients pour ainsi soulager les douleurs occasioner par une position stagnante.

Notre solution innovante peut être conçu pour un montant de 97$ sans inclure la main d'oeuvre.

Les défis principaux qui surviennent lors de la production d'un coussin intelligent sont la lecture efficace des données de pression sur une longue période, ainsi qu'un affichage qui simple qui facilite l'interprétation des données.


Il est possible d'observer les fichiers de programmations pour le coussin intelligent suivant le lien suivant :

https://github.com/TsaiJ/Tapis_Int?fbclid=IwAR09i2...

Title: SpeedPlow - Winter wheelchair accessibility device B3A
Desc: About 1.85 million people in Ontario are in a wheelchair because of a disability. For most of them, the snow season prevents them from going outside, and doing physical activities can be challenging. Our design is an attachable plow that allows people in wheelchairs to easily push snow away. The device also has an easy to use lift function for avoiding obstacles and maneuvering.

Title: Fall Detection System A3
Desc: Our 1 minute pitch

Title: GNG2101-A8-Ice Cube
Desc:
Skating is great exercise and a great social activity. Disabled children want to skate with friends and family. But whereas skating aids currently on the market are designed to stabilize the skater to some degree, they do not arrest a fall and they are not designed to allow an attendant to comfortably or safely help propel or steer the device.

The main focus of our design is to assure that kids with disabilities using the device will not get hurt while skating. Therefore, our design will arrest their fall before they hit the ice and prevent any kinds of injuries. Our target specs explain that we want a small, lightweight design, but also a strong material that will be used to construct our design. The benefits will be a product that brings safety and comfort, opportunity of improve physical and mental health and promote inclusion.

Title: GNG2101-A20-Wheelchair Assist
Desc: • Our Client Abass, is disabled and can only propel himself forward using his right side. The goal of this project is to provide a cost-effective and left-sided wheelchair assist system in the form of a pushable lever that will be efficient and sufficient in further enhancing his motion.

Title: GNG 2101 The Snow Gliders Group B2B
Desc: In this project, we were tasked with developing a product that would allow our wheelchair-bound client to freely traverse the snow. Our solution is The Snow Gliders!

Title: GNG2501-FA3-Rideau intelligents

La solution consiste en un système poulies/courroies qui repose sur le bord de la fenêtre et qui ouvre et ferme les rideaux en tirant et poussant les anneaux accrochés aux rideaux.. Le système est activé par des boutons et des modules de transmission radio.

Title: GNG2101 A18 Custom Hand Sanitizer
Desc:
A custom hand sanitizer solution to fit the need of a client with accessibility issues. It utilizes a peristaltic pump to dispense sanitizing liquid with an IR sensor all connected to an Arduino Nano. A manual alternate prototype without any electronics is also provided which heavily relies on the force of gravity to function.

The files included are as follows:

  • Final report with user manual
  • 1 minute video pitch of product
  • Code used for Arduino
  • 3D STL files used for printing peristaltic pump casing
  • Demo of alternate prototype

As of March 29, 2019 our final product is complete and fully functioning with presentation on Design Day Winter 2019. There have been slight adjustments with some of the electronics and overall design.

Title: handisan B3C
Desc:
An especially handy (and inexpensive) dispenser


Google Drive project files:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1_sR2fBU4ZWO-KdJ2...


Instructions to create your own:


You will need:

Bottle of Purell to take pump from (https://www.jeancoutu.com/en/shopping/product/hand...)

Container (recommend Snaplock 500mL https://www.canadiantire.ca/en/pdp/snaplock-rectan...)

Heat shrink tubing (ideally 3/8 Inch - 3/16 Inch https://www.homedepot.ca/en/home/p.heat-shrink-tub...)

1/4 in clear cinyl tubing (https://www.homedepot.ca/en/home/p.clear-vinyl-tub...)

Handisan Button Casing (see .stl file)


Optional if desk mounted:

Clamp (recommend F-clamp https://www.canadiantire.ca/en/pdp/mastercraft-f-c...)

Rubber bands to prevent slipping


Assembly:

Print button casing

Burn or cut correct sized hole in top lid of container for pump

Press pump in place and trim lower tube on angle so that it reaches bottom of container

Cut vinyl to correct length and fit to pump using heat shrink wrap

Feed tube through the printed casing and snap top of pump to bottom of casing*


*Note, you will need to trim a small piece off the side of the pump (e.g. using side cutters) to achieve a perfect fit


Voila!

Title: Advanced Laser Cutting
Desc:
This workshop takes you beyond the basic certification class where participants will be shown how to safely use the Laser cutters located in the Makerspace. This Workshop will consist of a tutorial on how to use extensions and the colour mapping functionality.

Some skills that will be reviewed include: box making extension, living hinge extension, and colour mapping settings. It is recommended to already possess laser cutting basic skills.

Title: Laser Cutting Basics
Desc: This workshop is a certification class where participants will be shown how to safely use the Laser cutters located in the Makerspace. The Workshop will consist of a tutorial on how to use the laser cutter, along with safety measures and approved materials that can be cut. Some skills that will be reviewed include: simple vectoring and rastering concepts, as well as more complex image rastering using bitmaps. Individuals who feel comfortable can be tested following the workshop to be fully certified for using the laser cutter for personal or volunteering purposes!

Title: Fusion 360 CAD Introduction
Desc:
Have you ever wanted to learn how to use CAD software? We are offering a workshop that will cover the basics of sketch based modeling using Fusion 360. We will cover how to create sketches and then extrude them. Other topics that will be covered include the sketch dimension tool, fillets, etc. Possessing these skills can help you create more complex and intricate 3D prints and prototypes.


The Makerspace holds no affiliations with Fusion 360 software

Title: Arduino Basics
Desc: This workshop focuses on the basics of Arduino and understanding I/O control. The workshop is used to familiarize participants with the hardware available for the boards and creating software for the microcontroller boards. Participants will work through some of the example codes in order to understand basic coding, preparing you for use with the Arduino platform.

Title: 3D Printing Advanced
Desc: Learn how to cut down on print times and make full use of the variety of printers in the Makerspace; including dual extrusion for the Ulitmaker 3 and Raise 3D! In this workshop, you will learn more advanced skills in Cura to help reduce print times and provide the most optimum orientation for 3D printing. Previous experience using Cura is highly recommended.

Title: 3D Printing
Desc: In this workshop, you will learn the basics on how to design and 3D print objects. You will learn how to use basic 3D design software [TinkerCAD] to create a personalized object then followed by a step by step tutorial on how to 3D print your object on the various printers in the Makerspace. Please bring your laptops to this workshop to follow along with the activity. Internet connection required.

Title: Soldering basics
Desc: Soldering is the process of using a filler material (solder) to join pieces of metal together (wires, PCB) to from stronger connections. In this workshop participants will be shown how to properly operate the soldering iron. Taking into account safety precautions, as well as tips for making soldering easier. You will learn how to splice, solder and de-solder wires as well as gain some practice on surface mount soldering.

Title: 3D Scanning Workshop
Desc: In this workshop, you will learn how to operate the NextEngine 3D scanner located in the Makerspace. You will learn how to setup a piece for optimal scanning, as well as how to configure the software in order to achieve the best results. 3D scanners are very effective in the field of reverse engineering and can open up your design possibilities. Please note that this workshop is a demonstration as the scanner takes a fair amount of time to complete scans, therefore we will only be covering its operation.

Title: SMART Grabber
Desc:
A grabber-reacher designed for those with hand mobility issues. A touch sensor is used as user input to actuate the claw movement. Included with the project files is the required parts to 3d print, the design report, the Arduino code, and the bill of materials and their prices at the time of purchase.


If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact me at jkim308@uOttawa.ca, I'll try my best to help in any way possible

Title: Embroidery and Sewing Machine Tutorial
Desc:
In this workshop you will learn how to set up and use the Makerspace embroidery and sewing machines!

We will also show you how to make designs on the PE design X software. You can embroider either a sample fabric or a piece of clothing you bring in. All are welcome, no experience needed.

This slideshow is being provided to make the use of the machines simpler for user operation. Demonstrating how to re-thread the machine, as well as how to use the design software.

Title: Time for STEAM
Desc:
"Time for STEAM" is an interactive art project prototype showcased at uOttawa's Design Day for the 2018 Makerspace Challenge.

The concept is using recyclable materials from uOttawa's free store, some 3D printing and laser cutting to produce a clock system that keeps the time using a real-time clock. The clock, telephone dial, and cups move while the LEDs change colours as people walk by the leap motion sensor. There are also other elements representing the "A" in STEAM such as the picture frame with LEDs for visual art, the multi colour-lit keyboard for music, and a smartphone with a camera representing the viewers walking by as their pixelated forms as theater/ film art.

This piece was intended to remind viewers that art derives from technology developed over time, but technology has also grown by following the development of art.
tags: ['Other Projects', 'Internet of Things', 'Virtual Reality', 'Arduino Microcontroller', 'Laser Cutter', 'Soldering']

Title: Interactive 2d projector with Xbox kinect
Desc:
Here are the steps to make your own interactive xbox kinect projector controlled by your fingers

Materials:

- An Xbox Kinect.
- A 12v 2A power supply
- A USB cable
- Soldering iron + solder
- Projector

- PC with windows and an hdmi port


How to set up xbox 360 kinect to PC port:


1. solder usb wires to kinect wires following color coding

Red -> red

green -> green

white -> white

put black wires together

2. Solder the brown Kinect wire to the 12v adapter positive, and the 12v adapter negative to the Kinect/USB black


Set up the program to make you kinect and projector interactive:

https://code.google.com/archive/p/ubidisplays/

This site will provide all the instructions to all the drivers for PC compatibility to the kinect. Also, from there you can download the free use program that allows you to use the kinect with your projector without having to program all of this.


Lastly, once you get the program running and learn the basic functionality of it, you can calibrate it and drag any html5 file into the calibrated projector box and you should be able to physically interact with it. Keep in mind that I didn't have much time to fix and program a lot, thus there is a lot of bugs this program and the code I made.


I will provide the code I made in the Project files

Title: Interactive Nature
Desc: The project includes interacting with a laser cut peacock, using arduino, ultrasound sensor and LEDs. The proximity sensor detects the distance of the person and interacts using the LEDs accordingly. This artistic and interactive project allows the users to visualize the beauty of the peacock as they approach it.

The attached files detail the design and hardware/material requirements for the integrated bed and table, the main prototyping component of the project. Parts and assembly files are contained in the attached ZIP.

Title: Dope Hydroponics System C15
Desc: The Dope Hydroponics System, is a design for the growing futures movement, that involves students at an elementary level to understand and interact with plant growth. The system that was designed had the purpose of improving existing design features and provide a cost efficient way to potentially set up new systems for other elementary classes.

Title: GNG1103- Water group shed 3
Desc: This is the water system responsible for water collection (via rainwater harvesting) and distribution to shed 3. This projects duration was approximately 4 months. The apparatus consists of eavestroughs to collect water on either side of the angled roof, PEX pipes to guide the water down to the water tank, a water tank with a 4 layer filtration system and a automated pump that distributes water to the sink on the inside of the small home.

Title: Group C-7
Desc: Hydroponics System 2018

Title: BloCarton B6
Desc: BloCarton (aka BloCup) is an eco-friendly pedestrian blocker designed for medians. Our aim was to design a triple-bottom line business plan in response to: (social) the growing population seeking alternative income (panhandlers), (environment) increasing landfill diversion rates and increasing public understanding of compost and recycling programs here, and (economic) low cost to fabricate + prime ad space = maximize profit

Title: GNG1103 - S1 - Water
Desc: The Algonquins of Barriere lake are in need of a more sanitary and reliable source of water for everyday use. Rainwater harvesting is proven to be the most feasible and reliable source of water for the Algonquin community. Through various prototyping and testing we have developed a rainwater harvesting system that incorporates a gutter collection system, natural filtration system, storage facility and an integrated dispersion facility to accommodate for the small nature of the net-zero homes.

Title: Blackboard Hydroponics C3
Desc: Hydroponics System modeled after a rotating blackboard

Title: GNG1103 - Shed 1 - Automation
Desc:
Design Day's winning team in the Zero Carbon Footprint Shed category - Automation Team A1

Design incorporates LEDs, Raspberry P 3, terminal strips for parallel connection, solenoid push/pull, solenoid water valve, matrix keypad, buzzer, PIR sensors, relay module, ultrasonic sensors, light switches, soldering board, 3D printed light fixtures, and Python coding.

Title: GNG1103-A20-BowieAttachment

Title: GNG1103C - C6 - Hydroponics with app
Desc: Hydroponic setup with Arduino sensor+Bluetooth to app for measuring water levels.. It holds 32 plants, 80 L of water and uses 2 electrical sockets (1 for the pump, and 1 for the Arduino). Don't forget to use a voltage divider if you are going from Arduino to a regular Bluetooth.

Desc: This self-sustainable shed was built for the residents of Barriere Lake Reserve in Quebec. The project was completed throughout the semester in our class GNG1103B, Engineering Design.

Title: Net Zero Home Water Group B2
Desc: Our goal was to create the water system for a net-zero home for an indigenous community in Northern Quebec. We had to devise a system that could collect, filter, heat, and distribute water to the residents of the shed. The system had to withstand regular use as well as a Canadian winter, while staying within the budget of $100.

Title: Aquatic Seed Launcher A21
Desc:
This device is a seed launching attachment for the Bowie robot. The water-wheel fits inside the case, to make the dispenser. The dispenser fits inside the Seed Feeder.

The two holes on the Seed Feeder are sized to fit specific fan blowers: Found here.

They need to be wired to the Arduino with relay, along with the DC motor, which needs to be mounted to the knob on the water-wheel.

Finally, connect the IR receiver to the Arduino as shown in the wiring diagram.

Title: Fire Notification Network
Desc:
The Fire Notification Network or FiNN is a system of devices interconnected over WIFI that help to detect and notify hard of hearing individuals in the event of a fire incident. The two types of devices in this system are the Access point and the Client device (Pager for this project).


For more information, please see documentation and files in the zipped folder provided.

This project was created by: Philip Barry, Nduka David, Neha Pawar, Nikita Blumkin

Special thanks to Harjot Chahal .

Title: Steady Utensil
Desc: Persons suffering from neurological disorders often experience an essential tremor. Essential tremor causes uncontrolled muscle contractions, often most severe in the hands. As a result, they often have great difficulty performing tasks that members of the general public would consider quite simple like eating with a fork and spoon. The goal of this project was to produce a utensil holder which could be used by the patient to hold their utensil without causing it to shake.
